original: de ni grub pa nyid kyis zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni grub pa nyid kyis zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is destroyed by its own establishment.

original: gang yang da ltar byed pa'i don byed par nus par mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang yang da ltar byed pa'i don byed par nus par mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it seen that the present one is able to perform the function of the object that is being made,

original: de ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not established.

original: lan smras pa ni /
analyzed: lan smras pa ni /
translated: The response is:

original: ma yin spyi ni ma grub phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ma yin spyi ni ma grub phyir // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: No, because the universal is not established.

original: ma yin zhes bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: No means it is not able.

original: gang las she na /
analyzed: gang las she na /
translated: From what?

original: spyi bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: spyi bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the universal has already been established.

original: de'i sgo nas nus pa grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas nus pa grub pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that its ability is established by that.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to clarify just this, he says,

original: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If, etc.

original: gal te yang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la nus par mthong ba'i bum pa ni gsal bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa la nus par mthong ba'i bum pa ni gsal bar bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: If, moreover, the pot that is seen to be able to hold water, etc. is not able to clarify,

original: grub nas zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grub nas zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is destroyed after being established.

original: gang yang da ltar yod pa de'i don byed par nus pa ma bkag pa ni de lta na yang gsal ba thams cad la rnam pa'i sgo nas don byed par nus par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang da ltar yod pa de'i don byed par nus pa ma bkag pa ni de lta na yang gsal ba thams cad la rnam pa'i sgo nas don byed par nus par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it is not refuted that what exists now is able to perform a function, then it would be established that all manifestations are able to perform a function in terms of their aspects.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that regard,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rnam pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that regard‚Äù refers to the aspects.

original: kha cig tu de la thog ma dang ldan te ces 'dod pa de'i don ni 'di yin te /üîΩchu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa de la thog ma dang ldan pa yod de /
analyzed: kha cig tu de la thog ma dang ldan te ces 'dod pa de'i don ni 'di yin te / chu 'dzin pa la sogs pa'i nus pa de la thog ma dang ldan pa yod de /
translated: Some assert that it has a beginning. The meaning of that is this.

original: rnam pa ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rten dang shin tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang rten dang shin tu tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The capacity to apprehend water and so on has a beginning because the aspects are permanent and because they are not utterly different from the basis.

original: ji skad du /üîΩrigs la sogs pa gsal ba las //
analyzed: ji skad du / rigs la sogs pa gsal ba las //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe universal and so on are not different

original: nged la gzhan nyid du gnas min //
analyzed: nged la gzhan nyid du gnas min //
translated: from the manifestation.

original: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: 'o na 'brel ba yang rnam pa'i sgo nas thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na 'brel ba yang rnam pa'i sgo nas thog ma med pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well then, the relation would also be beginningless in terms of the aspects.

original: 'di ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni mi rigs te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: de'i phyir / khyod kyi 'brel ba thog ma can //
analyzed: de'i phyir / khyod kyi 'brel ba thog ma can //
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: Your relationship is beginningless.

original: gzhan yang gal te de'i yang ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te de'i yang ste /
translated: Moreover, if that is so,

original: sgra dang don gyis 'brel pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sgra dang don gyis 'brel pa'i phyir //
translated: because of the relationship between word and meaning,

original: rtag par khas len pa de lta na rtag pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'i phyir kho bo can gyi 'dod pa grub po //
analyzed: rtag par khas len pa de lta na rtag pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po yod pa'i phyir kho bo can gyi 'dod pa grub po //
translated: if you accept that it is permanent, then because of the existence of a thing called ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù our assertion is established.

original: skabs su bab pa'i sgra nyid ni mi 'grub po zhe na /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa'i sgra nyid ni mi 'grub po zhe na /
translated: But the word itself that is relevant is not established.

original: rnam pa gnyis mi srid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis mi srid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says: The two aspects are not possible.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni 'brel pa dang // de'i spyi'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni 'brel pa dang // de'i spyi'o //
translated: The two aspects are the relationship and its generality.

original: rnam pa gcig kho na yod kyi spyi ni ma yin te /üîΩde ni gsal @154a * //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig kho na yod kyi spyi ni ma yin te / de ni gsal @154a * //
translated: Only one aspect exists, not a generality,üîΩbecause that is the end of the many manifestations.

original: ba du ma'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dang 'brel pa yang gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba du ma'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dang 'brel pa yang gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the relationship is one.

original: ji ltar 'brel pa gcig yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa gcig yin zhe na /
translated: How is the relationship one?

original: 'brel pa nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa nus pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says: The relationship is called ‚Äúpotential,‚Äù etc.

original: nus pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nus pa las ma gtogs pa'i 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no relationship apart from potential.

original: gal te de lta yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, what follows from that?

original: 'di'i tha dad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIts difference, etc. ‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni du ma nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni du ma nyid do //
translated: Difference is multiplicity.

original: ci'i phyir mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa ni /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi mthong zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu smras pa ni /
translated: Why is it not seen? The reason is stated here:

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat, etc. ‚Äù

original: de ni rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni rtag tu 'bras bus rjes su dpag par bya ba yin te /
translated: That is always to be inferred from the effect.

original: ji skad du /üîΩdngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni //
analyzed: ji skad du / dngos po rnams kyi nus pa ni //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe potency of things

original: 'bras bu don gyis go bas bsgrub //üîΩces bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu don gyis go bas bsgrub // ces bshad pa yin no //
translated: is established by the meaning of the effect.

original: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di 'bras bu tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug ste /
translated: Therefore, this is engaged in by the effect‚Äôs difference,

original: rjes su 'brang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba bzhin no //
translated: like a follower.

original: bdag nyid la yod pa'i tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i don du 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba med par nus pa tha dad par shes par nus pa ma yin no /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yod pa'i tha dad pa shes par bya ba'i don du 'bras bu tha dad pa mthong ba med par nus pa tha dad par shes par nus pa ma yin no /
translated: In order to know the difference that exists in itself, without seeing the difference in the effect, it is not possible to know the difference in potency.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: 'dir ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni 'bras bu tha dad pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Here, the existence of the difference in the effect is not possible.

original: 'di ltar de'i 'bras bu ni rtog pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar de'i 'bras bu ni rtog pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, its effect is just the conception.

original: de yang sgra la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de yang sgra la dmigs pa'am /
translated: Moreover, is it the conception that has sound as its object or

original: don la dmigs pa yin grang /
analyzed: don la dmigs pa yin grang /
translated: is it the conception that has meaning as its object?

original: re zhig dang po na tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig dang po na tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: First, it is not different from sound,

original: sgra ni rtag tu ngo shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni rtag tu ngo shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because sound is always recognized.

original: don la dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don la dmigs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not the conception that has meaning as its object,

original: lan brgyar brjod kyang lang gi sgra la sogs pa las gzhan dang 'dra ba'i rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no //üîΩklags te bshad pa ni gzhan du mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lan brgyar brjod kyang lang gi sgra la sogs pa las gzhan dang 'dra ba'i rtogs pa skye ba ma yin no // klags te bshad pa ni gzhan du mi 'thad ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: because even if it is repeated a hundred times, the conception of a cow, for example, does not arise as something similar to the sound ‚Äúcow.‚ÄùüîΩThe explanation of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is that it is not tenable that anything else is the object of the conception of meaning.

original: don rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs la /
analyzed: don rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad pas brjod par bya ba dang rjod par byed pa'i nus pa rtogs la /
translated: Therefore, the capacity of the expressed and the expression is understood.

original: nus pa gcig nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir nus pa du ma rtogs pa don med do //
analyzed: nus pa gcig nyid kyis brjod par 'dod pa'i don grub pa'i phyir nus pa du ma rtogs pa don med do //
translated: Since the meaning that is desired to be expressed is accomplished by the capacity alone, the understanding of multiple capacities is meaningless.

original: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i nus pa tha dad pa rjes su dpag par mi nus te /
analyzed: gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i nus pa tha dad pa rjes su dpag par mi nus te /
translated: The difference in the capacity that is not tenable as anything else cannot be inferred.

original: de ni nus pa tsam nyid la mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni nus pa tsam nyid la mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is only the mere potentiality that has the power.

original: 'di las kyang 'brel pa byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di las kyang 'brel pa byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not logical to make a connection from this,

original: des na 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'brel pa rtogs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is taught that the connection is understood.üîΩIn order to demonstrate that, it is said:

original: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus su yang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa brjod pa'i dus su yang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even when the connection is stated,

original: 'di ltar 'di ni ba lang ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di ni ba lang ste /
translated: In this way, it is said, This is a cow.üîΩDo not touch it with your foot.

original: rkang pas reg par mi bya'o zhes smras pa dang / skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel ba bzung nas 'brel ba sngon @154b du 'gro ba can gyis don rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: rkang pas reg par mi bya'o zhes smras pa dang / skyes bu 'ga' zhig gis brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel ba bzung nas 'brel ba sngon @154b du 'gro ba can gyis don rtogs pa yin la /
translated: When a person has grasped the connection between the object to be expressed and the means of expression, the meaning is understood through the prior connection.

original: gzhan dag 'brel pa mi shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid shes kyi don ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'brel pa mi shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid shes kyi don ma yin no //
translated: Others who do not know the connection understand the intrinsic nature but not the meaning.

original: de la gal te 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad tha snyad la byang yang don nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te 'brel pa dngos por gyur pa ma yin na de'i tshe skyes bu thams cad tha snyad la byang yang don nges par 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, if the connection is not an entity, then even though all people are familiar with conventions, they would not apprehend the ascertained meaning.

original: gcig la yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la yod pa dang med pa phan tshun 'gal ba dag rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical for something that exists in one thing to be both present and absent, because they are mutually exclusive.

original: de lta bas na 'brel pa rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'brel pa rtag tu gnas pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the connection is always present.

original: gal te 'brel pa rtag tu gnas pa yin na /üîΩci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe thams cad la don rtogs pa mi 'gyur snyam pa'i rtsod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas rgyas par lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa rtag tu gnas pa yin na / ci'i phyir thams cad kyi tshe thams cad la don rtogs pa mi 'gyur snyam pa'i rtsod pa'i dogs pa bsu nas rgyas par lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: If the connection is always present,üîΩwhy is the object not understood at all times?

original: gal te yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to respond to this objection with an extensive answer, he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists,‚Äù and so on.

original: ma yin zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba zlog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba zlog par byed pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúNo‚Äù means that the absurd consequence is rejected.

original: ga las she na de la las ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga las she na de la las ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because the action is not grasped.

original: gal te ma bzung ba de lta na yang ci'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed /
analyzed: gal te ma bzung ba de lta na yang ci'i phyir rang gi 'bras bu skyed par mi byed /
translated: If it is not grasped, why does it not produce its own effect?

original: g-yul gyi ser ga la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu mi spong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: g-yul gyi ser ga la sogs pa'i nang du zhugs pa'i phyir sa bon la sogs pa bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu mi spong ngo zhe na /
translated: Because it is engaged in the interior of the whorls of the battle, the seed does not abandon its own effect.

original: 'brel ba rang bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'brel ba rang bdag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúThe connection is the self, etc.‚Äù

original: shes par byed pa'i chos ni gzhan yin la /
analyzed: shes par byed pa'i chos ni gzhan yin la /
translated: The phenomenon that causes knowledge is one thing,

original: skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin te /
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yang gzhan yin te /
translated: and the producer is another.

original: sgra ni du ba bzhin du don shes par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sgra ni du ba bzhin du don shes par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: Sound is like smoke in that it causes knowledge of the object,

original: sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: sa bon la sogs pa bzhin du skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: but it is not like a seed, etc., in that it produces it.

original: 'on te ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir gcig la mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag kyang ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te ji ltar yod pa dang med pa'i phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir gcig la mi rigs pa de bzhin du 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag kyang ma yin nam /
translated: But if you say that it is not possible for one thing to be both existent and nonexistent because existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, then how can it be possible for one thing to be both a grasper and a nongrasper?

original: ci ste 'di dag mi 'gal na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di dag mi 'gal na /
translated: If you say that these are not mutually exclusive,

original: de ni yod pa dang med pa dag la ci zhig sdang zhe na /
analyzed: de ni yod pa dang med pa dag la ci zhig sdang zhe na /
translated: then what is the difference between existence and nonexistence?

original: la lar don ni yod na yang //
analyzed: la lar don ni yod na yang //
translated: In some cases, the object exists,üîΩbut the cognition does not exist.üîΩIn some cases, the object does not exist,üîΩbut the cognition exists.üîΩIn some cases, both exist,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and in some cases, both do not exist.

original: chos can gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos zhan pa 'gal gyi /
analyzed: chos can gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba'i chos zhan pa 'gal gyi /
translated: The mutual exclusion of properties that are incompatible with each other is possible in relation to a single entity,

original: chos can gzhan la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can gzhan la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in relation to different entities.

original: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag kyang skyes bu tha dad pas chos can tha dad pa'i rten can yin pa'i phyir mi 'gal gyi /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag kyang skyes bu tha dad pas chos can tha dad pa'i rten can yin pa'i phyir mi 'gal gyi /
translated: and the existence and nonexistence of the object of apprehension are not mutually exclusive because they are based on different subjects, i.e., different persons.

original: yod pa dang med pa dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa dag ni ma yin te /
translated: But existence and nonexistence are not so,

original: de dag gi rten chos can gcig nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //üîΩ'on te 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang shugs kyis yod pa dang med pa dag gzhi gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba khyod la 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag gi rten chos can gcig nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to // 'on te 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs la yang shugs kyis yod pa dang med pa dag gzhi gcig la phan tshun 'gal ba khyod la 'byung bar 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: because you accept that their basis, the subject, is one and the same.

original: 'di ltar dngos po yod @155a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po yod @155a * //
translated: But in your position, that existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive, do you not also implicitly accept that existence and nonexistence are mutually exclusive in one basis?üîΩFor,

original: pa dang med pa ngag gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag la khyab ste /
analyzed: pa dang med pa ngag gis 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag la khyab ste /
translated: existence and nonexistence are pervaded by apprehension and nonapprehension,

original: de dag ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are the reasons for the latter.

original: de lta ma yin na yul rung bar mtshungs pa can gyi skyes bu gnyis gcig kho nas mthong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul rung bar mtshungs pa can gyi skyes bu gnyis gcig kho nas mthong gi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rgyu brjod par bya dgos so zhe na /
translated: Otherwise, one would have to state the reason why one of two people, who are equal in being suitable objects, sees it, while the other does not.

original: long dang ma long zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: long dang ma long zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThe blind and the non-blind . . . ‚Äù

original: dper na long ba dang cig shos dag gi drung na gnas pa'i gzugs mig ma tshang ba med pa kho nas dmigs kyi cig shos kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na long ba dang cig shos dag gi drung na gnas pa'i gzugs mig ma tshang ba med pa kho nas dmigs kyi cig shos kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: For example, a form that is present in front of a blind person and another person is observed only by the eye sense faculty of the one whose eyes are not impaired, not by the other.

original: de dag la dkar po la sogs pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: de dag la dkar po la sogs pa yod pa dang med par 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa de bzhin du 'brel pa la yang yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the form does not exist or does exist for them. The same is true of the relationship.

original: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam du rtogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'thad pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: 'di la rgyu ci zhig yod snyam du rtogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'thad pa smras pa ni /
translated: To prevent the idea that there must be a reason for this, a justification is stated:

original: mi yi nus dang nus med pa'i //
analyzed: mi yi nus dang nus med pa'i //
translated: ‚ÄúThe ability and inability of humans . . . ‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: 'di nyid 'chad de don yod pa kho na dmigs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad de don yod pa kho na dmigs pa'i rgyu ni ma yin no //
translated: This is explained: The object that exists is not the cause of observation.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is?

original: skyes bu la yod pa'i nus pa yang yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu la yod pa'i nus pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also the capacity that exists in the person.

original: des na don yod na yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na don yod na yang skyes bu 'ga' zhig la nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even if the object exists, because the capacity exists in some persons,

original: mi 'dzin pa 'gal ba med pas mi 'dzin pa la don med pas ma khyab po //
analyzed: mi 'dzin pa 'gal ba med pas mi 'dzin pa la don med pas ma khyab po //
translated: there is no contradiction in not apprehending it. Therefore, not apprehending it is not pervaded by the nonexistence of the object.

original: gal te de lta na 'brel pa yod na yang skyes bu rnams kyi nus pa dang / nus pa med pa tha dad pa'i phyir sgra las don 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na 'brel pa yod na yang skyes bu rnams kyi nus pa dang / nus pa med pa tha dad pa'i phyir sgra las don 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa dag tu 'gyur ba'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then because the capacity and the absence of capacity of persons are different even when there is a relation, there would be both apprehension and nonapprehension of the object from the word. Therefore, everything is the same.

original: 'brel pa gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'brel pa gzhan las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of another relation,‚Äù and so on.

original: don rtogs pa ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: don rtogs pa ni 'brel pa 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that the understanding of the object is preceded by the apprehension of the relation.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'brel lo //üîΩmthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang 'brel lo // mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Another‚Äù is related to ‚Äúcause.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù is related to ‚Äúthe word and the object.‚Äù

original: sgra dang don rtogs par te zhes bya ba 'di la ltos na 'di drug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra dang don rtogs par te zhes bya ba 'di la ltos na 'di drug pa yin no //
translated: ‚Äú The understanding‚Äù is related to ‚Äúthe word and the object.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú

original: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos nas lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan la ltos nas lnga pa'o //
translated: From the relation is the fifth, in dependence on another.

original: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don gyi tha snyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don gyi tha snyad pa'o //
translated: Here is the conventional usage of word and meaning.

original: gzhan dag ni mi rnams kyi nus pa dang nus pa med pa 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pas zhes bya ba 'di nyid la 'thad pa'i ngo bor smras na brjod par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mi rnams kyi nus pa dang nus pa med pa 'dir rgyu tha dad pa'i phyir 'gal ba med pas zhes bya ba 'di nyid la 'thad pa'i ngo bor smras na brjod par byed do //
translated: Others say that this very statement, because of the difference in causes of the capacity and incapacity of humans here, there is no contradiction, is reasonable.

original: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i nus pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'brel pa las zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i nus pa las zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: From the relation means from the capacity of a person.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dkar po la'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ni dkar po la'o //
translated: Here is in regard to the white.

original: dpe las byung ba'i don mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe las byung ba'i don mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to conclude the meaning that has arisen from the example,

original: de kho na bzhin zhes @155b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin zhes @155b bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says just like that, etc.

original: 'dis tha snyad du byed pas na tha snyad de sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis tha snyad du byed pas na tha snyad de sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa'o //
translated: Since this makes a convention, that convention is the relation between word and meaning.

original: de dmigs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: de dmigs pa ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The observation of that is thorough knowledge.

original: de ni dbang po dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: de ni dbang po dang mtshungs te /
translated: That is similar to the sense faculty.

original: 'di ltar gang dag la dbang po de yod pa de dag kho nas don rtogs kyi gang dag la med pa de dag ni don yod na mi dmigs so//
analyzed: 'di ltar gang dag la dbang po de yod pa de dag kho nas don rtogs kyi gang dag la med pa de dag ni don yod na mi dmigs so//
translated: In the same way, only those who have the sense faculty understand the object, but those who do not have the sense faculty do not perceive the object even though it exists.

original: de bzhin du gang dag la 'brel ba yongs su shes pa yod pa de dag sgra dang don rtogs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag la 'brel ba yongs su shes pa yod pa de dag sgra dang don rtogs kyi /
translated: In the same way, only those who have knowledge of the relationship understand the meaning from the word.

original: gang dag med pa de dag ni 'brel pa yod na yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag med pa de dag ni 'brel pa yod na yang mi dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: But those who do not have knowledge of the relationship do not understand the meaning even though the relationship exists.

original: thams cad du mtshungs so //
analyzed: thams cad du mtshungs so //
translated: The case is the same in all instances.

original: gzhan yang thog mar 'brel pa'i byed pa po gang yin pa de la su zhig gis 'brel pa bslabs zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: gzhan yang thog mar 'brel pa'i byed pa po gang yin pa de la su zhig gis 'brel pa bslabs zhes bya ba 'di yang brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: Moreover, it must be said who first taught the relationship to the one who is the creator of the relationship.

original: rang nyid kyis so zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid kyis so zhe na /
translated: If it is said that he learned it by himself,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: de kho na bzhin du gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩci ste gzhan las yin na de yang gang las yin /
analyzed: de kho na bzhin du gzhan dag la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // ci ste gzhan las yin na de yang gang las yin /
translated: Because it would follow that the same is true of others.üîΩBut if it is from another, then from what other?

original: de'i yang gzhan las yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i yang gzhan las yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is from another of that kind,

original: 'o na / de ltar na thog ma med pa'i phyir sus kyang byed pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'o na / de ltar na thog ma med pa'i phyir sus kyang byed pa ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Well then, the statement, ‚ÄúSince there is no beginning, no one makes it,‚Äù is taught.

original: mi shes pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsbyor ba ni gang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa yin pa de ni rgan po'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: mi shes pa dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te / sbyor ba ni gang sgra dang don gyi 'brel pa yin pa de ni rgan po'i tha snyad sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIgnorant people,‚Äù etc.,

original: 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i 'brel pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba'i 'brel pa bzhin no //
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is the relation between a word and its meaning has the convention of the elders as its antecedent, because it is a relation, like the relation of the present.

original: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rtsod pa'i gzhir gyur pa yang 'brel pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the basis of the dispute is a relation. This is a natural inference.

original: de ltar re zhig skyes bu so so la brda mi srid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig skyes bu so so la brda mi srid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, it has been shown that, in the first place, an individual person cannot make a convention.

original: da ni brjod pa re re la zhes smras pa gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brjod pa re re la zhes smras pa gang yin pa de bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute the statement, ‚ÄúEach utterance,‚Äù etc.,

original: brjod pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brjod pa re re zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the statement, ‚ÄúEach utterance,‚Äù etc., is made.

original: tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni tha snyad 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a convention, means because there is the use of a convention.

original: de lta ma yin na sngar brda byas pa'i phyir tha snyad 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sngar brda byas pa'i phyir tha snyad 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Otherwise, because the convention would have been previously made, it would not be made again.

original: da ni 'gro ba'i dang por zhes gang smras pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'gro ba'i dang por zhes gang smras pa de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to refute what was said, ‚Äúthe first of goers,‚Äù

original: 'byin pa'i dang po zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'byin pa'i dang po zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthe first of emitters.‚Äù

original: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don gyi 'brel pas stong ba'i 'byin pa dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i zhes bya ba ni sgra dang don gyi 'brel pas stong ba'i 'byin pa dang sdud pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: ‚Äú Such as‚Äù refers to the nature of emitters and gatherers that is empty of the connection between word and meaning.

original: 'di 'dra'i min zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'di 'dra'i min zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: ‚Äú Not such as‚Äù refers to the nature of the complete cessation of everything.

original: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no valid cognition in regard to that.

original: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten na 'jig pa gla sogs pa'i tha snyad rab tu grags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar 'jig rten na 'jig pa gla sogs pa'i tha snyad rab tu grags pa yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is the convention of destruction well known in the world, such as ‚Äúthe destruction of the wage earner‚Äù?

original: 'jig pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'jig pa chen po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe great destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyud chad pa'i bdag @156a * //
analyzed: dam pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni thams cad rgyud chad pa'i bdag @156a * //
translated: ‚Äú In the ultimate sense‚Äù refers to the nature of the complete cessation of everything.

original: nyid de / kun tu brtags pa ni mi dgag go zhes bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: nyid de / kun tu brtags pa ni mi dgag go zhes bsams pa yin no //
translated: The imagined is not negated. This is the thought.

original: shes ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyis so //
analyzed: shes ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not known‚Äù means by the world.

original: de skad ston pa ni las rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de skad ston pa ni las rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The teaching of that is ‚Äúthe actions, etc.‚Äù

original: yang ci'i phyir don dam par mi 'dod ce na thams cad zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir don dam par mi 'dod ce na thams cad zhig pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Again, why is it not accepted as ultimate? He says ‚Äúall is destroyed,‚Äù etc.

original: 'jig pa don dam pa pa yin du chug mod /
analyzed: 'jig pa don dam pa pa yin du chug mod /
translated: Even if destruction is allowed to be ultimate,

original: de ltar na yang de'i tshe dran pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i 'du byed nyams pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel ba byed par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de'i tshe dran pa dang shes rab la sogs pa'i 'du byed nyams pa'i dbang phyug la sogs pa'i byed pa po 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir 'brel ba byed par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: nevertheless, at that time, since there is no creator such as God, etc., who would impair the formative forces such as memory and wisdom, it is not logical that there be a connection. In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: gang zhig 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe connection of what with what?‚Äù

original: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni de ni rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni de ni rgyas par bkag zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not logical‚Äù because this has already been extensively refuted.

original: go rims zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed de /
analyzed: go rims zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi lan dogs par byed de /
translated: He anticipates an objection regarding the order, etc. with ‚ÄúThe order, etc.‚Äù

original: yi ge'i go rims nyid tshig tu 'dod kyi gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i go rims nyid tshig tu 'dod kyi gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The order of the syllables is accepted as the word, but not the manifestation.

original: de yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa la rag las pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid yin la /
translated: Moreover, because it depends on the desire of the person, it is impermanent.

original: de'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang mi rtag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yi ge rnams kyang mi rtag par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the letters are impermanent.

original: go rims ni yi ge dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: go rims ni yi ge dag las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order is not different from the letters.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang phyir tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir tshig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause the word is not different from the letters,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar yi ge'i bdag gi tshig nyid rjod par byed par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar yi ge'i bdag gi tshig nyid rjod par byed par 'dod do //
translated: Thus, the word itself, which is the nature of the letters, is asserted to be the expresser.

original: gang gi phyir tshig gi blo ni yi ge'i rim pas byas kyis gsal bas byas pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig gi blo ni yi ge'i rim pas byas kyis gsal bas byas pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Because the cognition of the word is produced by the order of the letters, not by the manifestation of the letters.

original: rim pa de yang skyes bus byas pa yin no //
analyzed: rim pa de yang skyes bus byas pa yin no //
translated: And that order is produced by the person.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel ba ni //
translated: He explains this:

original: khyed la yi ge kun 'gro'i phyir //
analyzed: khyed la yi ge kun 'gro'i phyir //
translated: ‚ÄúFor you, because the letters are all-pervading,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the order is not produced by the object.‚Äù

original: khyed la ste khyed cag spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na /
analyzed: khyed la ste khyed cag spyod pa pa rnams kyi ltar na /
translated: For you, that is, for you Vaise~ika,

original: yi ge de thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yi ge de thams cad du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because the letters are all-pervading,

original: rim pa yul gyis byas pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: rim pa yul gyis byas pa ma yin zhing /
translated: the order is not produced by the object.

original: dus kyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus kyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it produced by time,

original: de dag ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are permanent.

original: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam gyis byas pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam gyis byas pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is produced by the mere sound that causes manifestation,

original: de yang mi rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: and because that is impermanent,

original: des byas pa yang mi rtag pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa yang mi rtag pa nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: what is produced by it is impermanent.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig mi rtag pas byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig mi rtag pas byas pa de ni mi rtag pa yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is produced by the impermanent is impermanent,

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like a pot, etc.

original: yi ge'i rim pa yang mi rtag pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: yi ge'i rim pa yang mi rtag pas byas pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The order of the letters is produced by the impermanent. This is a natural inference.

original: gang zhig skyes bus brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis byung ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig skyes bus brjod par 'dod pa'i dbang gis byung ba de ni /
translated: Whatever occurs by the power of the desire to speak of a person

analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pas skyes bus byas @156b pa nyid du tha snyad du bya ste /
translated: is conventionally called ‚Äúproduced by a person‚Äù by those who have understanding,

original: dper na lag pa g-yo ba dang mig 'dzums pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na lag pa g-yo ba dang mig 'dzums pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the movement of the hand and the winking of the eye.

original: yi ge rnams kyi rim pa yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: yi ge rnams kyi rim pa yang skyes bu'i 'dod pas 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni rang bzhin no //
translated: The order of the letters is due to the will of man. This is the nature of the case.

original: yang ci ste rim pa med par yang yi ge rnams nyid rna bas yongs su bcad pas don rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam na /üîΩde'i phyir / rim pa med pa sngon byed pa'i //
analyzed: yang ci ste rim pa med par yang yi ge rnams nyid rna bas yongs su bcad pas don rtogs par 'gyur ro snyam na / de'i phyir / rim pa med pa sngon byed pa'i //
translated: But if the order of the letters is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then why is it that one does not understand the meaning when the letters are uttered in a different order?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the author says:üîΩThe order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning,

original: rim pa med par ni yi ge rnams don rtogs pa'i rgyur ma mthong ste /
analyzed: rim pa med par ni yi ge rnams don rtogs pa'i rgyur ma mthong ste /
translated: because the order is not seen as a cause of the understanding of the meaning when the letters are uttered in a different order.

original: de lta bas na de dag gi rim pa gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //üîΩde lta bas na spyod pa de khyed cag la rim pa nyid tshig dang brjod pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur gyi /

original: yi ge yan gar ba rnams ni ma yin te /üîΩrim pa de yang mi rtag pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa'i yang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yi ge yan gar ba rnams ni ma yin te /üîΩrim pa de yang mi rtag pa'i phyir rjod par byed pa'i yang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause of the understanding of the meaning, not the individual letters.üîΩBut if the order is not a cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the order of the letters is the cause

original: de lta yin dang sgra rtag pa nyid du brtag pa don med do //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgra rtag pa nyid du brtag pa don med do //
translated: If that were so, then the investigation of the permanence of sound would be pointless.

original: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar brjod par 'dod pa'i sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod kyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: For, one wishes to prove the permanence of sound that is the object of expression, not anything else.

original: de bas na khyed cag gi yi ge rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de skabs su mi mkho ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de bas na khyed cag gi yi ge rtag pa nyid du sgrub par byed pa gang yin pa de skabs su mi mkho ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Therefore, whatever you may adduce as a proof of the permanence of letters is completely irrelevant.

original: de ni rjod byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rjod byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not the expressors.

original: gang yang rjod par byed pa de'i rim pa'i ngo bo de ni rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rtsom pa thams cad 'bras bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang yang rjod par byed pa de'i rim pa'i ngo bo de ni rtag pa nyid du khas blangs pa'i phyir rtsom pa thams cad 'bras bu med pa yin no //
translated: And because the nature of the order of the expressors is accepted as permanent, all composition is pointless.

original: brda sprod pa gang dag gi ltar na /
analyzed: brda sprod pa gang dag gi ltar na /
translated: According to the grammarians,

original: yi ge las gsal ba'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba cha shas med pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: yi ge las gsal ba'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba cha shas med pa'i tshig ste /
translated: the so-called ‚Äúsyllable‚Äù is a partless word that is different from the letters.

original: brjod par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na yang sgra rtag pa nyid du brtags pa 'di don med pa yin te /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa de dag gi ltar na yang sgra rtag pa nyid du brtags pa 'di don med pa yin te /
translated: Even according to those who assert that, this investigation of the permanence of sound is pointless.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba'i dngos po de ni mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that thing called ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù is impermanent.

original: 'dir lan smras pa ni re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir lan smras pa ni re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Here, the response is ‚ÄúFirst of all,‚Äù and so on.

original: go rims yod pa ni go rims can /
analyzed: go rims yod pa ni go rims can /
translated: That which has order is ordered.

original: go rims can de tsam kho bo cag la 'dzin par byed pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: go rims can de tsam kho bo cag la 'dzin par byed pa nyid du thal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: That ordered sequence does not entail the fault of being grasped by us as just that,

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: because it is mistaken.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dngos po gzhan gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says ‚ÄúThe order of the basis of another thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gzhan gyi rten can zhes bya ba nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'i rten can te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan gyi rten can zhes bya ba nor bu dang mu tig la sogs pa'i rten can te /
translated: The basis of another thing is the basis of a jewel, pearl, and so on.

original: yi ge'i rten can gyi go rims nyid 'ba' zhig rjod par byed 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i rten can gyi go rims nyid 'ba' zhig rjod par byed 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: He does not wish to express just the order of the basis of a letter.

original: ji ltar zhe na de dag gi 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de dag gi 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How so? He says ‚ÄúThe order of those,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gis rjod par byed pa nyid du @157a * //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang dbang gis rjod par byed pa nyid du @157a * //
translated: The order of another thing is the order of something else, which is expressed by its own power.

original: zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: de lta ma yin na don dam par chos dang chos can tha dad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na don dam par chos dang chos can tha dad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were not so, then ultimately the property and the property-possessor would not be different.

original: de yang 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'dod pa yin no //
translated: And this is accepted.

original: 'o na ci zhig rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig rjod par byed ce na /
translated: What is it that is expressed?

original: de nas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nas de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning with ‚Äúthen, in that way‚Äù is stated.

original: de ltar ni khyad par can gyi rim pas so //
analyzed: de ltar ni khyad par can gyi rim pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù is by the order of the qualified.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /üîΩrim pa tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / rim pa tsam rjod par byed pa ma yin la /
translated: This is the teaching.üîΩIt is not just the order that is expressed,

original: yi ge'i rten tsam yang ma yin zhing /
analyzed: yi ge'i rten tsam yang ma yin zhing /
translated: nor is it just the mere support of the letters,

original: yi ge tsam yang ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge tsam yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it just the letters.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: yi ge nyid kyi rim pa dang ldan pa rjod par byed pa yin pa des na rim pa ni rjod par byed pa nyid la gtso bo yin te de dang ldan pa nyid kyis rtogs pa bzhin pa de ni sel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge nyid kyi rim pa dang ldan pa rjod par byed pa yin pa des na rim pa ni rjod par byed pa nyid la gtso bo yin te de dang ldan pa nyid kyis rtogs pa bzhin pa de ni sel ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order itself, which is endowed with the letters, is what is expressed. Therefore, the order itself is the primary means of expression, because it is just that which is endowed with the letters that is understood, since it is the eliminator.

original: 'o na gang zhe na /üîΩyi ge rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhe na / yi ge rnams yin te /
translated: What then?üîΩThe letters.

original: de dag ni chos can yin pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de dag ni chos can yin pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: They are the property-possessors, because they are understood. This has been explained.

original: mi rtag phyir zhes gtan tshigs gnyis gang smras pa de grub par ston pa ni /
analyzed: mi rtag phyir zhes gtan tshigs gnyis gang smras pa de grub par ston pa ni /
translated: The two reasons, ‚Äúbecause of impermanence‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause of the order of arising,‚Äù are established.

original: rim pa 'bras bu nyid min te //
analyzed: rim pa 'bras bu nyid min te //
translated: The order is not the effect itself.

original: zhes bya ba smos so ;üîΩ/ sngar grub yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so ; / sngar grub yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir //
translated: This is what is said.üîΩBecause of the prior establishment and the complete grasping.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi rim pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa nyid kyi rim pa nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the order of the established is appropriated.

original: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir smra ba po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify this, he says, ‚Äúthe speaker, etc.‚Äù

original: 'brel ba bzhin du rim pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba bzhin du rim pa yang thogs pa med pa yin no //
translated: Just as there is a connection, so there is an order, without obstruction.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: de lta bas na ri la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa 'di gcig gi ngo bor mi bden na yang rgan pa'i tha snyad nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na ri la sogs pa bzhin du rim pa 'di gcig gi ngo bor mi bden na yang rgan pa'i tha snyad nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du nges par bya'o //
translated: Thus, although this order is not real as the nature of one, like a mountain, etc., it should be ascertained as permanent, because of the convention of seniority.

original: de'i phyir 'dis ni rim pa'i tha snyad rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dis ni rim pa'i tha snyad rtag pa nyid du bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, by this, the convention of order is taught as permanent.

original: ri la sogs pa bzhin du gcig gi ngo bo rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ri la sogs pa bzhin du gcig gi ngo bo rtag pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like a mountain, etc., that is permanent in the nature of a single entity.

original: gal te de lta na rim pa bzhin du yi ge rnams kyi tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rim pa bzhin du yi ge rnams kyi tha snyad kyang rtag pa nyid du ci'i phyir mi 'dod ce na /
translated: If that is so, then why not accept that the conventions of the letters are permanent in sequence?

original: yi ge du mar zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yi ge du mar zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúMany letters . . .‚Äù

original: yi ge rnams rim pa bzhin du mar gnas te /
analyzed: yi ge rnams rim pa bzhin du mar gnas te /
translated: The letters exist in sequence as many.

original: rtag pa nyid yin na yang tha snyad rtag pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: rtag pa nyid yin na yang tha snyad rtag pa nyid kyis don rtogs pa'i tha snyad 'grub pa ma yin no ;
translated: Even though they are permanent, the conventions of the letters do not establish the conventions of understanding the meaning through the permanence of the letters.

original: / ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: / ji ltar mi 'grub ce na /
translated: How is it not established?

original: yi ge rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yi ge rtag par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe letters are permanent . . .‚Äù

original: yi ge gcig gi ngo bor gnas pa rtag pa nyid kyis yi ge rnams rtag par 'gyur ba de lta yin na /
analyzed: yi ge gcig gi ngo bor gnas pa rtag pa nyid kyis yi ge rnams rtag par 'gyur ba de lta yin na /
translated: If the letters were permanent in the nature of a single entity, then the letters would be permanent.

original: skyes bu brgyud pas tha snyad yod pa'i phyir rim par 'byung ste /
analyzed: skyes bu brgyud pas tha snyad yod pa'i phyir rim par 'byung ste /
translated: Since the conventions are due to a succession of persons, they occur in sequence.

original: rim pa'i bdag nyid thob par 'byung ba yin @157b te ;
analyzed: rim pa'i bdag nyid thob par 'byung ba yin @157b te ;
translated: They occur in the nature of a sequence.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa rdul phra rab kyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i bkod pa rdul phra rab kyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the arrangement of such things as a pot is due to the cause of subtle particles.

original: kha cig tu rim sogs zhes 'don pa der ni sogs pa'i sgras 'brel ba dang ngo shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: kha cig tu rim sogs zhes 'don pa der ni sogs pa'i sgras 'brel ba dang ngo shes pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: In some places, the reading is ‚Äúorder, etc.‚Äù In that case, the word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes connection, recognition, and so on.

original: ci ste rtag pa nyid med par yi ge dang rdul phra rab dag gnyi ga'i yang bkod pa ci'i phyir mi srid ce na /
analyzed: ci ste rtag pa nyid med par yi ge dang rdul phra rab dag gnyi ga'i yang bkod pa ci'i phyir mi srid ce na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúWithout permanence, how is it that the arrangement of both letters and subtle particles is impossible?‚Äù

original: de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚ÄúThat does not exist.‚Äù

original: de med ces bya ba ni yi ge dang rdul phra rab gnyi ga'i yang gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid med pa'o //
analyzed: de med ces bya ba ni yi ge dang rdul phra rab gnyi ga'i yang gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That does not exist‚Äù means that the permanence of both letters and subtle particles abiding as the nature of one does not exist.

original: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa la rtsom par byed pa'i rdul phra rab yod pa bzhin du yi ge rnams la yang cha phra mo yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bum pa la sogs pa la rtsom par byed pa'i rdul phra rab yod pa bzhin du yi ge rnams la yang cha phra mo yod pa yin te /
translated: But just as the subtle particles that are the cause of such things as a pot exist, so too the letters have subtle parts.

original: ji skad du yi ge rnams la yang yi ge'i cha bzhi pa yod de zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji skad du yi ge rnams la yang yi ge'i cha bzhi pa yod de zhes bshad pa ma yin nam /
translated: For it is explained, ‚ÄúThe letters also have four parts of letters.‚Äù

original: de ji ltar yi ge rnams gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid du rjod par byed ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yi ge rnams gcig gi rang bzhin du gnas pa'i rtag pa nyid du rjod par byed ce na /
translated: How can you say that the letters are permanent in the sense of being the same through all their manifestations?

original: nyes pa de ni med do //
analyzed: nyes pa de ni med do //
translated: There is no fault here.

original: ji ltar yi ge'i cha yod pa ma yin no zhas gsal ba bsu na phyung bar 'di bstan zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar yi ge'i cha yod pa ma yin no zhas gsal ba bsu na phyung bar 'di bstan zin to //
translated: If you ask how the letters are not present in their parts, this has been explained in the verse, ‚ÄúIf the letters are not present in each of their parts‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gal te gcig gi rang bzhin rtag pa nyid kyis yi ge rnams rtag par 'gyur na de'i tshe smra ba po thams cad la gzhan gyis rab tu dpyad pa'i sgra dag bdag gis brjod do zhes bya ba'i brjod par 'dod pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba zhig
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gcig gi rang bzhin rtag pa nyid kyis yi ge rnams rtag par 'gyur na de'i tshe smra ba po thams cad la gzhan gyis rab tu dpyad pa'i sgra dag bdag gis brjod do zhes bya ba'i brjod par 'dod pa 'dir mi 'gyur ba zhig
translated: Moreover, if the letters were permanent in the sense of being the same through all their manifestations, then when someone says, ‚ÄúI uttered the sound that you examined,‚Äù this statement would not be possible.

original: na 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: na 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: But it is possible.

original: de lta bas na yi ge rtag pa med pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bas na yi ge rtag pa med pa mi rigs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, it has been shown that it makes no sense to say that the letters are permanent.

original: gzhan gyis brjod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis brjod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúIf you say that the letters‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'on te gal te yi ge la sogs pa'i rim pa don dam par rtog pa ma yin zhing gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on te gal te yi ge la sogs pa'i rim pa don dam par rtog pa ma yin zhing gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam yang ma yin la /
translated: If the order of the letters, etc. is not imagined ultimately, and the sound that manifests them does not exist,

original: de dag skul bar byed pa'i rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par 'byed pa yang rtag pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de dag skul bar byed pa'i rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par 'byed pa yang rtag pa ma yin nam /
translated: Are not the conjunctions and disjunctions of the palate and so on that motivate them permanent?

original: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag mi nyan pa'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis mtshon par bya bar nus /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag mi nyan pa'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa po rnams kyis mtshon par bya bar nus /
translated: Therefore, how can they be indicated by those who make conventions, since they do not hear them?

original: ma mtshon na de dag gis sgra dang don gyis tha snyad so sor nges par bya ba nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mtshon na de dag gis sgra dang don gyis tha snyad so sor nges par bya ba nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: If they are not indicated, they cannot make conventions by means of the individual meanings of words,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.üîΩIf that were so, then all the faults that are stated in the context of the creator would also apply to the manifestor,

original: de lta yin dang 'brel ba byed pa nyid la skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad mngon par gsal ba'i phyir la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'brel ba byed pa nyid la skyon brjod pa gang yin pa de thams cad mngon par gsal ba'i phyir la yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: because it is similar.

original: ji ltar gang dag yi ge rnams kyi mngon par gsal bar byed cing mthong ba'i sgra tsam de dag re zhig smra ba pos skul bar nus pa ma yin @158a * //
analyzed: ji ltar gang dag yi ge rnams kyi mngon par gsal bar byed cing mthong ba'i sgra tsam de dag re zhig smra ba pos skul bar nus pa ma yin @158a * //
translated: Just as the mere sounds that manifest and are seen of the letters cannot be motivated by the speaker,

original: te ; de dag ni zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; de dag ni zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have ceased,

original: gang yang skul bar byed pa de dag ni mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang yang skul bar byed pa de dag ni mngon par gsal bar byed pa ma mthong ngo //
translated: But we do not see that which is activated as being manifest.

original: de bzhin du gang dag rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba las sgra tsam skul bar byed pa mthong ba de dag ni bya bar nus pa ma yin la gang yang gsar du byed pa de dag ni skul bar byed pa ma mthong /üîΩde lta yin dang rim gyis mngon par gsal ba'i yi ge rnams don tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di thams cad rtogs par byas nas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba las sgra tsam skul bar byed pa mthong ba de dag ni bya bar nus pa ma yin la gang yang gsar du byed pa de dag ni skul bar byed pa ma mthong / de lta yin dang rim gyis mngon par gsal ba'i yi ge rnams don tha dad pa rtogs pa'i rgyur ci ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di thams cad rtogs par byas nas lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: Similarly, we do not see that which is newly produced as being activated, but we do see that mere sound is activated from the conjunction and disjunction of the palate and so on.üîΩSince that is so, how could the syllables that are gradually manifest be the cause of understanding different meanings?

original: ji ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Having understood all of this, to respond, he says, ‚ÄúJust as a pot, etc., is understood from a collection of parts,‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rigs la brten nas tha snyad bsgrub pa de bzhin du go rims la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid yin yang tha snyad du nye bar mtshon par grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid yin na yang rigs la brten nas tha snyad bsgrub pa de bzhin du go rims la sogs pa mi rtag pa nyid yin yang tha snyad du nye bar mtshon par grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as, for example, a pot, etc., are impermanent, but the convention is established in dependence upon the type, in the same way, even though order, etc., are impermanent, the convention is established in dependence upon them.

original: ji ltar zhe na re zhig rkan la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na re zhig rkan la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: How is that? He says, ‚ÄúFirst, the types of places such as the palate,‚Äù etc.

original: ji ltar rkan la sogs pa'i gnas kyi rigs rnams ni skyes bu thams cad dang 'du ba'i rkan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar rkan la sogs pa'i gnas kyi rigs rnams ni skyes bu thams cad dang 'du ba'i rkan la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: Just as the types of places such as the palate, etc., are present in all persons because all persons have palates, etc.,

original: skyes bu thams cad la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu thams cad la rnam par gnas pa yin no //
translated: so they are present in all persons.

original: smra ba po yang rkan la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gis rkan la sogs pa'i mtshon nas te /
analyzed: smra ba po yang rkan la sogs pa'i rigs de dag gis rkan la sogs pa'i mtshon nas te /
translated: The speaker, having indicated the palate, etc., by means of those types of places such as the palate, etc.,

original: nges par bzung nas phyis sgra tsam ste /
analyzed: nges par bzung nas phyis sgra tsam ste /
translated: having ascertained them, later causes the mere sound,

original: gsal bar byed pa'i rlung rnams rjod par byed pa skul bar byed de /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i rlung rnams rjod par byed pa skul bar byed de /
translated: the wind that causes the manifestation, to be uttered.

original: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
analyzed: khyad par ma bzung bar khyad par can gyi blor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i rigs pas so //
translated: and without apprehending the particular, there is no cognition of the particular.

original: sgra tsam de dag gal te yang mi rtag pa yin pa de lta na yang ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin du ji srid du ste /
analyzed: sgra tsam de dag gal te yang mi rtag pa yin pa de lta na yang ba lang dang rta la sogs pa'i rigs bzhin du ji srid du ste /
translated: Even if those mere sounds are impermanent, they exist as a class, like the class of cows, horses, etc.

original: yi ge ji snyed pa de snyed kyi rigs yod pa yin te /
analyzed: yi ge ji snyed pa de snyed kyi rigs yod pa yin te /
translated: There are as many classes of letters as there are letters.

original: de dag nyid gsal bas grogs byas pa na sgra mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag nyid gsal bas grogs byas pa na sgra mngon par gsal ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When those very letters are assisted by the manifestor, they become the cause of the manifestation of sound.

original: yang na sgra tsam gyis gsal ba nyid rigs kyis grogs byas pa na yi ge dang rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bos gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan yin no //
analyzed: yang na sgra tsam gyis gsal ba nyid rigs kyis grogs byas pa na yi ge dang rjes su mthun pa'i ngo bos gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba ni phyogs gzhan yin no //
translated: Or, the mere sound, by the assistance of the class, becomes manifest, and operates to manifest the form that accords with the letters. This is another position.

original: 'on te gal te yang sgra tsam rnams kyis rigs tha dad pa yod pa de lta na yang sgra tsam de dag gis mtshon pa na yang rim pa med par yi ge mngon par gsal ba'i go rims bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te gal te yang sgra tsam rnams kyis rigs tha dad pa yod pa de lta na yang sgra tsam de dag gis mtshon pa na yang rim pa med par yi ge mngon par gsal ba'i go rims bsgrub par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But even if there were a difference in type due to mere sounds, still, when those mere sounds are indicated, it is not possible to establish the order of the manifestation of the letters.

original: 'di ltar de dag rigs kyi khyad par tha dad ma yin yang @158b rang las rim pa yod pa ma yin te cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag rigs kyi khyad par tha dad ma yin yang @158b rang las rim pa yod pa ma yin te cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, even though they are not different in type, they do not have order from themselves because they are partless.üîΩHow do the letters manifest order through the order of manifestation?

original: de ji ltar yi ge rnams kyis rim pa gsal bar byed pa'i rim pas byas zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la sgra tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ji ltar yi ge rnams kyis rim pa gsal bar byed pa'i rim pas byas zhes dogs pa bsu nas de la sgra tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Anticipating this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúEven if the order of mere sounds is not from themselves,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te yang sgra tsam rnams kyi go rims rang las ma yin pa de lta na yang de dag gis rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba rnams ni go rims sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang sgra tsam rnams kyi go rims rang las ma yin pa de lta na yang de dag gis rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba rnams ni go rims sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: Even if the order of mere sounds is not from themselves, still, the order is established by the order of the conjunctions and disjunctions of the palate and so on.

original: rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa la sogs pa'i rim pa dang / sgra tsam gyi rim pa gnyi ga rang gi rten la 'du ba'i rigs kyi sgo nas rtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa la sogs pa'i rim pa dang / sgra tsam gyi rim pa gnyi ga rang gi rten la 'du ba'i rigs kyi sgo nas rtags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the order of the palate and so on and the order of the mere sound are both indicated by the class of their basis, which is their collection.

original: yang ji ltar rang gis de ltar mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi yan lag tu 'gyur bas go rims mi rtag pa yin na yang rigs kyis rtag pa nyid du mtshon par nus she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rang gis de ltar mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi yan lag tu 'gyur bas go rims mi rtag pa yin na yang rigs kyis rtag pa nyid du mtshon par nus she na /
translated: Again, one might ask, ‚ÄúHow can the order of the class be indicated as permanent, even though the order of the conventional is impermanent, when one indicates it in that way?‚Äù

original: ji ltar bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar bskor ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúJust as circling and waving, etc.‚Äù

original: dper na bskor ba dang g-yabs pa la sogs pa ni gar la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: dper na bskor ba dang g-yabs pa la sogs pa ni gar la sogs pa'i bya ba'i khyad par yin te /
translated: For example, circling, waving, and so on are particular actions of dance, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras grog mo la sogs pa gzung ste ji ltar de dag gi go rims rjes su 'jug pa'i cha'i rigs la sogs pas mtshon pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag yin te /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras grog mo la sogs pa gzung ste ji ltar de dag gi go rims rjes su 'jug pa'i cha'i rigs la sogs pas mtshon pa ni tha snyad kyi yan lag yin te /
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes ants, etc. Just as the order of those is indicated by the class of the part that is engaged in following, it is a part of the conventional.

original: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras grog mo la sogs pa'i rigs bzung ngo //
analyzed: 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras grog mo la sogs pa'i rigs bzung ngo //
translated: Here, the term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the class of ants, etc.

original: de bzhin du rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyi yi ge la brten pa'i rim pa rjes su 'jug brkan  la sogs pa'i rigs kyis mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi don du byed pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyi yi ge la brten pa'i rim pa rjes su 'jug brkan  la sogs pa'i rigs kyis mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi don du byed pa yin no zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Likewise, the order of the letters based on the mere sound of the palate, etc. is indicated by the mere sound of the palate, etc. and is used as the conventional object.

original: rkan sogs sgra tsam yig rten 'gyur //
analyzed: rkan sogs sgra tsam yig rten 'gyur //
translated: The mere sound of the palate, etc. is the basis of the letters.

original: zhes bya ba ni rkan la sogs pa dang / sgra tsam yi ge zhes bya ba ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i bsdu ba yin te de la brten pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rkan la sogs pa dang / sgra tsam yi ge zhes bya ba ni tshig rnam par sbyar ba'i bsdu ba yin te de la brten pa'i phyir de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The mere sound of the palate, etc. is the basis of the letters. This is a compound in which the terms are to be resolved as ‚Äúthe mere sound of the palate, etc. is the basis of the letters.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa la sogs pa'i rim pa sgra tsam brjod pa'i rgyu dang rang gi rigs nye bar mtshon pa dang / sgra tsam gyi rim pa yang rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang dbye ba'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba can rang gi rigs nye bar mtshon pa dang yi ge mngon par gsal ba'i rim pa dang /
analyzed: 'dis ni rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa la sogs pa'i rim pa sgra tsam brjod pa'i rgyu dang rang gi rigs nye bar mtshon pa dang / sgra tsam gyi rim pa yang rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang dbye ba'i rim pa sngon du 'gro ba can rang gi rigs nye bar mtshon pa dang yi ge mngon par gsal ba'i rim pa dang /
translated: This shows that the mere sound of the palate, etc. is the cause of the order of the letters based on the palate, etc. and that the mere sound of the letters indicates their class. The order of the mere sound of the letters is preceded by the order of the possession, etc. of the palate, etc. and indicates their class and the order of the manifestation of the letters.

original: de yang don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang don rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is the reason for understanding the meaning.

original: kha cig cha zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /üîΩdper na bskor ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i yan lag rim pa dang ldan pa rigs sam de las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du rkan la sogs pa la brten pa'i rim pa @159a *
analyzed: kha cig cha zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste / dper na bskor ba la sogs pa'i bya ba'i yan lag rim pa dang ldan pa rigs sam de las gzhan pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gis nye bar mtshon pa na tha snyad kyi rgyur 'gyur ba de bzhin du rkan la sogs pa la brten pa'i rim pa @159a *
translated: Some read ‚Äúpart‚Äù in place of ‚Äúorder,‚Äù and it should be applied in this way:üîΩFor example, when the parts of an action such as circling are endowed with order, or when they are indicated by some other phenomenon, they become the cause of conventional expressions.

original: // rjes su 'jug pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag kyang yin no //üîΩkha cig tu /
analyzed: // rjes su 'jug pa'i tha snyad kyi yan lag kyang yin no // kha cig tu /
translated: In the same way, the order based on the palate, etc., is also a part of the conventional expression that is engaged in sequence.

original: rim pa rjes su dran gyur te /
analyzed: rim pa rjes su dran gyur te /
translated: Some read ‚Äúorder‚Äù in place of ‚Äúremembering.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes 'don pa der ni 'di ltar sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: In that case, it should be applied in this way:

original: ji ltar g-yabs pa la sogs pa'i cha'i rigs la sogs pa de ltar rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam yi ge la brten pa rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyis yul can rkan la sogs pa'i rigs mtshon nas rim pa rjes su dran par 'gyur ba yin no
analyzed: ji ltar g-yabs pa la sogs pa'i cha'i rigs la sogs pa de ltar rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam yi ge la brten pa rkan la sogs pa'i sgra tsam gyis yul can rkan la sogs pa'i rigs mtshon nas rim pa rjes su dran par 'gyur ba yin no
translated: Just as the type of the parts of waving and so on are indicated, so too the mere sound of palate and so on that are the basis of letters indicate the mere sound of palate and so on, and the order is recalled.

original: // yang sgra tsam rnams kyis go rims rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba'i rim pas byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: // yang sgra tsam rnams kyis go rims rkan la sogs pa'i ldan pa dang rnam par phye ba'i rim pas byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, the order of mere sounds is not made by the order of the possession and division of palate and so on.

original: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid kyis yin te /
translated: However, it is by itself.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
