analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that, it is said:

original: yang na phra phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na phra phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or because they are subtle.

original: gsal rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sgra tsam rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gsal rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni sgra tsam rnams kyi'o //
translated: The clear ones refers to mere sounds.

original: de dag gi rim pa dang ldan pa rtsom par byed pa'i cha phra mo gang dag yin pa de dag gis tha snyad grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi rim pa dang ldan pa rtsom par byed pa'i cha phra mo gang dag yin pa de dag gis tha snyad grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The subtle parts that are possessed of their order are not established by the creator.

original: de'i phyir de dag la rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi chos rtag pa nyid la sogs pa so sor nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la rigs kyi rang bzhin gyi chos rtag pa nyid la sogs pa so sor nges pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the causes of manifestation of the particular, definite, permanent, etc.

original: mngon par gsal ba gsal ba'i rgyu rnams nges par dpyad par te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba gsal ba'i rgyu rnams nges par dpyad par te /
translated: properties of the nature of the class are to be examined,

original: nges par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, they are to be ascertained.

original: de las ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What is accomplished by that?

original: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúby the power of that, etc. ‚Äù

original: khyab pa nyid yin na yang rim pa bzhin du sgra tsam gyi dbang gis yi ge rnams rim pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid yin na yang rim pa bzhin du sgra tsam gyi dbang gis yi ge rnams rim pa dang ldan pa'o snyam du snang ba yin no //
translated: Even though there is pervasion, the order of the letters is due to the order of the mere sounds.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs kyi don nyid mjug sdud par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs kyi don nyid mjug sdud par byed de /
translated: The summary of the point of the section is stated by ‚Äúthus, etc. ‚Äù

original: sgra tsam gyis yon tan ni rim pa dang gsal ba dang zhan pa dang phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam gyis yon tan ni rim pa dang gsal ba dang zhan pa dang phyogs gcig tu 'jug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The properties of mere sound are order, manifestation, weakness, application to one part, etc.

original: rtag pa nyid du rnam gnas pa //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du rnam gnas pa //
translated: ‚ÄúThe permanent abiding‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi sgo nas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi sgo nas so //
translated: is by way of the class.

original: rjes su byed pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa ni rjes su 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFollowing‚Äù is following after.

original: de ltar gal te rtag pa dang thams cad du song bdag gi phyir yi ge rnams kyi rim pa la sogs pa rang las yod pa ma yin te de skad du yang dag gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam yod pa na 'di dag yi ge la don gyi
analyzed: de ltar gal te rtag pa dang thams cad du song bdag gi phyir yi ge rnams kyi rim pa la sogs pa rang las yod pa ma yin te de skad du yang dag gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam yod pa na 'di dag yi ge la don gyi
translated: Thus, because of being permanent and all-pervading, the order of the letters and so on do not exist in themselves.

original: rtogs pa'i yan lag yin no zhes rgyas par bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yan lag yin no zhes rgyas par bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been extensively taught that when mere sound, which is the revealer, exists, these are the parts of the understanding of the meaning in the letters.

original: da ni nang na dus su gtogs pa nyid kyi sgra tsam gyi khyad par can rnam par dbye ba'i cha dag ni yi ge rnams 'dzin pa na rtog pa'i yan lag yin no zhes phyogs gzhan @159b bstan pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smos te /
analyzed: da ni nang na dus su gtogs pa nyid kyi sgra tsam gyi khyad par can rnam par dbye ba'i cha dag ni yi ge rnams 'dzin pa na rtog pa'i yan lag yin no zhes phyogs gzhan @159b bstan pa'i phyir yi ge rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to teach another position, that the letters are the parts of the understanding when they are apprehended as having the distinction of being mere sound belonging to the divisions of time, he says ‚Äúthe letters‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra tsam ste gsal bar byed pa'i rlung rnams khyad par te bye brag tu gyur pa dus rnam par dbye ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sgra tsam ste gsal bar byed pa'i rlung rnams khyad par te bye brag tu gyur pa dus rnam par dbye ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those that have the distinction, the particularities, of mere sound, the winds that reveal, in the divisions of time, are so called.

original: 'on te dus smras pa rnams kyi dus gcig dang khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te dus smras pa rnams kyi dus gcig dang khyab pa dang rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa ma yin nam /
translated: But don‚Äôt you assert that time is one, pervasive, and permanent, as the Vai≈õe·π£ikas do?

original: ji skad du /üîΩbya ba las ni tha dad pa'i //üîΩbya ba dang ldan pa yi chad //üîΩrtag pa gcig tu khyab pa'i rdzas //
analyzed: ji skad du / bya ba las ni tha dad pa'i // bya ba dang ldan pa yi chad // rtag pa gcig tu khyab pa'i rdzas //
translated: As it is said:üîΩSome say that time is a substance

original: dus su kha cig rjod par byed //
analyzed: dus su kha cig rjod par byed //
translated: that is permanent, one, and pervasive,

original: ces bshad pa bzhin te /
analyzed: ces bshad pa bzhin te /
translated: and is different from activityüîΩand is endowed with activity.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par dbye bar rigs she na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar rnam par dbye bar rigs she na /
translated: Therefore, how can it be logically analyzed?

original: dus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dus kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúTime is also like this,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par dag pa yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in ‚Äúpure also‚Äù is in a different order.

original: gcig na yang khyab na yang zhes bya ba 'dir sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: gcig na yang khyab na yang zhes bya ba 'dir sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: It should be connected here as ‚Äúeven if it is one, even if it is pervasive.‚Äù

original: ji ltar rnam par phye ba yin zhe na /üîΩdngos po kun la yi ge bzhin //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par phye ba yin zhe na / dngos po kun la yi ge bzhin //
translated: How is it analyzed?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúLike all things, like letters.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is what is taught:

original: dper na ga la sogs pa'i yi ge rtag pa gcig bu yin yang gang gi tshe sgra tsam gyi khyad par 'ba' zhig gis yul 'ba' zhig tu gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe yul la sogs pa rnam par phye nas rnam par dbye ba rtogs par 'gyur la
analyzed: dper na ga la sogs pa'i yi ge rtag pa gcig bu yin yang gang gi tshe sgra tsam gyi khyad par 'ba' zhig gis yul 'ba' zhig tu gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe yul la sogs pa rnam par phye nas rnam par dbye ba rtogs par 'gyur la
translated: For example, a single permanent letter such as ‚Äúga‚Äù is manifested in a particular place by the mere difference of sound, and at that time, having distinguished the place, etc., the distinction is understood.

original: dus kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: dus kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Time is also like that.

original: gal te yang 'di dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis dngos po 'ga' zhig la gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe rnam par dbye ba 'dzin pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te yang 'di dngos po thams cad la khyab pa yin pa de lta na yang gang gi tshe byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig gis dngos po 'ga' zhig la gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe rnam par dbye ba 'dzin pa yin la /
translated: Even if it pervades all things, when it manifests a certain thing by some particular action, at that time it apprehends the distinction.

original: gang gi tshe yi ge rnams la gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe don rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe yi ge rnams la gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe don rtogs pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: When it manifests the letters, at that time it becomes a factor in understanding the meaning.

original: 'o na gal te rnam par phye ba yin na de ji ltar rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid rtogs she na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rnam par phye ba yin na de ji ltar rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid rtogs she na /
translated: If it is distinguished, how is its permanence and pervasiveness understood?

original: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan dag la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúin others, etc.‚Äù

original: lcug ma dang me tog la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod pa'i phyir yod pa bzhin du de rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du 'grub ste /
analyzed: lcug ma dang me tog la sogs pa gzhan dag la yang yod pa'i phyir yod pa bzhin du de rtag pa dang khyab pa nyid du 'grub ste /
translated: because it exists in other things, such as twigs and flowers.

original: rtag pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: rtag pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is used to illustrate.

original: de'i phyir tshig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi phyogs grub par mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang gi phyogs grub par mjug sdud par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the words ‚Äúbecause of the words‚Äù and so on conclude the establishment of our own position.

original: 'di 'dra 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni go rims la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o //üîΩ'o na gal te go rims ni dus kyi chos sam /
analyzed: 'di 'dra 'ga' yang zhes bya ba ni go rims la sogs pa'i ngo bo'o // 'o na gal te go rims ni dus kyi chos sam /
translated: ‚Äú Nothing like this‚Äù refers to the nature of order and so on.

original: gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam gyi chos yin gyi don dam par yi ge'i chos ni ma yin na de ji ltar 'di rtogs pa'i yan lag nyid yin te /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa'i sgra tsam gyi chos yin gyi don dam par yi ge'i chos ni ma yin na de ji ltar 'di rtogs pa'i yan lag nyid yin te /
translated: If order is a property of time or a property of the mere words that express it, but not a property of the syllables in the ultimate sense, then how can it be a part of the understanding of that?

original: @160a * // gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyir gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: @160a * // gzhan gyi chos ni gzhan gyir gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: For the property of one thing cannot be the property of another.

original: gzhan gyi chos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chos kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To respond, he says, ‚ÄúThe property of one thing . . .‚Äù

original: brjod ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: brjod ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú Is expressed‚Äù means

original: grur zhugs pa yang 'gro ba ni //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa yang 'gro ba ni //
translated: . . . even when one is in a boat, one moves.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: grur zhugs pa'i tshig ni bzhon pa la zhon pa thams cad mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: grur zhugs pa'i tshig ni bzhon pa la zhon pa thams cad mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The words ‚Äúembarked in a boat‚Äù illustrate all those who are mounted on a vehicle.

original: rta yi shugs la sogs pa bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni dper na rta la sogs pa la yod pa'i shugs de la zhon pa'i skyes bu yul gzhan du phyin pa dang shing ljon pa la sogs pa 'gro bar shes pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du sgra tsam la yod pa'i go rims
analyzed: rta yi shugs la sogs pa bzhin // zhes bya ba ni dper na rta la sogs pa la yod pa'i shugs de la zhon pa'i skyes bu yul gzhan du phyin pa dang shing ljon pa la sogs pa 'gro bar shes pa'i yan lag tu 'gyur ba de bzhin du sgra tsam la yod pa'i go rims
translated: Like the speed of a horse, and so on.

original: kyang yi ge don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: kyang yi ge don rtogs par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Just as the speed that exists in a horse, and so on, is the limb of the man mounted on it that goes to another place, and the limb of the tree, and so on, that is known to move, in just the same way, the order that exists in mere sound is the limb of the syllable that causes the understanding of the meaning.

original: de ltar rgyas par sgra mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba la don gyis go ba'i tshad mas gnod pa nyid du bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar rgyas par sgra mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' ba la don gyis go ba'i tshad mas gnod pa nyid du bsgrubs nas mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having proven in detail that the proposition that sound is impermanent is undermined by the valid cognition of implication, in order to conclude, he says,

original: thams cad rtag pa nyid la ni //
analyzed: thams cad rtag pa nyid la ni //
translated: In all permanence,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir mjug sdud par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir mjug sdud par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äútherefore‚Äù here should be seen as a conclusion.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni don rtogs pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas yi ge rtag pa nyid du grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni don rtogs pa bzhin du mi 'thad pas yi ge rtag pa nyid du grub pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad /
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù means that it is not tenable that the meaning is understood as it is, so it is not only established that the letter is permanent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rkan la sogs pa dang sgra tsam la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: rkan la sogs pa dang sgra tsam la sogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the palate, etc., nor is it mere sound, etc.

original: ji skad du bshad pa las brjod pa tsam nyid na 'jig pa na khyad la gzhan gyi sgra gzhan gyis don rtogs par mi nus te /
analyzed: ji skad du bshad pa las brjod pa tsam nyid na 'jig pa na khyad la gzhan gyi sgra gzhan gyis don rtogs par mi nus te /
translated: As it was explained, when mere expression is destroyed, one cannot understand the meaning through another sound.

original: des na gzhan gyi don brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi don brjod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of another is not expressed.

original: 'on te mi 'jig na de'i phyir sngar mang du dmigs pas don rtogs so zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on te mi 'jig na de'i phyir sngar mang du dmigs pas don rtogs so zhes bya bar rigs pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: But if it is not destroyed, then it is reasonable to say that the meaning is understood through the many previous observations.

original: dam bca' ba la rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang / lung dang / grags pas gnod pa yang bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba la rang gi tshig dang khas blangs pa dang / lung dang / grags pas gnod pa yang bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the thesis is undermined by one‚Äôs own words, by what is accepted, by scripture, and by what is commonly acknowledged,

original: rang gi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
analyzed: rang gi tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúone‚Äôs own words,‚Äù and so on, in detail.

original: sogs pa'i sgras khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras khas blangs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include contradiction of what is accepted, and so on.

original: bstan zin te zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel ba ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bstan zin te zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel ba ma mthong ba'o //
translated: The phrase already explained means that no connection with the meaning is seen.

original: sgra ni rjod byed du mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: sgra ni rjod byed du mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Sound is not a means of expression and so on.

original: des na don rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pa ste don shes pas thob pa ste grub ni don rtogs thob pa //
analyzed: des na don rtogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni don rtogs pa ste don shes pas thob pa ste grub ni don rtogs thob pa //
translated: Therefore, having attained the understanding of the meaning means that having attained the understanding of the meaning, having obtained the knowledge of the meaning, one has attained the understanding of the meaning.

original: don rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad par grub pas rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don rtogs pa gzhan du mi 'thad par grub pas rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it is established that the understanding of the meaning is not tenable in another way, it is permanent. This is what it means to say because it is permanent.

original: khas blangs pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: khas blangs pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The refutation by what is accepted is stated:

original: don gyi rjod byed nus pa ni //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gyi rjod byed nus pa ni // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ability to express the meaning and so on.

original: @160b sgrub pa na zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa brjod pa zhes bya ba shugs kyis thob ste de lta ma yin na gzhan la bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @160b sgrub pa na zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa brjod pa zhes bya ba shugs kyis thob ste de lta ma yin na gzhan la bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase when proving means when stating a proof. This is implicitly understood. Otherwise, it would not be possible to prove to others.

original: lung gis gnod pa smras pa /
analyzed: lung gis gnod pa smras pa /
translated: The refutation by scripture is stated:

original: bstan bcos so so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bstan bcos so so zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The treatises are different and so on.

original: sgra rnams kyis don rtogs pa'i nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi dam bca' ba la gnod pa'i phyir zhes kha bskang ngo //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis don rtogs pa'i nus pa gang dag yin pa de dag gi dam bca' ba la gnod pa'i phyir zhes kha bskang ngo //
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it contradicts the thesis of those who have the ability to understand the meaning of words‚Äù should be supplied here.

original: grags pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: grags pas gnod pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The contradiction by what is commonly acknowledged is explainedüîΩin the following:

original: sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reasonings explained earlier . . .‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa ni de ma thag tu bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o /
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i rigs pa ni de ma thag tu bshad pa'i tshigs su bcad pa'o /
translated: The reasonings explained earlier are the verses just explained.

original: 'di ltar gnod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod par bya ste /
translated: The contradiction is as follows:üîΩThose who have the ability to understand

original: 'jig rten kun gyis nges bzung ba'i /üîΩdon rtogs pa yis nus rnams kyis //üîΩrgol ba kun gyi 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun gyis nges bzung ba'i / don rtogs pa yis nus rnams kyis // rgol ba kun gyi 'jig rten gyi //
translated: the meaning ascertained by everyone in the worldüîΩcontradict the world‚Äôs acknowledgment

original: grags pas 'jig pa la gnod do //üîΩzhes bya ba yin no //üîΩrjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pas 'jig pa la gnod do // zhes bya ba yin no // rjes su dpag pa la sogs pa dang 'gal ba sngar bshad pa dran par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: of the refutation of all arguments.üîΩThe following is stated to remind one of the contradictions with inference and so on, which were explained earlier:

original: sngar bshad gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sngar bshad gtan tshigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reasonings explained earlier . . . ‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa gtan tshigs ni yul dang dus sogs tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa gtan tshigs ni yul dang dus sogs tha dad pa'o //
translated: The reasonings explained earlier are the different times and places.

original: ba lang sgra yis gsal ba'i blo //
analyzed: ba lang sgra yis gsal ba'i blo //
translated: The cognition that is manifested by the word cow

original: thams cad mtshungs pa'i yul can nam //
analyzed: thams cad mtshungs pa'i yul can nam //
translated: Or, all are subjects of the same object,

original: sna tshogs don gyi yul can yin //
analyzed: sna tshogs don gyi yul can yin //
translated: Or, the object is a variety of meanings.

original: ba lang snyam du skyes pa'i phyir //
analyzed: ba lang snyam du skyes pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it arises as the thought of a cow,

original: de ltar skyes pa'i blo bzhin na //
analyzed: de ltar skyes pa'i blo bzhin na //
translated: Just like the cognition that arises in that way.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshogs kyi dang / gzhan yang rna ba las byung ba'i //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshogs kyi dang / gzhan yang rna ba las byung ba'i //
translated: And also, from the Ear-production:üîΩBy recognition, sound is permanent,

original: ngo shes pa yis sgra rtag dang // khyab pa nyid du gnas na de //
analyzed: ngo shes pa yis sgra rtag dang // khyab pa nyid du gnas na de //
translated: And if it abides as all-pervading,

original: phyin ci log tu su zhig nges //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu su zhig nges //
translated: Who would be certain about its error?

original: zhes bya ba 'dis so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis so //
translated: Thus it is.

original: lhag ma phyogs kyi skyon dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'ga' zhig bstan par 'dod nas de 'jig pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhag ma phyogs kyi skyon dang gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'ga' zhig bstan par 'dod nas de 'jig pa nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Desiring to teach some faults of the position and faults of the reason, he says ‚ÄúIf it is destroyed‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas 'chad de /
analyzed: sgra la 'jug pa'i rnam par rtog pa grub pa'i mtha' tha dad pas 'chad de /
translated: The conceptual thought that engages sound is explained by different tenets.

original: de grangs can rnams kyis sgra dang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yon tan gsum du 'dod do //
analyzed: de grangs can rnams kyis sgra dang rdul dang mun pa dang snying stobs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir yon tan gsum du 'dod do //
translated: The Enumerators assert that sound is the three qualities because it is the nature of sound, darkness, and courage.

original: nam mkha'i gos can dag gis ni gang zag ste /
analyzed: nam mkha'i gos can dag gis ni gang zag ste /
translated: The Sky-clad ones assert it is the person.

original: gang zag ni rdul phra rab tsam las brjod de /
analyzed: gang zag ni rdul phra rab tsam las brjod de /
translated: The person is said to be the size of a minute particle.

original: de dag gi 'di ni gang zag can te /
analyzed: de dag gi 'di ni gang zag can te /
translated: The person is the possessor of this,

original: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgzegs zan pa dag gis ni /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzegs zan pa dag gis ni /
translated: which is to say, it is the self of that.

original: nam mkha'i yon tan du 'dod do //üîΩ'jig rten pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: nam mkha'i yon tan du 'dod do // 'jig rten pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: The KƒÅ≈õmƒ´ri VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas assert that it is a quality of space.

original: yi ge las tha dad pa'i sgra tsam gyi bdag nyid du ste /
analyzed: yi ge las tha dad pa'i sgra tsam gyi bdag nyid du ste /
translated: Worldly beings assert that it is the nature of mere sound that is different from letters.üîΩAs it says in the Explanation of the Difficult Points of the ‚ÄúDrop of the Great Seal‚Äù:

original: ji skad du snyim par lhung gi bshad pa las yang na 'jig rten na tshig gi don rtogs pa'i sgra tsam ni sgra yin no zhes bshad pa yin bzhin no //
analyzed: ji skad du snyim par lhung gi bshad pa las yang na 'jig rten na tshig gi don rtogs pa'i sgra tsam ni sgra yin no zhes bshad pa yin bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúOr, in the world, mere sound that is the object of the word is sound.‚Äù

original: slob byed pa rnams kyis ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i rlung gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: slob byed pa rnams kyis ni rjod par byed pa ma yin pa'i rlung gi ngo bo ste /
translated: The ≈öabdavidyƒÅ philosophers assert that it is the nature of wind that is not an expression.

original: ji skad du rlung ni sgrar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩbrda sprod pa rnams kyis ni tshigs gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam ngag gsal @161a * //
analyzed: ji skad du rlung ni sgrar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // brda sprod pa rnams kyis ni tshigs gsal ba'i bdag nyid dam ngag gsal @161a * //
translated: As it says, ‚ÄúWind becomes sound.‚Äù

original: ba'i bdag nyid 'dod do //
analyzed: ba'i bdag nyid 'dod do //
translated: The grammarians assert that it is the nature of the clear articulation of words or the clear articulation of speech.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it says:

original: mtha' yi sgra dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: mtha' yi sgra dang lhan cig tu //
translated: Together with the sound of the end of a word,

original: sgra tsam gyis bskos sa bon gyis //üîΩyongs su smin par 'gyur ba yi //
analyzed: sgra tsam gyis bskos sa bon gyis // yongs su smin par 'gyur ba yi //
translated: by mere sound.üîΩThe sound is definitely grasped

original: blo la sgra ni nges par gzung //üîΩzhes bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩ'bigs byed na gnas pa ni /
analyzed: blo la sgra ni nges par gzung // zhes bshad pa lta bu'o // 'bigs byed na gnas pa ni /
translated: in the mind.

original: 'dra ba ste mtshungs par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dra ba ste mtshungs par 'dod do //
translated: The DƒÅr·π£·π≠ƒÅntikas say that it is similar, that is, equal.

original: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni gzhan la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni gzhan la ltos pa ste /
translated: The Buddhists say that it depends on another,

original: gzhan sel ba zhes brjod par byed pa gang 'dod pa de la /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba zhes brjod par byed pa gang 'dod pa de la /
translated: that is, it is called an exclusion of another.

original: gal te grangs can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i sgra de dag mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
analyzed: gal te grangs can la sogs pas 'dod pa'i sgra de dag mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
translated: If the sound that is asserted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya and so on is established as impermanent, then it is the fault of the thesis that is established.üîΩThis is because it is stated:

original: rang gi ngo bor bstan bya ba //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor bstan bya ba //
translated: That which is to be shown as its own nature

original: zhes bya ba 'dis grub pa ngo bor bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis grub pa ngo bor bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By this, the established nature is refuted.

original: spyod pa ba rnams kyis 'di 'dra ba'i sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: spyod pa ba rnams kyis 'di 'dra ba'i sgra rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The Carakas do not assert that such a sound is established as permanent.

original: gzhan yang kho bo cag la yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgra chos can ma grub pa'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi skyon yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang kho bo cag la yon tan gsum la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi khyad par gyi sgra chos can ma grub pa'i phyir khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyi phyogs kyi skyon yin no //
translated: Moreover, for us, the term ‚Äúdistinction‚Äù in the statement ‚Äúthe distinction of the nature of the three qualities, etc., is not established‚Äù is not established as the subject, and so the fault is that the distinction is not established.

original: gtan tshigs kyang gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang gzhi ma grub pa'i skyon yin te /
translated: The reason is also faulty in that its basis is not established.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i chos can ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a subject of that kind is not established.

original: ci ste zhes bya ba ni ci ste 'dod chags dpyod pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i gal sogs pa'i yi ge nyid sgra yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste zhes bya ba ni ci ste 'dod chags dpyod pa rnams kyis mngon par 'dod pa'i gal sogs pa'i yi ge nyid sgra yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs 'dir 'gyur na /
translated: If, in this position, you assert that sound is the very letters such as ga, etc., that are accepted by those who analyze sound, and that it is not different from them,

original: de lta yin na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyi dam bca' ba'i skyon dang gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'di gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa la khyad par ma grub pa nyid kyi dam bca' ba'i skyon dang gzhi ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon 'di gnyis 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then, in that case, the fault of the thesis is that the distinction is not established for the Buddhist, and the fault of the reason is that its basis is not established.

original: ci ste sgra tsam brjod gyur na ste /
analyzed: ci ste sgra tsam brjod gyur na ste /
translated: If it is said that sound is merely the expression,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can nyid du zhes bya ba lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe subject that is to be established‚Äù is the remainder.

original: de lta yin dang sgra nyid kyi spyi khyed cag gis sgra nyid te khyad la mi rtag nyid de thob po zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sgra nyid kyi spyi khyed cag gis sgra nyid te khyad la mi rtag nyid de thob po zhes khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: If that were the case, then you would be forced to admit that the universal ‚Äúsound‚Äù is impermanent, because the particular sound is impermanent.

original: 'di ltar tsam gyi sgras khyad par thams cad dor bar byas na spyi las gzhan pa'i sgra tsam gzhan ci zhig tu 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ltar tsam gyi sgras khyad par thams cad dor bar byas na spyi las gzhan pa'i sgra tsam gzhan ci zhig tu 'gyur /
translated: If the word ‚Äúmere‚Äù excludes all particulars, then what other ‚Äúmere sound‚Äù is there that is different from the universal?

original: de lta bas na shugs kyis khyed cag gis sgra nyid mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na shugs kyis khyed cag gis sgra nyid mi rtag pa nyid du dam bca' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, you would be forced to admit that sound itself is impermanent.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ce na ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ce na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that this is the case, then we reply: No.

original: de yang thams cad rtag par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang thams cad rtag par 'dod // ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because they assert that all universals are permanent.üîΩThis is what is meant by the passage that begins with the words ‚ÄúBecause they assert that all universals are permanent.‚Äù

original: de skad du yang gzhan sel bar smra ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis kyang rigs kyi chos gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhan sel bar smra ba sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis kyang rigs kyi chos gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: The Buddhist who advocates apoha explains that this is so because the property of the universal remains the same.

original: 'dis ni khas blangs pas gnod pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni khas blangs pas gnod pa bshad do //
translated: This shows that the opponent‚Äôs position is undermined by his own beliefs.

original: de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, ≈öƒÅntarak·π£ita says:

original: gang cung zad grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brel nas spyi rnam par 'jog pa de thams cad ni rgol ba thams cad kyi brtag par 'dod do //
analyzed: gang cung zad grub pa'i mtha'i rjes su 'brel nas spyi rnam par 'jog pa de thams cad ni rgol ba thams cad kyi brtag par 'dod do //
translated: Whatever is posited as a universal in connection with a philosophical tenet is asserted by all disputants to be a conceptual imputation.

original: de lta ma yin na gsal ba bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan skye bas gsal @161b ba gzhan la ma khyab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gsal ba bzhin du gzhan dang gzhan skye bas gsal @161b ba gzhan la ma khyab pa'i phyir /
translated: Otherwise, like the particulars, it would not pervade other particulars because it would arise from other causes.

original: de'i spyi'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i spyi'i rang bzhin nyid nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore its nature as a universal would be undermined.

original: de ltar re zhig bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi rnam par rtog pas phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig bsgrub bya'i chos can gyi rnam par rtog pas phyogs kyi nyes pa bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having demonstrated the fault of the subject in terms of the conceptualization of the probandum,

original: da ni bsgrub bya'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas bstan par 'dod nas gal te gtan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni bsgrub bya'i chos kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas bstan par 'dod nas gal te gtan nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: now, wishing to demonstrate the fault in terms of the conceptualization of the probandum, he says ‚ÄúIf it is a non-pervading‚Ä¶‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te gtan nas rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig pa nyid gang yin pa de mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la khyad par ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
analyzed: gal te gtan nas rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid 'jig pa nyid gang yin pa de mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe kho bo cag la khyad par ma grub pa'i phyogs kyi skyon yin te /
translated: If it is a non-pervading impermanence that is the characteristic of destruction, and you assert that it is the probandum, then we would have the fault of an unestablished subject.

original: 'di ltar dpyod pa pa rnams ni ser skya ba dag bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa nyid kyi khyad par ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dpyod pa pa rnams ni ser skya ba dag bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa nyid kyi khyad par ma grub pa ste /
translated: Thus, the Analysts, like the Followers of Kapila, do not establish the difference of destruction without recourse to something else.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams zhig na yang nus pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams zhig na yang nus pa'i ngo bos gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, even when such things as pots are destroyed, their capacity remains.

original: sgron ma la sogs pa yang de'i tshe cha shas phra mo rnams yul gzhan du phra zhing phra ba 'gro'o zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgron ma la sogs pa yang de'i tshe cha shas phra mo rnams yul gzhan du phra zhing phra ba 'gro'o zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they assert that such things as lamps, at that time, go to another place in a subtle and subtle way.

original: ci ste ji zhig ltar mi rtag par bstan pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin la /
analyzed: ci ste ji zhig ltar mi rtag par bstan pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pa de'i tshe grub pa la sgrub pa'i skyon yin la /
translated: But if they wish to prove that it is impermanent in some way, then that is the fault of proving what is already established.

original: de bzhin du rtag pa rnams la yang mngon par gsal ba dang mngon par mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs la brten nas spyi rtag pa nyid du brtan par 'dod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtag pa rnams la yang mngon par gsal ba dang mngon par mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs la brten nas spyi rtag pa nyid du brtan par 'dod pa kho na'o //
translated: And in the same way, the Followers of Kapila assert that the permanent universals are stable, in dependence on the states of manifestation and nonmanifestation.

original: de ltar re zhig sgra mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dam bca' ba ni rgyas par sun phyung nas de ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig sgra mi rtag pa yin no zhes bya ba'i dam bca' ba ni rgyas par sun phyung nas de ni dbang pos gzung bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having extensively refuted the thesis ‚ÄúSound is impermanent,‚Äù in order to demonstrate the fault in the reason ‚Äúbecause it is apprehended by the sense faculties,‚Äù

original: dbang po 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dbang po 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it is said that only the sense faculty . . .‚Äù

original: dbang pos gzung ba 'ba' zhig ni 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: dbang pos gzung ba 'ba' zhig ni 'bras bu yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni khyad par dang bral ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly the sense faculty is the apprehender of the effect‚Äù and so on are devoid of a distinguishing feature.

original: khyad par med pa de gtan tshigs yin na sngar bsgrub pa'i rigs de phyis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur te ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa de gtan tshigs yin na sngar bsgrub pa'i rigs de phyis gtan tshigs ma nges par 'gyur te ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that which is devoid of a distinguishing feature is the reason, then the type of proof that was previously established would later become an uncertain reason because the reverse is not established.

original: gal te phyir rgol bas rigs khas blangs pa'i phyir ldog pa ma grub pa de lta na yang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas rigs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te phyir rgol bas rigs khas blangs pa'i phyir ldog pa ma grub pa de lta na yang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pas rigs khas ma blangs pa'i phyir /
translated: If the opponent accepts the reason, then the reverse is not established. Even so, because the Buddhist and so on do not accept the reason,

original: grub pa nyid yin te de'i phyir ji ltar ma nges pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: grub pa nyid yin te de'i phyir ji ltar ma nges pa yin zhe na /
translated: it is established. Therefore how could it be uncertain?

original: dper na phyir rgol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dper na phyir rgol zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: For example, it is like the opponent, etc.

original: gnyi ga la nges pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid sgrub par dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so //
analyzed: gnyi ga la nges pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid sgrub par dang sun 'byin pa yin no zhes bya ba'i rigs pa las so //
translated: That which is ascertained for both is the proof and the refutation.

original: ji ltar phyogs kyi chos gang yang rung ba la ma grub na gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur ba de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa na skyon can nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar phyogs kyi chos gang yang rung ba la ma grub na gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur ba de bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag kyang gang yang rung ba la ma grub pa na skyon can nyid yin no //
translated: Just as when the property of the position is not established, the reason is faulty, in the same way, when either the forward or reverse pervasion is not established, it is faulty.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub na yang zhes tshig rnam par bsgyur la gnyis kyi tshig sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩde ltar na gal te gnyi ga la grub pa gang @162a * //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag ma grub na yang zhes tshig rnam par bsgyur la gnyis kyi tshig sbyar bar bya'o // de ltar na gal te gnyi ga la grub pa gang @162a * //
translated: When neither the forward nor reverse pervasion is established, the reason is faulty.

original: yin pa de nyid sgrub pa sun 'byin pa yin na de ji ltar sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa'i rigs kyis 'khrul par brjod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yin pa de nyid sgrub pa sun 'byin pa yin na de ji ltar sangs rgyas pa la ma grub pa'i rigs kyis 'khrul par brjod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Thus, if that which is established for both is the proof and the refutation, then how can the Buddhist say that the reason is mistaken because it is not established for the opponent?

original: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te yang sgrub par byed pa smra ba sangs rgyas pa la rigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du ma grub pa de lta na yang dogs pa mi ldog ste /
analyzed: gal te yang sgrub par byed pa smra ba sangs rgyas pa la rigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du ma grub pa de lta na yang dogs pa mi ldog ste /
translated: Even if the proponent of the proof does not establish the property of the subject, still the doubt is not removed.

original: de dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dgag par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not possible to refute that.

original: de lta yin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then there would be doubt about the reversal of the discordant side.

original: gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gi rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa ni dbang pos gzung bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa dag gi rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi sun 'byin pa ni dbang pos gzung bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, the other party‚Äôs refutation of the conception of the probandum and the proof is stated with ‚ÄúThe object of the sense faculties, etc.‚Äù

original: stsogs pa'i sgras mi rtag pa nyid gzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras mi rtag pa nyid gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes impermanence.

original: de la dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa ci'i bdag nyid yin zhes dpyad par bya ste /üîΩspyi gsal ba las tha dad pa yin nam /
analyzed: de la dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid la sogs pa ci'i bdag nyid yin zhes dpyad par bya ste / spyi gsal ba las tha dad pa yin nam /
translated: There, one should analyze what kind of nature the object of the sense faculties, etc., has.üîΩIs it different from the manifestation of the universal?

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin grang /
translated: Or is it not different?

original: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gsal bar byed de /üîΩci de tha dad na yang gong bu so so la tha dad pa'am ;
analyzed: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa gsal bar byed de / ci de tha dad na yang gong bu so so la tha dad pa'am ;
translated: In the case of the nondifferent position, the difference and nondifference are clarified.üîΩIf it is different, is it different from the individual wholes?

original: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: Or is it nondifferent?

original: gcig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la dbang pos gzung bar bya ba nyid kyi gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: In the case of the nondifferent position, the reason of being apprehended by the sense faculties is not shared.

original: gsal ba la tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba la tha mi dad pa'i phyir de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo bzhin du de gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not different from the manifestation, therefore, like its own nature, it does not pervade other manifestations.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs la yang dpyod pa tha dad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs la yang dpyod pa tha dad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: In the case of the different position, because it is not accepted that the analysis is different,

original: gsal ba re re dang tha dad pa'am /
analyzed: gsal ba re re dang tha dad pa'am /
translated: it is not established that it is different from each individual manifestation,

original: tha mi dad pa ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub po //
translated: or that it is nondifferent. Therefore the reason is not established.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs kyi skyon ma brjod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i phyogs kyi skyon ma brjod de /
translated: For that very reason, the fault of the different and nondifferent positions is not stated.

original: tha dad du grub pa na de'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad du grub pa na de'i go skabs yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they were established as different, then there would be an opportunity for that.

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyang tha dad pa'i phyogs la mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyang tha dad pa'i phyogs la mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub bya dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Impermanence also is devoid of the probandum in the similar instance of a different position.

original: dpe bsgrub byas stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub byas stong ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The example is empty of the probandum‚Äîthat is the meaning.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la yang dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid yin te /
translated: In the case of a nondifferent position, the example is incomplete.

original: gsang ba gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ba gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the hidden is not concomitant with the other.

original: da ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid 'chad pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: da ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid 'chad pa ni brtsal ma thag tu byung zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Now, in order to explain that the reason ‚Äúbecause it arises immediately after being sought‚Äù is uncertain, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is observed immediately after being sought,‚Äù and so on.

original: brtsal ba'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du brjod la /
analyzed: brtsal ba'i mjug thogs su dmigs pa nyid ni brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid du brjod la /
translated: The mere observation immediately after the conclusion of seeking is called ‚Äúarising immediately after being sought.‚Äù

original: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pas byas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang 'jug pa'i phyir ma nges pas byas pa dang mi rtag pa nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not definite that the reason applies to the dissimilar class, the reason does not prove that it is produced or impermanent.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang nam mkha' zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas gsum po dngos po skad @162b cig las tha dad pa ma byas pa dang rtag par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang nam mkha' zhes bya ba 'dus ma byas gsum po dngos po skad @162b cig las tha dad pa ma byas pa dang rtag par 'dod de /
translated: Thus, Buddhists assert that the three unconditioned things called cessation through critical discernment, space, and nonanalytical cessation are things that are not different from moment-to-moment impermanence and are permanent.

original: de la gtan tshigs 'di 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir blo sngon 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs 'di 'jug go zhes bstan pa'i phyir blo sngon 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause the intellect precedes‚Äù is stated to show that this reason applies to them.

original: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi blo sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtag pa'i 'gog pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi blo sngon du 'gro ba'i 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni so sor brtag pa'i 'gog pa'o //
translated: The destruction of a pot and so on that is preceded by the intellect is cessation through critical discernment.

original: gang yang blo sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung lugs yin par grag go //
analyzed: gang yang blo sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa de ni so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba 'di ni sangs rgyas pa'i gzhung lugs yin par grag go //
translated: That which is not preceded by the intellect is nonanalytical cessation. This is the Buddhist position.

original: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag gi zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the pot, etc.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag go //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags pa dang so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúTwo‚Äù refers to the cessation of discrimination and the cessation of non-discrimination.

original: ma byas par yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra las rtag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ma byas par yang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra las rtag pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúNot made‚Äù and also ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù is supplied by the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'di dag gi ma byas pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dag dang / yang ji ltar de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa de ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di dag gi ma byas pa nyid dang / rtag pa nyid dag dang / yang ji ltar de la gtan tshigs 'jug pa de ltar gzhan gyi lugs kyis bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: How are they not made and permanent? And how does the reason apply to them? In order to prove that in accordance with the opponent‚Äôs system,

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says ‚Äúthose,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni sangs rgyas rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the Buddhas.

original: 'on te mes bud shing dang dbyig pas bum pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu dag mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te mes bud shing dang dbyig pas bum pa zhes bya ba'i 'jig pa'i rgyu dag mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But aren‚Äôt the causes of destruction of the pot, etc., seen, such as fire for fuel and a hammer for a pot?

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rgyu med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rgyu med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how can they be causeless?

original: me dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: me dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúfire,‚Äù etc.

original: de la me la sogs pa ni sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang gis nges kyi 'jig pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de la me la sogs pa ni sol ba la sogs pa'i dngos po gzhan gyi rgyu nyid du rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dang gis nges kyi 'jig pa'i ni ma yin te /
translated: In that regard, fire, etc. are ascertained by positive and negative concomitance to be the cause of other things, such as charcoal, etc., but not of destruction.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is established by intrinsic nature.

original: 'o na gal te rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin na ci'i phyir me la sogs pa dang phrad pa las sngar yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa yin na ci'i phyir me la sogs pa dang phrad pa las sngar yang dmigs par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Now, if it is intrinsically perishable, why does it not previously become manifest through contact with fire, etc.?

original: 'dra ba'i rgyun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dra ba'i rgyun ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe continuum of a similar type,‚Äù etc.

original: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa'i zhan pa rnams kyis mi nges la /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan dang gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa'i zhan pa rnams kyis mi nges la /
translated: The weak-minded are deceived by the occurrence of other similar things and do not ascertain it.

original: rgyun mi 'dra bar 'byung bas ni nges pa yin no //üîΩmi mthun pa'i rgyu ni tho ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'dra bar 'byung bas ni nges pa yin no // mi mthun pa'i rgyu ni tho ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: But they do ascertain it through the occurrence of a dissimilar continuum.üîΩA dissimilar cause is a hammer, etc.

original: mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni gyo mo la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni gyo mo la sogs pa'o //
translated: A dissimilar effect is a shard, etc.

original: gnas skabs 'dir 'jig par rigs pa nyid du gsal bar 'gyur ro lo //
analyzed: gnas skabs 'dir 'jig par rigs pa nyid du gsal bar 'gyur ro lo //
translated: It is reasonable that it is destroyed in this state.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: The conclusion is stated by ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: mi 'dra ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent continuum‚Äù means dissimilar.

original: rgyu gang las zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu gang las zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what cause‚Äù means the common locus.

original: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyus so //
analyzed: de nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rgyus so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that very thing‚Äù means by the cause.

original: gang las zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba phyi ma dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba bstan par bya ba gang yin pa de ni mngon par gsal ba zhes bya ba phyi ma dang 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what‚Äù is what is to be indicated. That is connected with the following, ‚Äúis clearly manifest.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the reason, the engagement with the discordant class,

original: gang phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'gog pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the two kinds of cessation.

original: tho ba brdegs pa la sogs pa rtsol ba'i mjug thogs su shes pa dmigs pa ni tho ba @163a * //
analyzed: tho ba brdegs pa la sogs pa rtsol ba'i mjug thogs su shes pa dmigs pa ni tho ba @163a * //
translated: The cognition that is observed immediately after the exertion of striking with a hammer, etc.,

original: brdegs pa la sogs pa'i brtsal ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brdegs pa la sogs pa'i brtsal ma thag tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: is called ‚Äúarisen immediately after the exertion of striking with a hammer, etc.‚ÄùüîΩHaving taught the error of the two,

original: gsum gyis zhes smras pa de la gnyis kyis 'khrul pa bstan nas /
analyzed: gsum gyis zhes smras pa de la gnyis kyis 'khrul pa bstan nas /
translated: with respect to what was said about the three,

original: gsum pa nam mkhas kyang 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsum pa nam mkhas kyang 'khrul par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The third, in order to demonstrate that space is also erroneous,

original: nam mkha' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: nam mkha' yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: says, ‚ÄúSpace is also . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de brtsal ba yis zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa de rko ba la sogs pa byed par gyur bas brtsal ba yis so //
analyzed: de brtsal ba yis zhes bya ba ni sa la sogs pa de rko ba la sogs pa byed par gyur bas brtsal ba yis so //
translated: ‚Äú By searching for it‚Äù means by digging up the earth and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni sgra la'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù refers to the sound.

original: mthong ba ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Seeing‚Äù is the consciousness that arises immediately after the search.

original: de ltar gtan tshigs skyon brjod nas //
analyzed: de ltar gtan tshigs skyon brjod nas //
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the reason,

original: dpe'i skyon brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: dpe'i skyon brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: in order to state the faults of the example,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe similar class . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs ni dpe ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs ni dpe ste /
translated: The similar class is the example.

original: de ci thos pa'i don yin par 'dod dam /
analyzed: de ci thos pa'i don yin par 'dod dam /
translated: Is it the meaning of what is heard?

original: 'on te gsal ba yin grang /
analyzed: 'on te gsal ba yin grang /
translated: Or is it a manifestation?

original: gal te thos pa'i don yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba'i dpe'i nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te thos pa'i don yin pa de'i tshe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba'i dpe'i nyes pa yin te /
translated: If it is the meaning of what is heard, then the example is faulty in that the probandum is not complete.

original: 'di ltar thos pa ni sgra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar thos pa ni sgra'o //
translated: In this way, what is heard is sound.

original: de'i don ni brjod bya ste /
analyzed: de'i don ni brjod bya ste /
translated: Its meaning is the expressed meaning.

original: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i yin la /
analyzed: de yang bum pa la sogs pa'i spyi'i yin la /
translated: Moreover, it is the universal of a pot and so on.

original: de yang rgol ba thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang rgol ba thams cad mi rtag pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir /
translated: For all disputants assert that sound is impermanent.

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid kyi bsgrub par bya ba'i chos rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, impermanence is not a property that pervades the thesis.

original: kha cig tu rigs kyi don la zhes 'don pa der ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba bya ste /
analyzed: kha cig tu rigs kyi don la zhes 'don pa der ni las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba bya ste /
translated: In some editions, the meaning of the word type is taken to be the same as the word class.

original: don ni 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: don ni 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: The meaning is the same.

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe yang dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i gsal ba de'i rigs las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin par brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe yang dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i gsal ba de'i rigs las gzhan nam gzhan ma yin par brtag par bya ste /
translated: If the second position is correct, then the type of the manifest that is asserted as the example should be investigated to determine whether it is different or not different from the type.

original: ci gsal ba de rigs las gzhan yin nam /
analyzed: ci gsal ba de rigs las gzhan yin nam /
translated: Is the manifest different from the type?

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin /
translated: Or is it not different?

original: gal te gzhan yin pa de'i tshe dpyod pa la dpe'i chos can ma grub ste /
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin pa de'i tshe dpyod pa la dpe'i chos can ma grub ste /
translated: If it is different, then the property of the example is not established for the proponent of analysis,

original: dpyod pa ba ni bye brag ba la sogs pa bzhin du mtha' gcig tu rigs gsal ba las nged la gzhan du mi 'dod de /
analyzed: dpyod pa ba ni bye brag ba la sogs pa bzhin du mtha' gcig tu rigs gsal ba las nged la gzhan du mi 'dod de /
translated: because the proponent of analysis does not assert that the manifest is different from the type, like the Vai≈õe·π£ika and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba las /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa gsal ba las /
translated: The manifest is not different from the type and so on.

original: nged la gzhan nyid gnas pa med //
analyzed: nged la gzhan nyid gnas pa med //
translated: For us, difference does not exist.

original: ces gnas pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ces gnas pa lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, it is like the example.

original: 'on te gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe gzhan sangs rgyas pa la dpe'i chos can ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan ma yin pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i tshe gzhan sangs rgyas pa la dpe'i chos can ma grub ste /
translated: But if the position is that it is not different, then for the other Buddhist, the exemplification of the property is not established.

original: gzhan gyis gsal ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i rigs mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyis gsal ba las gzhan ma yin pa'i rigs mi 'dod do //
translated: For, the other does not accept that the type is not different from the manifestation.

original: ci ste tha dad pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas bum pa dpe nyid du len par byed na de'i tshe yang kho bo cag la dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ci ste tha dad pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam par rtog pa spangs nas bum pa dpe nyid du len par byed na de'i tshe yang kho bo cag la dpe bsgrub byas stong pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: But if one accepts the pot itself as the example, having abandoned the conception of difference and non-difference, then at that time, we show that the example is empty of the probandum.

original: khyad med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyad med ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no difference,‚Äù and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni bum pa'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the entity of the pot.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: 'di'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di'i rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe type of this,‚Äù and so on.

original: bum pa'i dngos po 'di'i rigs kyi ming can gyi cha rnams ni rtag la /
analyzed: bum pa'i dngos po 'di'i rigs kyi ming can gyi cha rnams ni rtag la /
translated: The parts that are called the type of this entity of the pot are permanent.

original: cig shos gsal ba'i ming can rnams ni 'jig pa ste 'gyur ba can yin no //
analyzed: cig shos gsal ba'i ming can rnams ni 'jig pa ste 'gyur ba can yin no //
translated: The other parts that are called the manifestation are perishable, that is, subject to change.

original: 'di snyam du ji ltar gcig @163b la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa yin snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ji ltar gcig @163b la phan tshun 'gal ba'i rang bzhin gnyis rigs pa yin snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúHow could it be logical for a single thing to have two natures that are mutually exclusive?‚Äù

original: dngos gcig 'dren pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgzhan yang bsgrub bya'i chos rnam par brtags pa'i sgo nas dpe'i skyon brjod par 'dod nas /
analyzed: dngos gcig 'dren pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gzhan yang bsgrub bya'i chos rnam par brtags pa'i sgo nas dpe'i skyon brjod par 'dod nas /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna addresses this point:

original: de ltar mi rtag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar mi rtag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Moreover, wishing to state the fault of the example from the perspective of the analysis of the predicate of the probandum, [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] says, ‚ÄúIn that case, impermanence,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub bya nyed du 'dod pa de'i tshe kho bo cag dpyod pa ba la dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub bya nyed du 'dod pa de'i tshe kho bo cag dpyod pa ba la dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba yin te /
translated: If you assert that the impermanence characterized by destruction is the predicate of the probandum without [the presence of] the entailment, then in that case, for us MƒÅdhyamikas, the example is incomplete with respect to the predicate of the probandum.

original: kho bo cag gis ni dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa bstan nas chad par mi 'dod de /
analyzed: kho bo cag gis ni dngos po rnams kyi 'jig pa bstan nas chad par mi 'dod de /
translated: For we MƒÅdhyamikas do not assert nihilism after demonstrating the destruction of things,

original: nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i ngo bor gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because [we maintain that] things abide in the nature of potentiality.

original: gal te yang 'jig pa'i zhes bya ba spyi'i sgra yin pa de lta na yang skabs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi don gyi yul 'di la 'jug par shes te /
analyzed: gal te yang 'jig pa'i zhes bya ba spyi'i sgra yin pa de lta na yang skabs kyi rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i bdag nyid kyi don gyi yul 'di la 'jug par shes te /
translated: Even if the term ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is a general term, it is understood that it applies to the object of the meaning of ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù in this context.

original: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar rigs /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ji ltar dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bar rigs /
translated: Otherwise, how could it be logical that the example would be incomplete with respect to the probandum?

original: 'on te gal te gtan nas 'jig pa nyid /
analyzed: 'on te gal te gtan nas 'jig pa nyid /
translated: But if you say that ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is a general term,

original: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi rtag pa nyid rnam par brtags zin ma yin nam /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid du brjod pa na zhes bya ba la sogs pas mi rtag pa nyid rnam par brtags zin ma yin nam /
translated: then why do you say that ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù is not already investigated, since you say, ‚ÄúIf destruction itself is called impermanence‚Äù?

original: de ci'i phyir yang rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir yang rtog par byed ce na /
translated: Why do you think about it again?

original: bden te der ni phyogs kyi skyon bstan pa'i don du yin la da lta ni dpe'i yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: bden te der ni phyogs kyi skyon bstan pa'i don du yin la da lta ni dpe'i yin no zhes bya ba ni khyad par ro //
translated: It is true that in the previous context, impermanence was investigated in order to show the fault in the opponent‚Äôs thesis, but here it is in the context of the example. This is the difference.

original: yang rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: yang rjes su 'gro ba med par 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid kyi mi rtag pa nyid mi 'dod kyi /
translated: You may say, ‚ÄúWe do not assert that impermanence has the characteristic of destruction without dependence on something else.

original: 'on kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: But rather, it has the characteristic of manifestation and nonmanifestation.‚Äù

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gzhan yin zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan yin zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù is stated.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: It is connected with ‚Äúimpermanence.‚Äù

original: khyed la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub byas stong zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyed la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub byas stong zhes bya ba dang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúYou‚Äù is connected with ‚Äúis empty.‚Äù

original: de la yang dpe'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dpe'i zhes bya ba ni khyad par yin no //
translated: And there, ‚Äúlike the example‚Äù is a distinction.

original: khyed cag sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni grangs can bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: khyed cag sangs rgyas pa rnams kyis ni grangs can bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba dang bcas pa'i 'jig pa mi 'dod do //
translated: You Buddhists do not assert destruction that is concomitant like the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas.üîΩTherefore, in your position, the example is incomplete.

original: de lta bas na khyed kyi phyogs la dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la skyon gyi lam 'di mkhas pa rnams la bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed kyi phyogs la dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i sgra mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa la skyon gyi lam 'di mkhas pa rnams la bshad pa yin la /
translated: This statement is explained to the learned as a fault in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: gzhan yang shes rab can rnams kyis rang nyid kyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang shes rab can rnams kyis rang nyid kyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the wise should investigate this themselves.

original: gal te tshig don zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te tshig don zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka'i dogs pa bsu ba yin te /
translated: If someone says ‚ÄúThe word and meaning,‚Äù and so on, this is anticipating an objection from others.

original: khyad par can gyi sgrub par byed pa rnam par chad pa'i bya ba'i khyad par bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag gi don te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi sgrub par byed pa rnam par chad pa'i bya ba'i khyad par bsgrub pa dang dgag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ngag gi don te /
translated: The meaning of the sentence is the particular activity that is accomplished by the particular means of accomplishment, which is either affirmed or denied.

original: de nyid la skul bar byed pa ni tshad ma yin gyi dngos po la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid la skul bar byed pa ni tshad ma yin gyi dngos po la ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the sentence that is the means of valid knowledge, not the thing.

original: de lta yin dang rig byed tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la tshig dang tshig gi don dang de dag gi 'brel ba gsum po rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa gang yin pa de ni skabs su nye bar mkho ba @164a * //üîΩma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rig byed tshad ma nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la tshig dang tshig gi don dang de dag gi 'brel ba gsum po rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa gang yin pa de ni skabs su nye bar mkho ba @164a * // ma yin no //
translated: If that were not so, then in order to prove that the Veda is a means of valid knowledge, it would be necessary to prove that the three‚Äîthe words, their meanings, and their relationship‚Äîare permanent, and that would be irrelevant to the present discussion.

original: gzhan yang gang dang gang dag gi don rtogs pa de ni brda las byung ba can yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang dang gang dag gi don rtogs pa de ni brda las byung ba can yin te /
translated: Moreover, the understanding of any meaning arises from linguistic signs.

original: dper na aa ae ao zhes bya ba'i ngag las yon tan 'phel ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na aa ae ao zhes bya ba'i ngag las yon tan 'phel ba la sogs pa'i blo bzhin no //
translated: For example, the understanding of the increase of a quality and so on arises from the words ‚Äúa,‚Äù ‚Äúe,‚Äù and ‚Äúo.‚Äù

original: skul bar byed pa'i ngag las byung ba yang dag gi don rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa'i ngag las byung ba yang dag gi don rtogs par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The speech that is the source of the correct understanding of the meaning of the Veda is the Veda itself. This is a natural inference.üîΩThis is what is being taught:

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni skyes bu rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni skyes bu rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Just as people who are intent on wealth, etc.

original: yon tan 'phel sogs blo bzhin ni 'dun pa'i don la 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel sogs blo bzhin ni 'dun pa'i don la 'dra ba yin no //
translated: are intent on the goal of wealth, etc.

original: 'di nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir rgyu mtshan med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to prove this, he says, ‚ÄúEven without a reason,‚Äù etc.

original: rgyu mtshan med pa yin yang ste /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa yin yang ste /
translated: Even without a reason,

original: rag las pa med pa yin na yang mchod sbyin byed pa med pa rnams kyis lcags kyu med pa rang nyid kyi brtags pas 'tsho ba'i don du /
analyzed: rag las pa med pa yin na yang mchod sbyin byed pa med pa rnams kyis lcags kyu med pa rang nyid kyi brtags pas 'tsho ba'i don du /
translated: even without a cause, those who do not perform sacrifices, without a hook, for the sake of their livelihood,

original: mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg sbyin //
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas me la sbyin sreg sbyin //
translated: through their own imagination, ‚Äúdesire heaven and perform sacrifices in the fire,‚Äù etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rigs byed kyi ngag gi don brtags pa yin no zhes bya bar srid pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rigs byed kyi ngag gi don brtags pa yin no zhes bya bar srid pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of the words of the Vedas is imagined. This is possible.

original: gzhan yang ngag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang ngag 'dus pa'i ngo bo yin pa de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, the Vedas are the product of a person, because they are a collection of words.

original: dper na zlos gar gyi sgrung la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zlos gar gyi sgrung la sogs pa'i gtam rgyud bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the stories of the Ramayana and so on.

original: rig byed kyang tshig 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rig byed kyang tshig 'dus pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The Vedas are a collection of words. This is a natural inference.

original: de lta yin dang skyes bus byas pa'i phyir lam po che'i skyes bu'i ngag bzhin du rig byed tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyes bus byas pa'i phyir lam po che'i skyes bu'i ngag bzhin du rig byed tshad ma ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then because they are the product of a person, like the words of a person on the street, the Vedas are not a valid means of knowledge.

original: yid ches pas byas pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa yin na yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yid ches pas byas pa'i phyir skyes bus byas pa yin na yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even if they are the product of a person because they are made by a trustworthy person, they are a valid means of knowledge.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In response to that, he says, ‚ÄúHere, the Vedas are not the product of a person.‚Äù

original: 'brel ba mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'brel ba mi byed ces bya ba la sogs pas len 'debs par byed de /
translated: He responds with, ‚ÄúBecause they do not make a connection,‚Äù and so on.

original: nyan pa po la 'brel byed na //
analyzed: nyan pa po la 'brel byed na //
translated: If the listener makes the connection,

original: smra ba po yis gang rtogs 'gyur //
analyzed: smra ba po yis gang rtogs 'gyur //
translated: then what is understood by the speaker?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig dang tshig gi don gang gi 'brel ba mi rigs pa brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis rig byed kyi tshig rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas tshig dang tshig gi don gang gi 'brel ba mi rigs pa brjod pa gang yin pa de nyid kyis rig byed kyi tshig rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: The very fact that the connection between the words and their meanings is not reasonable in the statements such as ‚ÄúOne should sacrifice an animal at a sacrifice‚Äù should be stated as the eternality of the words of the Vedas.

original: skyes bu rnams kyi brda las ni //
