analyzed: skyes bu rnams kyi brda las ni //
translated: From the convention of men

original: yon tan 'phel sogs blo bzhin du //
analyzed: yon tan 'phel sogs blo bzhin du //
translated: like the cognition of the increase of qualities, etc.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ma nges pa nyid du ston pa ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ma nges pa nyid du ston pa ni /
translated: This shows that the statement ‚ÄúThe words of the Vedas are eternal because they are not like the words of men‚Äù is not established.

original: brda las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: brda las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: From convention, etc.

original: aa dang ai la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i don de la brda las yon tan la sogs pa'i tha snyad rtogs pa srid pa nyid yin gyi /üîΩrig byed las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: aa dang ai la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i don de la brda las yon tan la sogs pa'i tha snyad rtogs pa srid pa nyid yin gyi / rig byed las ni ma yin te /
translated: The convention of qualities, etc., is possible in the seen meanings of a, i, etc.

original: mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyis brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyis brda bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not possible in the Vedas because heaven, etc., are supersensible and cannot be the basis of a convention.

original: 'o na de lta na 'di don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na 'di don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then this is pointless.

original: 'di yang don med ma yin te //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'di yang don med ma yin te // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is not pointless.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the Vedas.

original: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de la yang sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dus pa nyid la yang zhes ba la @164b sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa de la yang sgrub par byed pa gzhan gyis ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir 'dus pa nyid la yang zhes ba la @164b sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that proof, ‚Äúbecause of being a collection,‚Äù and so on, in order to demonstrate that it is not ascertained by another proof, he says, ‚ÄúEven with regard to the collection,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'on te bha ra ta 'don par byed pa la yang de skad du brjod par nus pa ma yin nam /üîΩgang bha ra ta 'dan par byed pa de thams cad ni bla ma 'don par byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bha ra ta 'don par byed pa la yang de skad du brjod par nus pa ma yin nam / gang bha ra ta 'dan par byed pa de thams cad ni bla ma 'don par byed pa sngon du 'gro ba can yin te /
translated: But can it not be said that the reciter of the Bharata is so?

original: bha ra ta 'don pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba bzhin no zhes de skad du brjod par nus pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: bha ra ta 'don pa yin pa'i phyir da ltar ba bzhin no zhes de skad du brjod par nus pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It cannot be said that ‚Äúall reciters of the Bharata are preceded by the recitation of the guru, because of being reciters of the Bharata, like the present reciter of the Bharata.‚Äù

original: de lta bas na de bzhin du sgrub byed gzhan yang ma nges pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na de bzhin du sgrub byed gzhan yang ma nges pa yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Therefore, in the same way, another proof is also not ascertained.

original: bha ra ta yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bha ra ta yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In response to that doubt, he says, ‚ÄúEven the Bharata,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni thal bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù refers to the reductio.

original: 'on kyang de la byed pa po rgyas par dran zhes bya ba byed pa po dran pa des dam bca' ba'i don la gnod pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de la byed pa po rgyas par dran zhes bya ba byed pa po dran pa des dam bca' ba'i don la gnod pa'i phyir thal bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that the memory of the author is a fault in the meaning of the thesis, because the memory of the author is extensive.

original: rig byed la ni dran pa med de byed pa po zhes bya ba lhag ma'o ;
analyzed: rig byed la ni dran pa med de byed pa po zhes bya ba lhag ma'o ;
translated: The Vedas have no author, because there is no memory of an author.

original: /'on te rig byed la yang byed pa po dran pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: /'on te rig byed la yang byed pa po dran pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt there memory of an author even of the Vedas?

original: 'di ltar drang srong me khros nges brjod kyi rig byed byas la snyan tshig gi rig byed pa ni snyan dngags kyi rig byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar drang srong me khros nges brjod kyi rig byed byas la snyan tshig gi rig byed pa ni snyan dngags kyi rig byed do //
translated: Thus, the Vedas of the sages are the Vedas of the sages who are angry at fire. The Vedas of poetry are the Vedas of poetry.

original: legs ldan la mtshungs pa'i blo can drang srong phug ron 'jug gis byas pa ni srid snang gi rig byed do //
analyzed: legs ldan la mtshungs pa'i blo can drang srong phug ron 'jug gis byas pa ni srid snang gi rig byed do //
translated: The Vedas of the sky are the Vedas of the sage who is a pigeon, who is a friend of Brihaspati.

original: snyan dngags kyi rig byed byas pa'am /
analyzed: snyan dngags kyi rig byed byas pa'am /
translated: The Vedas of poetry are the Vedas of poetry.

original: yang na nyi ma'i gnyen gyis byas pa yin no zhe na /üîΩde'i phyir / gang de don brjod rgyu mtshan can //
analyzed: yang na nyi ma'i gnyen gyis byas pa yin no zhe na / de'i phyir / gang de don brjod rgyu mtshan can //
translated: Or, they are the Vedas of the friend of the sun.üîΩTherefore, it says:üîΩThe Vedas are the subject.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: They have no author.üîΩBecause they are not remembered.

original: gang yang reg byed pa po dran pa de ni don brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: gang yang reg byed pa po dran pa de ni don brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The memory of the one who touches is the reason for the expression of the object.

original: don gzhan brjod pa lhur len pa ni /
analyzed: don gzhan brjod pa lhur len pa ni /
translated: The expression of the object is the primary concern of the other.

original: don brjod pa ste de rgyu mtshan du gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: don brjod pa ste de rgyu mtshan du gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: The one who has that is called the one who expresses the object.

original: 'di ltar byas zhes bya ba byed pa'i don lhur len pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byas zhes bya ba byed pa'i don lhur len pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the expression of the object is the primary concern of the one who says ‚ÄúI touched it.‚Äù

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: dran pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: dran pa'i don yin no //
translated: It is the object of memory.

original: byas te dran par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byas te dran par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the object of memory is ‚ÄúI touched it.‚Äù

original: don 'di ji ltar nges she na /
analyzed: don 'di ji ltar nges she na /
translated: How is this meaning ascertained?

original: 'das dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'das dang ma 'ongs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe past and the future,‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma gnyis ni go bar zad do //
analyzed: tshad ma gnyis ni go bar zad do //
translated: The two valid forms of knowledge are understood.

original: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs su bab pa'i don mtha' dag mjug bsdus nas tshad ma byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs su bab pa'i don mtha' dag mjug bsdus nas tshad ma byed pa yin te /
translated: In this way, having summarized the entire topic, he concludes by saying, ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang zhig gang la byed pa por gyur ba'i smra ba po la ltos pa med par shes pa skyed pa de ni de la brdzun par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la byed pa por gyur ba'i smra ba po la ltos pa med par shes pa skyed pa de ni de la brdzun par mi 'gyur te /
translated: That which produces knowledge without depending on the speaker who is the agent in regard to that is not false for that person.

original: dper na tshig gi don la tshig bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshig gi don la tshig bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the meaning of a word.

original: rig byed kyi tshig kyang byed pa por gyur ba'i skyes bu smra ba po la ltos pa med par rang gi don la shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi tshig kyang byed pa por gyur ba'i skyes bu smra ba po la ltos pa med par rang gi don la shes pa skyed par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The words of the Vedas generate the cognition of their meaning without depending on a speaking person who is an agent. This is the observation of a contradictory pervasion,

original: byed pa por gyur ba'i skyes bu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis brdzun pa la khyab pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: byed pa por gyur ba'i skyes bu la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid kyis brdzun pa la khyab pa'i phyir la /
translated: because the generation of cognition that depends on a speaking person who is an agent is pervaded by falsity,

original: de dag 'gal ba smra ba po la ltos pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag 'gal ba smra ba po la ltos pa med pa nyid do //
translated: and those words do not depend on a speaking person who is an agent.

original: tshig blo bzhin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: tshig blo bzhin zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is like the cognition of a word.

original: 'di ni tshig rnams kyis mi slu ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ston pa @165a * //
analyzed: 'di ni tshig rnams kyis mi slu ba'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ston pa @165a * //
translated: This shows that the words are the cause of nondeceptive cognition.

original: lhur len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lhur len pa yin gyi /
translated: This is the main point.

original: tshig gi blo dpe nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig gi blo dpe nyid du mngon par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not asserted that the cognition of a word is the example.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: tshig rnam pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: tshig rnam pa nyid yin te /
translated: It is the words themselves.

original: de ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin la /
analyzed: de ltar sgra'i bdag nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can yin la /
translated: Thus, the nature of sound is the logical subject to be proven.

original: de mi slu pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis brdzun pa ma yi pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: de mi slu pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid kyis brdzun pa ma yi pa nyid du bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: It is proven to be non-false by the reason that it produces a non-deceptive cognition.

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi dpe'i chos can rigs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid kyi dpe'i chos can rigs pa yin gyi /
translated: The example subject, which is of that nature, is correct.

original: de lta ma yin na dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, the example would be incomplete with respect to the probandum.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan ni gang zhig rtag pa'i ngag las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni don ji lta ba nyid kyis yang dag pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan ni gang zhig rtag pa'i ngag las skyes pa'i shes pa de ni don ji lta ba nyid kyis yang dag pa yin te /
translated: Similarly, another syllogism is: ‚ÄúThat cognition which arises from eternal speech is correct because of being just as its object is,

original: dper na ngag gi rang bzhin gyi yul can bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ngag gi rang bzhin gyi yul can bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the cognition whose object is the nature of speech.‚Äù

original: me la sbyin sreg byas pa la sogs pas mtho ris la sogs pa 'grub par nges pa la yang rtag pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg byas pa la sogs pas mtho ris la sogs pa 'grub par nges pa la yang rtag pa'i ngag gis bskyed pa yin na zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso, with respect to the certainty of the attainment of heaven, etc., by means of the performance of fire sacrifices, etc., it is produced by eternal speech,‚Äù is a natural inference.

original: sngar rgyas par thos pa brtag par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar rgyas par thos pa brtag par bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it has already been extensively established in the examination of learning, the reason is not unestablished.

original: bskul bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang po nyid du bshad zin to ;
analyzed: bskul bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dang po nyid du bshad zin to ;
translated: As for ‚Äúby prompting‚Äù and so on, this was explained at the beginning.

original: / de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan dag ni gang zhig yid ches pa ma yin pas ma byas pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa dang / gang yang yul dang dus dang skyes bu'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la sogs pa la slu ba dang bral ba de ni tshad ma yin te /üîΩdper na yid ces pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: / de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan dag ni gang zhig yid ches pa ma yin pas ma byas pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa dang / gang yang yul dang dus dang skyes bu'i gnas skabs kyi khyad par la sogs pa la slu ba dang bral ba de ni tshad ma yin te / dper na yid ces pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: Similarly, other syllogisms are: ‚ÄúThat which is not produced by words that are not trusted by someone is valid knowledge, like the consciousness produced by the words of a reliable person.üîΩThis consciousness produced by the words of a reliable person is also like that.‚Äù

original: skul bar byed pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa'i tshig gis bskyed pa'i shes pa 'di yang de bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs dag go //
translated: These are autonomous reasons.

original: gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang po ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The first reason is not unestablished,

original: skyes bus ma byas par rgya cher bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas par rgya cher bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been extensively established that it is not produced by a person.

original: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyis pa yang ma yin te /
translated: because,

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: as it is said,

original: mtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig las the tshom rtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig las the tshom rtogs par 'gyur ba yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne does not understand the doubt from the words ‚ÄòOne should make sacrifice through desire for heaven.‚ÄôüîΩ‚Äù

original: the tshom med par rtogs pa na 'di log pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩgang dag bskyed nas 'jig pa 'di de lta ma yin no snyam pa'i log pa'i shes pa 'di ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan nam /
analyzed: the tshom med par rtogs pa na 'di log pa nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin no // gang dag bskyed nas 'jig pa 'di de lta ma yin no snyam pa'i log pa'i shes pa 'di ni yul gzhan nam dus gzhan nam /
translated: When one understands without doubt, this is not a wrong conception.üîΩThe wrong conception that thinks, ‚ÄúThis destruction is not like that which has arisen,‚Äù is not a wrong conception with regard to another object, another time, or another person.

original: skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba ma yin pas de lta bas na phyin ci log ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci log tu 'gyur ba ma yin pas de lta bas na phyin ci log ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not a wrong conception.

original: de'i phyir snang ba bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad kyi thun mong ba chos la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu rig byed ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba bzhin du 'jig rten thams cad kyi thun mong ba chos la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu rig byed ni rang nyid las tshad ma yin no zhes bya ba grub po //
translated: Therefore, like the appearance of a double moon, the Veda, which is the cause of the positing of dharma and so on, is common to all people in the world. It is established that it is a valid means of knowledge in itself.

original: de lta yin dang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gis gang smras pa'i sems tsam @165b la sogs pa'i tshul de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ba'i bar gnas so //
analyzed: de lta yin dang sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa dag gis gang smras pa'i sems tsam @165b la sogs pa'i tshul de ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes ba'i bar gnas so //
translated: If that were the case, then the system of mind only and so on, which is spoken of by Buddhists and so on, would not be reasonable.

original: gal te thams cad du thun mong ba'i rig byed snang ba bzhin du rang nyid las tshad ma ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te thams cad du thun mong ba'i rig byed snang ba bzhin du rang nyid las tshad ma ma yin nam /
translated: If it is not a valid cognition in regard to itself, like the appearance of a universal that is common to all,

original: ci'i phyir de la sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa kha cig log par rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de la sangs rgyas pa la sogs pa kha cig log par rtog par 'gyur /
translated: why do some, such as Buddhists, conceive it to be mistaken?

original: de dag la de tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de dag la de tshad ma ma yin par rigs pa ma yin no zhes dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: Fearing that it is not reasonable that it is not a valid cognition in regard to those,

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says therefore and so on.üîΩJust as the sun, which is the eye common to all beings, is born with a multitude of very clear light rays that remove all causes of cataracts,

original: ji ltar ches gsal ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rab rib kyi rgyu mtha' dag sel bar byed pa'i nyi ma skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ba'i mig lta bu kun nas snang yang rang gi las kyi nyes pa dang rjes su mthun pas bskyed pa'i cho
analyzed: ji ltar ches gsal ba'i 'od zer gyi tshogs kyis rab rib kyi rgyu mtha' dag sel bar byed pa'i nyi ma skye bo thams cad kyi thun mong ba'i mig lta bu kun nas snang yang rang gi las kyi nyes pa dang rjes su mthun pas bskyed pa'i cho
translated: it appears in every way, but due to the fault of one‚Äôs own karma, the cataracts of the eye of wisdom are not removed.

original: mi gsal ba'i mig can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam du gzugs mi 'jug pa de bzhin du chos ma yin pas blo'i mig bslad pa sh'akya'i bu la sogs pa rig byed 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig pur gnas na yang 'gal baüîΩnyid du sgrub par byed do zhes grag ste /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i mig can gyi bum pa la sogs pa'i mthong ba'i lam du gzugs mi 'jug pa de bzhin du chos ma yin pas blo'i mig bslad pa sh'akya'i bu la sogs pa rig byed 'jig rten mtha' dag gi mig gcig pur gnas na yang 'gal ba nyid du sgrub par byed do zhes grag ste /
translated: Even though the son of the ≈öƒÅkyas is the sole eye of the entire world, he is refuted.

original: lo'i sgra ni ma rangs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: lo'i sgra ni ma rangs pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúlo‚Äù expresses displeasure.

original: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnyis skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar byed pa ni gnyis skyes zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To clarify that, he says ‚Äútwice-born‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes bu'i yi ge zhes bya ba ni rog dang ta la tsam du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes bu'i yi ge zhes bya ba ni rog dang ta la tsam du yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe letters of men‚Äù means just the letters ro and ta.

original: de la gang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang bral ba de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la re zhig gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas ma nges pa bstan
analyzed: de la gang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang bral ba de ni phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la re zhig gtan tshigs grub pa nyid du khas blangs nas ma nges pa bstan
translated: Regarding what was said, ‚ÄúThat which is free from the fault of being a cause of error is the cause of non-erroneous cognition,‚Äù and so on, first accepting that the reason is established, he shows that it is not definite.

original: pa'i phyir / byed pa po med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa'i phyir / byed pa po med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúEven if there is no author,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni thos pa'o //üîΩji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa brdzun du smra bar mthong ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tshig log pa nyid kyis rgyu nyes pa yin par gtan la phab pa de bzhin du brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dangüîΩldan pa bden par smra bar mthong ba'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yang bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir log pa nyid bzhin du rgyu log pas bden pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa yin na yang bden pa'i
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni thos pa'o // ji ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa brdzun du smra bar mthong ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las tshig log pa nyid kyis rgyu nyes pa yin par gtan la phab pa de bzhin du brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan pa bden par smra bar mthong ba'i phyir brtse ba la sogs pa'i yon tan yang bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yin pas de'i phyir log pa nyid bzhin du rgyu log pas bden pa nyid kyang ldog pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa yin na yang bden pa'i
translated: ‚Äú These‚Äù refers to the words.

original: don can du mi 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: don can du mi 'grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Just as it is ascertained that the cause of false speech is a fault, because one sees that one who possesses attachment and so on speaks falsely, and because one sees that one who is free of attachment and so on does not speak falsely, in the same way, because one sees that one who possesses the good qualities of compassion and so on speaks truthfully, and because one sees that one who is free of compassion and so on speaks falsely, the good qualities of compassion and so on are also the cause of truthfulness. Therefore, because the cause is reversed, like the reversal of falsity, truthfulness is also reversed. Thus, even if it is not produced by a person, it is not established as having a true meaning. Therefore, the reason is indeterminate.

original: yang ji ltar yon tan ldan par nges she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar yon tan ldan par nges she na /
translated: Moreover, how is it ascertained that it possesses good qualities?

original: yon tan yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yon tan yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is a quality, etc.‚Äù

original: khyed kyis nyes pa med pa'i rgyur brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan med pa la yang yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khyed kyis nyes pa med pa'i rgyur brjod pa gang yin pa de ni de nyid bden pa nyid kyi rgyu yon tan med pa la yang yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Whatever you have said is the cause of non-fault, that is the cause of truth-status even in the absence of a quality.

original: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @166a * //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba la sogs @166a * //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, etc.‚Äù

original: pas mjug bsdus nas rgyu mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid dag med par thal ba ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pas mjug bsdus nas rgyu mi dmigs pa'i sgo nas bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid dag med par thal ba ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: concludes, and shows that the consequence of the absence of truth-status and falsity is due to the non-apprehension of a cause.

original: de la shes rab la sogs pa ni bden pa nyid kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab la sogs pa ni bden pa nyid kyi rgyu'o //
translated: Therein, wisdom, etc. are the cause of truth-status.

original: log pa nyid kyi rgyu ni brtse ba med pa la sogs pa'i zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: log pa nyid kyi rgyu ni brtse ba med pa la sogs pa'i zhes go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of falsity is lack of compassion, etc.

original: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid dag go //
analyzed: de gnyis zhes bya ba ni bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose two‚Äù are truth-status and falsity.

original: gnyis med pa ni thal bar 'gyur ba gang zhig tu 'gyur ba de ston pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis med pa ni thal bar 'gyur ba gang zhig tu 'gyur ba de ston pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúWithout the two‚Äù is the consequence.

original: des na don med thob 'gyur te //
analyzed: des na don med thob 'gyur te //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, one would obtain a meaningless result‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: khur ba drug dang se'u bcu //
analyzed: khur ba drug dang se'u bcu //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúSix cakes and ten cherries‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i smyon pa'i smyon tshig bzhin du khyed cag sangs rgyas pa la rig byed don med par sgrub par byed pa ni dam bca' ba mthong bas gnod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i smyon pa'i smyon tshig bzhin du khyed cag sangs rgyas pa la rig byed don med par sgrub par byed pa ni dam bca' ba mthong bas gnod par 'gyur te /
translated: and so on, which are the insane words of a madman, are undermined by the perception of a thesis.üîΩThus, since the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúOne who performs fire sacrifice with fire attains the higher realms‚Äù is directly experienced, how could it be rejected?

original: 'di ltar me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las don rtogs par mngon sum du nyams su myong na de ji ltar spong bar byed ces dogs pa bsu nas gzhan gyi tshig go skabs spong bar byed pa ni
analyzed: 'di ltar me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i ngag 'di las don rtogs par mngon sum du nyams su myong na de ji ltar spong bar byed ces dogs pa bsu nas gzhan gyi tshig go skabs spong bar byed pa ni
translated: Anticipating this qualm, the following is stated to refute the opportunity for others to speak:

original: / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is a reductio argument.

original: 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: This is what is thought:

original: gal te rang rgyud kyis rig byed don med pa can bsgrub par bya ba yin na dam bca' ba la gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rang rgyud kyis rig byed don med pa can bsgrub par bya ba yin na dam bca' ba la gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: If the statement ‚ÄúThe Vedas are meaningless‚Äù were to prove a thesis of one‚Äôs own, then it would be undermined by the perception of a thesis.

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni thal bar sgrub par byed pa yin la /üîΩde lta thal bar 'gyur ba la ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni thal bar sgrub par byed pa yin la /üîΩde lta thal bar 'gyur ba la ni /
translated: But since this is a reductio argument,üîΩin a reductio there is no thesis.

original: dam bca' ba la gnod pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dam bca' ba la gnod pa srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it possible to invalidate the thesis,

original: de la dam bca' bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la dam bca' bar bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is nothing to be proven by the thesis.üîΩAnd when the pervading factor is eliminated, the pervaded factor is not necessarily eliminated.

original: khyab par byed pa'i chos log na yang khyab par bya ba ldog par mi 'dod pa gzhan dag nyid la mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pas tshig 'gal bar ston pa 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i chos log na yang khyab par bya ba ldog par mi 'dod pa gzhan dag nyid la mi 'dod pa thog tu bab pas tshig 'gal bar ston pa 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
translated: This is a contradiction in the words of others who do not accept this, and it is pointless to demonstrate this contradiction.

original: 'di la mthong bas gnod pa nyid kyang med de /
analyzed: 'di la mthong bas gnod pa nyid kyang med de /
translated: Here, there is no contradiction with what is seen,

original: 'di ltar skyes bus bshad pa'i dbang gis don med pa can gyi rig byed la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bus bshad pa'i dbang gis don med pa can gyi rig byed la sogs pa la rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: because this understanding arises in regard to meaningless Vedic statements and so on by the power of human explanation.

original: dper na me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'dis bha ra ta dang lha mo la sogs pa'i spyod pa brjod pa yin no zhes mi shes pa kha cig gis bshad pas phyis de'i
analyzed: dper na me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rig byed kyi ngag 'dis bha ra ta dang lha mo la sogs pa'i spyod pa brjod pa yin no zhes mi shes pa kha cig gis bshad pas phyis de'i
translated: For example, some ignorant people explain that this Vedic statement, ‚ÄúBy offering oblations into the fire, one attains heaven,‚Äù expresses the conduct of Bharata and the goddess.

original: tshig de las don de rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na yin na de ni don des don dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis don med pa'i rig byed pas kyang don rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba la
analyzed: tshig de las don de rtogs par 'gyur ba kho na yin na de ni don des don dang ldan pa yang ma yin pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis don med pa'i rig byed pas kyang don rtogs pa 'dir 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir dam bca' ba la
translated: If the meaning of the statement is understood from the words themselves, then the statement is meaningless, just like the meaningless statements of a natural fool.

original: mthong bas gnod pa gang las yin /
analyzed: mthong bas gnod pa gang las yin /
translated: So how could the thesis be undermined by perception?

original: gzhan yang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa kho na ldog gi yon tan ni @166b ma yin du chug mdo de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid mi zlogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa kho na ldog gi yon tan ni @166b ma yin du chug mdo de lta na yang gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid mi zlogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, suppose that only the cause of error, the fault, is eliminated, and not the good qualities. Even so, the reason remains indefinite.

original: skyon med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyon med na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúEven if there is no fault,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te sgra rnams kyi bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chu bo gzhan zhig yod par ma gyur na de'i tshe phung po gcig med pa phung po gnyis pa yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra rnams kyi bden pa nyid dang log pa nyid las ma gtogs pa'i chu bo gzhan zhig yod par ma gyur na de'i tshe phung po gcig med pa phung po gnyis pa yod pa med na mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no other river apart from the truth and falsity of the words, then the absence of one heap would not entail the absence of the second heap.

original: gang gi tshe gzhan phung po gsum pa don med pa yang yod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gzhan phung po gsum pa don med pa yang yod pa de'i tshe /
translated: When the third alternative, which is meaningless, exists,

original: log pa nyid ldog pas bden pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: log pa nyid ldog pas bden pa nyid du nges pa ma yin te /
translated: then it is not ascertained that the Vedas are true because of the reversal of falsity,

original: gzhan phung po gsum pa don med pa mi zlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan phung po gsum pa don med pa mi zlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the third alternative, which is meaningless, is not reversed.

original: gal te 'di snyam du rig byed la brtse ba la sogs pa yon tan gyi rgyu can gyi bden pa nyid khas blangs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du rig byed la brtse ba la sogs pa yon tan gyi rgyu can gyi bden pa nyid khas blangs par gyur na /
translated: If you think that the truth of the Vedas is due to the quality of being composed by a trustworthy person,

original: de'i tshe yon tan rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi skyes bu ldog pas ldog pa na log pa nyid bzhin du bden pa nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur na gang gi phyir rig byed ni rang las chad ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i
analyzed: de'i tshe yon tan rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyi skyes bu ldog pas ldog pa na log pa nyid bzhin du bden pa nyid kyang ldog par 'gyur na gang gi phyir rig byed ni rang las chad ma yin pa'i phyir rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i
translated: then when the quality of being composed by a trustworthy person is reversed because the person is reversed, truth would also be reversed, just as falsity is.

original: don can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi yon tan gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin gyi yon tan gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the Vedas are not reversed because they are not composed by a person.

original: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na gtan tshigs ma nges pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore the reason is not indefinite.

original: rig byed don med pa can du thal ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi lan 'di dogs par byas nas lan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rig byed don med pa can du thal ba yang ma yin no zhes bya ba'i gzhan gyi lan 'di dogs par byas nas lan bshad pa ni /
translated: Having anticipated this response of the opponent, the reply is:

original: de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If that is so, etc.üîΩIf the Vedas are not intrinsically true, then it is possible that they are false, and therefore the reason is simply not established.

original: ji ltar rig byed 'di rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i don can ma yin pa de lta na log pa nyid kyang srid pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bsams pa'o //üîΩ'di yang thams cad du ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar rig byed 'di rang bzhin gyis bden pa'i don can ma yin pa de lta na log pa nyid kyang srid pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa kho na'o zhes bya ba bsams pa'o // 'di yang thams cad du ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: This is what he means.üîΩThis is also explained later:

original: shes rgyu yin na cig car du //
analyzed: shes rgyu yin na cig car du //
translated: If it were the cause of cognition in all cases,

original: de las byung ba'i shes par 'gyur //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i shes par 'gyur //
translated: then consciousness would arise from it all at once,

original: rgyu ma tshang ba med phyir ro //üîΩzhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma tshang ba med phyir ro // zhes phyis 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the cause would not be incomplete.

original: ji ltar don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar don med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: How could the consequence of uselessness follow?

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung ba kho na yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung ba kho na yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever is not incomplete with regard to its cause at a certain time, it arises at that time,

original: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i tshig las byung ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon par 'dod pa'i gnas skabs kyi me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i tshig las byung ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that arises from the words of the fire sacrifice, etc. at the time of the desired state.

original: rig byed kyi rgyu can gyi shes pa thams cad kyang gnas skabs thams cad rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rig byed kyi rgyu can gyi shes pa thams cad kyang gnas skabs thams cad rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And all cognitions that are caused by the Vedas are complete causes at all times. This is a natural inference.

original: shes pa gcig bcad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs la yang skyon gzhan bshad pa ni /
analyzed: shes pa gcig bcad par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyogs la yang skyon gzhan bshad pa ni /
translated: In the position that it follows that a single cognition is eliminated, another fault is explained:

original: de'i rjes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: After that, etc.

original: 'di ltar shes pa mtha' dag cig car bskyed nas dus phyis rig byed shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de las nyams pa yin na de'i tshe nus pa'i @167a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar shes pa mtha' dag cig car bskyed nas dus phyis rig byed shes pa skyed par byed pa'i nus pa de las nyams pa yin na de'i tshe nus pa'i @167a * //
translated: Thus, after generating all cognitions simultaneously, if at a later time the potency that produces the cognition of the Vedas declines, then at that time,

original: bdag nyid du gyur ba zad pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur ba zad pa'i phyir nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: because the nature of potency is exhausted, it would decline.

original: ci ste mi nyams na de'i tshe dus phyis kyang shes pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag pa ni ci zhig ltar yang don byed par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste mi nyams na de'i tshe dus phyis kyang shes pa skyed par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rtag pa ni ci zhig ltar yang don byed par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: But if it does not deteriorate, then it follows that it would generate consciousness at a later time as well. Therefore, in no way can a permanent entity be a causal condition that generates consciousness.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed de /
translated: The opponent raises the doubt that the reason ‚Äúbecause the cause is not incomplete‚Äù is not established.

original: bshad pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras brda la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: bshad pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras brda la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch as explanation‚Äù includes such things as conventional symbols.

original: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la sogs pa la'o //
analyzed: de dag la yang zhes bya ba ni bshad pa la sogs pa la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin those‚Äù refers to explanation and so on.

original: de ltar ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed do //
translated: The response to this is stated in the passage beginning with the words ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: de las nus pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed par 'dod nas nus pa med pa ni gzhan la ltos kyi /
analyzed: de las nus pa'i rang bzhin du bskyed par 'dod nas nus pa med pa ni gzhan la ltos kyi /
translated: If you assert that a cause generates an effect that possesses the nature of potentiality, then an entity that lacks potentiality would depend on something else.

original: gang nus pa de'i rang bzhin ni cung zad kyang mtshang ba med pa'i phyir de'i ltos pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
analyzed: gang nus pa de'i rang bzhin ni cung zad kyang mtshang ba med pa'i phyir de'i ltos pa ci 'dra ba zhig yin /
translated: But if it possesses potentiality, then it has not lost even the slightest bit of its nature, so what kind of dependence would it have on something else?

original: ci ste sngar nus pa med pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir phyis nus par 'gyur ro zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe khyed cag gis rig byed la rtag par re ba dor cig / ci ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste sngar nus pa med pa lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir phyis nus par 'gyur ro zhes khas len par byed na de'i tshe khyed cag gis rig byed la rtag par re ba dor cig / ci ltar zhe na /
translated: But if you accept that it becomes potent later on because it previously lacked potency and now possesses the conditions for being a co-originating cause, then you should give up your hope that the Vedas are permanent.üîΩWhy?

original: gal te dang po nus med pa //
analyzed: gal te dang po nus med pa //
translated: If it is initially without potency,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: etc.

original: nus pa tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa tha mi dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: It is because potency is not different.

original: tha dad na yang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rig byed byed pa po ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: tha dad na yang 'brel ba med pa'i phyir rig byed byed pa po ma yin par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are different, then because they are unrelated, it follows that the Vedas are not the creator.

original: nus pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nus pa nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the effect arises from potency alone.

original: zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: This is what should be said.

original: shes rgyu zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i rig byed gang yin pa de skyes bu la brten nas skye ba'am rig byed kyi rang bzhin skyes bu la brten nas skye ba de yang rig byed dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang skye ba kho
analyzed: shes rgyu zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i rig byed gang yin pa de skyes bu la brten nas skye ba'am rig byed kyi rang bzhin skyes bu la brten nas skye ba de yang rig byed dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir de yang skye ba kho
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthe cause of knowledge‚Äù is the indicative that becomes the cause of knowledge. That which arises in dependence on a person, or the nature of the indicative that arises in dependence on a person, is also impermanent, because it is not different from the indicative.

original: na'o // gzhan yang gzhan la ltos na mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags pa yang don med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: na'o // gzhan yang gzhan la ltos na mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags pa yang don med par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it is not only that it would absurdly follow that it is impermanent in dependence on another, but also that the imputation of its being uncreated by a person would be pointless.

original: ji srid sgron 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdon ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags na /
analyzed: ji srid sgron 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / don ji lta ba bzhin du shes par bya ba'i phyir 'di skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du brtags na /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúAs long as it is not burned, etc.,‚ÄùüîΩIf it is imputed to be uncreated by a person in order to understand its meaning,

original: de brtags na yang skyes bu la ltos pa med par de'i shes pa skyed par byed par mi nus pa'i phyir de brtags pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de brtags na yang skyes bu la ltos pa med par de'i shes pa skyed par byed par mi nus pa'i phyir de brtags pa don med pa yin no //
translated: then, even though it is imputed, it is not able to generate the understanding of that meaning without depending on a person. Therefore, the imputation of it is pointless.

original: 'chad pa po tshad mar gyur ba'i skyes bu nyid don ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi da ni grub zin pa nye bar 'jig pa'i skyes bus ma byas pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'chad pa po tshad mar gyur ba'i skyes bu nyid don ji lta ba bzhin shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi da ni grub zin pa nye bar 'jig pa'i skyes bus ma byas pas ci zhig bya /
translated: The person who is a valid being is the cause of knowing things as they are. But what is the use of a person who is not a creator and who is already established?

original: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rtag pa yang don med par 'gyur du 'ong bas rig byed thams @167b cad du nus par khas len par byed na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar
analyzed: ci ste mi rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba dang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid rtag pa yang don med par 'gyur du 'ong bas rig byed thams @167b cad du nus par khas len par byed na de'i tshe snga ma bzhin du skyon du thal bar
translated: But if you accept that all Vedas are capable of being created because it would follow that they are impermanent and it would follow that being uncreated is meaningless, then the error stated previouslyüîΩwould follow.

original: 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says:

original: gal te kun du 'di nus na //
analyzed: gal te kun du 'di nus na //
translated: If you accept that they are all capable of being created,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: then the error stated previously would follow.

original: 'di snyam du skyes bu la ltos pa na skyes bus ma byas pa don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du skyes bu la ltos pa na skyes bus ma byas pa don med pa ma yin te /
translated: If you think that if they depend on a person, then it is not meaningless that they are uncreated by a person,

original: 'di ltar ji ltar gnas pa'i don nyid skyes bu dag gis gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar gnas pa'i don nyid skyes bu dag gis gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: then just as things exist, people make them clear.

original: snga na med pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But they do not make that which did not previously exist.

original: snga na med pa byed pa yin na 'di dag rang dbang can du khas len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: snga na med pa byed pa yin na 'di dag rang dbang can du khas len par 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are creators of something that did not previously exist, then they would be independent.

original: de lta yin dang 'dod chags la sogs pas bslad par thos pa phyin ci log gi don du 'god par byed pa su zhig gis gegs byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'dod chags la sogs pas bslad par thos pa phyin ci log gi don du 'god par byed pa su zhig gis gegs byed par 'gyur /
translated: If that were so, then who would prevent the corrupted from positing the meaning of the false scriptures as the meaning of the scriptures?

original: skyes bus 'chad par byed na yang skyon de nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bus 'chad par byed na yang skyon de nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The same error would apply even if a person were to explain it.üîΩTo demonstrate this, it says:

original: rang dbang skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: rang dbang skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If a person were independent,

original: gzhan yang gang zhig rig byed kyi don 'chad par byed pa rig byed kyi don dbang po las 'das par rang dbang du yongs su shes pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zhig rig byed kyi don 'chad par byed pa rig byed kyi don dbang po las 'das par rang dbang du yongs su shes pa'i skyes bu 'ga' zhig khas blangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is not accepted that some person who explains the meaning of the Vedas has independent knowledge of the meaning of the Vedas that is beyond the senses.

original: 'di ltar 'di rig byed kyi don yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid yin gyi rang dbang du ni ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di rig byed kyi don yongs su shes pa'i sgo nas dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba nyid yin gyi rang dbang du ni ma yin la /
translated: In this way, it is through knowing the meaning of the Vedas that he sees the meaning that is beyond the senses, but not independently.

original: rig byed kyi don yongs su shes pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba med par ma yin pa'i phyir gsal rab tu phan tshun bsten pa nyid 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu gcig kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te
analyzed: rig byed kyi don yongs su shes pa yang dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong ba med par ma yin pa'i phyir gsal rab tu phan tshun bsten pa nyid 'jug pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir skyes bu gcig kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te
translated: In order to demonstrate that the understanding of the meaning of the Vedas is not without seeing the meaning that transcends the senses, he says, ‚ÄúEven a single person,‚Äù and so on.

original: / 'di la skul bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pas skul byed med pa'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: / 'di la skul bar byed pa yod pa ma yin pas skul byed med pa'i shes pa ste /
translated: Here, since there is no instigator, there is cognition without an instigator.

original: skul bar byed pa la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skul bar byed pa la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it does not depend on an instigator.

original: 'di la rgyu smras pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu smras pa ni gang phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The reason for this is stated: ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: 'di yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is this?

original: 'di ltar rtag pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa'i tshig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn this way, the words are permanent,‚Äù and so on.üîΩTherefore, the one who sees

original: de ni / de'i phyir dbang po las 'das don //
analyzed: de ni / de'i phyir dbang po las 'das don //
translated: the meaning that transcends the senses

original: dngos su mthong ba po yod min //
analyzed: dngos su mthong ba po yod min //
translated: does not actually exist.üîΩThe words

original: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis ni //
translated: are permanent.

original: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bshad do //
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bshad do //
translated: The one who sees sees.

original: 'di snyam du rig byed rang nyid skyes bu'i bya ba la ma ltos par skyes bu 'di la rang gi don rtogs par byed pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rig byed rang nyid skyes bu'i bya ba la ma ltos par skyes bu 'di la rang gi don rtogs par byed pa /
translated: If you think that the Veda itself, without depending on the activity of a person, causes the understanding of its own meaning for this person,

original: de'i phyir phan tshun bsten par thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'jug go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan tshun bsten par thal bar 'gyur ba mi 'jug go snyam du sems na /
translated: then the consequence of mutual dependence would not follow.

original: gang gi tshe skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe skyes bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: When you say ‚Äúa person,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar rig byed ni dbang po thos pa na brda mi shes pa la rang nyid rang gi don rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed ni dbang po thos pa na brda mi shes pa la rang nyid rang gi don rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the Veda itself does not cause the understanding of its own meaning for one who does not know the language, when the sense faculty of hearing is operative.

original: ci zhig byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig byed ce na /
translated: What does it do?

original: long ba 'khar ba thogs pa ltar //üîΩzhes bya ba @168a * //üîΩla sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: long ba 'khar ba thogs pa ltar // zhes bya ba @168a * // la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is like a blind person holding a stick.üîΩIt is like a blind person holding a stick.

original: long ba 'khar ba thogs pa ni bzung ba ste /
analyzed: long ba 'khar ba thogs pa ni bzung ba ste /
translated: The blind person is held by the stick, and the stick is held by the blind person.

original: de dang 'dra'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de dang 'dra'o zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the way the sentence is to be analyzed.

original: de la ltos pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
analyzed: de la ltos pa la skyon ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with depending on that?

original: de ni de yis drangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni de yis drangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is drawn by that,‚Äù etc.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the Veda.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bshad pas so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i bshad pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù refers to the explanation of the person.

original: lam log par ni lhung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lam log par ni lhung bar 'gyur //
translated: ‚ÄúThey fall into a false path‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log gi don gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that it clarifies the meaning of error.üîΩAnd also,

original: gang yang / de phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi //
analyzed: gang yang / de phyir 'jig rten thams cad kyi //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore, in all the world,

original: mig gcig snang 'dra'i rig byed la //
analyzed: mig gcig snang 'dra'i rig byed la //
translated: the Vedas are like the eye;

original: long bar rtogs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: long bar rtogs par mi bya'o //
translated: they should not be considered blind.‚Äù

original: zhes smras pa de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes smras pa de mi 'thad do //
translated: That is not tenable.

original: rang dbang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs kyi don mjug sdud par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rang dbang can zhes bya ba la sogs pas skabs kyi don mjug sdud par byed pa yin te /
translated: The summary of the point of the chapter is stated by ‚ÄúIndependent‚Äù and so on.

original: nus pa ni skyes bu la ltos nas shes pa skyed par byad pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: nus pa ni skyes bu la ltos nas shes pa skyed par byad pa nyid du mi rigs so zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has been demonstrated that it is not tenable that the power to generate consciousness depends on the person.

original: skyes bu ltos nas nus pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid yin du chug mod de lta na yang skyes bu la ltos pa'i phyir shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin na yang gsal bar 'di'i tshad ma nyid srid pa ma yin zhes tshig gi don sbyar
analyzed: skyes bu ltos nas nus pa yang skyed par byed pa nyid yin du chug mod de lta na yang skyes bu la ltos pa'i phyir shes pa skyed par byed pa nyid yin na yang gsal bar 'di'i tshad ma nyid srid pa ma yin zhes tshig gi don sbyar
translated: Even if it were the case that the power to generate consciousness depends on the person, still, because it depends on the person, it is not possible for it to be a valid cognition that generates consciousness. This is the meaning of the words.

original: bar bya'o // yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du ste /
analyzed: bar bya'o // yang gi sgra ni rim pa gzhan du ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is in a different order.

original: shes pa skyed par byed pa na yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa skyed par byed pa na yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be read at the end of ‚Äúwhen it generates consciousness.‚Äù

original: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji bzhin don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji bzhin don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to clarify this point, he says, ‚ÄúWhen one understands the meaning as it is,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di yi tshad ma brtag mi legs //
analyzed: 'di yi tshad ma brtag mi legs //
translated: It is not good to analyze its validity.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: de ni de yis drangs pa na //
analyzed: de ni de yis drangs pa na //
translated: it is drawn by that.

original: lam log par ni lhung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: lam log par ni lhung bar 'gyur //
translated: One will fall into a wrong path.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar mi legs pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis sngar mi legs pa bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This has already been explained as a fault above.üîΩThus,

original: de ltar yin dang / rig byed tshad mar gnas pa na //
analyzed: de ltar yin dang / rig byed tshad mar gnas pa na //
translated: when the Vedas are valid,

original: slob dpon slob ma'i brgyud pa ni //üîΩthog ma med pa rtogs pa yang //
analyzed: slob dpon slob ma'i brgyud pa ni // thog ma med pa rtogs pa yang //
translated: the lineage of teachers and studentsüîΩis understood to be beginningless.

original: skyon med nyid du 'gyur ba yin //üîΩzhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon med nyid du 'gyur ba yin // zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: This is faultless.

original: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is illogical, he says, ‚ÄúThus, first,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi gnas zhes bya ba 'dir dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas zhes bya ba 'dir dgag pa'i tshig gdon par bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt does not endure‚Äù should be supplied here.

original: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: Why is it unreasonable?

original: gang phyir de dag ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: gang phyir de dag ces bya ba smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause they are not valid regarding that. ‚Äù

original: gal te long ba brgyud par gyur ba yin pa na de las cir 'gyur zhe na /üîΩlong bas long ba khrid pa na //
analyzed: gal te long ba brgyud par gyur ba yin pa na de las cir 'gyur zhe na / long bas long ba khrid pa na //
translated: If they are like a series of blind people, what follows from that?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúA blind man leading a blind man. ‚Äù

original: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: As it is said in the Explanation of the Forest of Logic:

original: gzugs kyi khyad par dag la dmus long rnams kyi tshig bzhin du de lta bu'i rigs can gyi don la skyes bu'i tshig tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khyad par dag la dmus long rnams kyi tshig bzhin du de lta bu'i rigs can gyi don la skyes bu'i tshig tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the words of the blind are regarding the distinctions of form, so the words of a person are not valid regarding the meaning of that type. ‚Äù

original: de ltar slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel @168b pa thog ma med pa nyid du grub par khas blangs nas skyon bshad la /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon dang slob ma'i 'brel @168b pa thog ma med pa nyid du grub par khas blangs nas skyon bshad la /
translated: Having thus accepted that the relationship of master and disciple is beginningless, he explains the error.

original: de ni de yang ma grub po //
analyzed: de ni de yang ma grub po //
translated: But that is not established.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,

original: rig byed de nyid shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rig byed de nyid shes pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe Vedas are not valid regarding that. ‚Äù

original: tshad ma med ces bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med ces bya ba ni shin tu lkog tu gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNot valid‚Äù means that they are not valid regarding that which is extremely obscure.

original: 'di snyam du phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di snyam du phyin ci ma log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyi tshad ma nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not maintained that a means of valid cognition is non-artificial because it is the cause of non-erroneous cognition.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: bden pa'i don can gyi sgra don gyi 'brel ba brtag pa tsam gyis so //
analyzed: bden pa'i don can gyi sgra don gyi 'brel ba brtag pa tsam gyis so //
translated: It is merely the investigation of the connection between the word and the object that has a true object.

original: de yang skyes bus ma byas na yang 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de yang skyes bus ma byas na yang 'gyur ba yin no snyam du sems na /
translated: And that is also the case even if it is not artificial.

original: 'di yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ma nges pa nyid yin te /
translated: This is also uncertain.

original: skyes bus ma byas pas bden pa'i don can du 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pas bden pa'i don can du 'gyur bar bya dgos so zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di la nges pa'i rgyu ci zhig yod /
translated: What is the reason for this certainty that it is necessary that it be non-artificial in order to have a true object?üîΩEven if it were to exist, it would still be faulty.

original: yod du chug mod de lta na yang skyon can nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod du chug mod de lta na yang skyon can nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: yang na bden don 'brel brtags pa //
analyzed: yang na bden don 'brel brtags pa //
translated: Or else, the connection with the object of truth is investigated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The word ‚Äúor else‚Äù has the sense of ‚Äúif.‚Äù

original: 'di ni bden don yang yin la 'brel pa brtags pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni bden don yang yin la 'brel pa brtags pa yang yin no zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: This is the connection with the object of truth and the investigation of the connection.

original: 'brel ba brtag pa brtags pa yin na yang gal te 'di don rtogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe de brtags pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba brtag pa brtags pa yin na yang gal te 'di don rtogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba de'i tshe de brtags pa don med pa yin no //
translated: If the investigation of the connection is not the cause of the understanding of the meaning, then the investigation is pointless.

original: don rtogs par byed pa yin skyed par byed pa nyid las ma gtogs pa de'i ngo bo gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rtogs par byed pa yin skyed par byed pa nyid las ma gtogs pa de'i ngo bo gzhan yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: And the cause of the understanding of the meaning is not anything other than the production of the understanding.

original: 'brel ba'i bya ba ni 'di tsam nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i bya ba ni 'di tsam nyid yin te /
translated: The function of the connection is just this:

original: rtogs pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa skyed par byed pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: it is the cause of the production of the understanding.

original: de mi byed na ji ltar 'brel bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de mi byed na ji ltar 'brel bar 'gyur /
translated: If it does not perform that function, how can it be a connection?

original: 'di yod pa tsam gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di yod pa tsam gyis don rtogs pa'i rgyu yang ma yin no //
translated: The mere existence of the connection is not the cause of the understanding of the meaning.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then is?

original: shes pa yod na'o //
analyzed: shes pa yod na'o //
translated: The existence of the cognition.

original: de lta ma yin na 'brel ba ma bzung ba la yang de las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'brel ba ma bzung ba la yang de las rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, even when the connection is not apprehended, there would be an understanding of the meaning.

original: 'di sus kyang shes par nus pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di sus kyang shes par nus pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not possible for anyone to know the connection,

original: 'brel ba can mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyis te de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel ba can mtho ris la sogs pa dbang po las 'das pa nyid kyis te de yang dbang po las 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the connected things, such as heaven, are beyond the senses, and the connection itself is also beyond the senses.

original: 'o na de dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong bas shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dbang po las 'das pa'i don mthong bas shes par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is known because it sees a transcendent object,üîΩthen the verse says, ‚ÄúAll these people . . . .‚Äù

original: skyes bu 'di kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di kun zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: And it is said:

original: de ni / de'i phyir dbang po las 'das don //
analyzed: de ni / de'i phyir dbang po las 'das don //
translated: Therefore, a transcendent object

original: dngos su mthong ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: dngos su mthong ba yod ma yin //
translated: is not directly seen.

original: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis na //
analyzed: tshig ni rtag pa nyid kyis na //
translated: Because the words are permanent,

original: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo //üîΩzhes bshad de /
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba des mthong ngo // zhes bshad de /
translated: what is seen is seen by that.

original: lkog min mthong zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don mthong ba'o //
analyzed: lkog min mthong zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i don mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot hidden‚Äù means seen by the sense faculties.

original: thos pa rang nyid smra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: thos pa rang nyid smra bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that what is heard speaks for itself,

original: 'di ni bdag gi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the verse says, ‚ÄúThis is my object . . . .‚Äù

original: bram ze khyod tshur sheg bdag gi don 'di yin par @169a * //
analyzed: bram ze khyod tshur sheg bdag gi don 'di yin par @169a * //
translated: The verse means that a brahman should be told, ‚ÄúCome here! This is my object.

original: zung shig ces pos nas snying rje ches cher 'phel bas bsod nams la sems gcig tu 'dud pa can gzhan la phan pa'i mthar thug pa'i bden par smra ba bzhin du /
analyzed: zung shig ces pos nas snying rje ches cher 'phel bas bsod nams la sems gcig tu 'dud pa can gzhan la phan pa'i mthar thug pa'i bden par smra ba bzhin du /
translated: Take it!‚Äù Then, with compassion increasing more and more, one should speak the truth, with a mind focused on merit, for the sake of others, to the best of one‚Äôs ability.

original: rig byed rang nyid bram ze rnams kyi don du rang gi don ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig byed rang nyid bram ze rnams kyi don du rang gi don ston par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Vedas themselves do not teach their own meaning for the sake of the Brahmins.

original: 'o na skyes bu rnams rang nyid rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na skyes bu rnams rang nyid rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Well, then, people themselves would understand!

original: skyes bu brtags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bu brtags pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe meaning of the words is not understood without a person,‚Äù and so on.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: He shows that they are not different:

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as,‚Äù and so on.

original: ci nas kyang ma 'chol ba'i don shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'chol ba'i rgyu skyes bu spong ba yin no //
analyzed: ci nas kyang ma 'chol ba'i don shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir 'chol ba'i rgyu skyes bu spong ba yin no //
translated: Since the meaning is not understood without a person, the cause of the confusion, a person, is rejected.

original: de la ji ltar skyes bu dag gis rang nyid kyis sbyar ba'i sgra dag 'chol bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de dag gis nye bar brtags pa'i don yang yin pa'i phyir 'di la khyad par ci yod de /
analyzed: de la ji ltar skyes bu dag gis rang nyid kyis sbyar ba'i sgra dag 'chol bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du de dag gis nye bar brtags pa'i don yang yin pa'i phyir 'di la khyad par ci yod de /
translated: In that case, just as the words that people themselves employ become confused, so too the meaning that they designate would be the same. What is the difference here?

original: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa zhes bya ba ni dogs par bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúFearing‚Äù means fearing.

original: der zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log go //
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni phyin ci log go //
translated: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù means in error.

original: sngar rig byed tshad ma yin pa'i phyir slob dpon dang slob ma'i brgyud pa brtags pa don med do zhes bstan zin la /
analyzed: sngar rig byed tshad ma yin pa'i phyir slob dpon dang slob ma'i brgyud pa brtags pa don med do zhes bstan zin la /
translated: It has already been explained that because the Vedas are valid, it is pointless to examine the lineage of the teacher and the student.

original: da ni 'brel ba brtags pa'i sgo nas tshad ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: da ni 'brel ba brtags pa'i sgo nas tshad ma yin du chug mod /
translated: Now, even if it is granted that the Vedas are valid,

original: slob dpon dang slob ma gnyi ga'i brgyud pa brtags pa don med do zhes ston pa ni /üîΩrig byed tshad mar gnas na yang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon dang slob ma gnyi ga'i brgyud pa brtags pa don med do zhes ston pa ni / rig byed tshad mar gnas na yang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: it is pointless to examine the lineage of both the teacher and the student.

original: de ltar skyes bus brtags pa la'ang //üîΩci'i phyir dogs pa der mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bus brtags pa la'ang // ci'i phyir dogs pa der mi 'gyur //
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúEven if the Vedas are valid cognitions,‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes gang smras pa 'di la gzhan dag dogs pa mi rigs par ston pa ni 'on te spyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa 'di la gzhan dag dogs pa mi rigs par ston pa ni 'on te spyin sreg ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To demonstrate that it is illogical for others to doubt this, he says, ‚ÄúIf you doubt the Vedas,‚Äù and so on.

original: yid gnyis ni the tshom mo //
analyzed: yid gnyis ni the tshom mo //
translated: Doubt is uncertainty.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyin ci log gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni phyin ci log gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes error.

original: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod pa'i bshad pa las /
translated: As it says in the Explanation of the Forest of Logic:

original: mtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di las mtho ris 'byung ngam /
analyzed: mtho ris 'dod pas mchod sbyin bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di las mtho ris 'byung ngam /
translated: The words One should perform sacrifice in order to attain heaven do not give rise to the understanding that one should doubt whether or not heaven arises from that.

original: mi 'byung snyam pa'i the tshom rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / des par rtogs pa na 'di log par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi 'byung snyam pa'i the tshom rtogs par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bya ba dang / des par rtogs pa na 'di log par mi 'gyur la /
translated: When one understands it, one does not misunderstand it.

original: de ni de la ma yin no snyam du bskyed nas 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni log shes pa yin zhing /
analyzed: de ni de la ma yin no snyam du bskyed nas 'jig pa gang yin pa de ni log shes pa yin zhing /
translated: When one generates the thought It is not so, and then destroys it, that is a wrong consciousness.

original: 'di ni yul gzhan dang / dus gzhan dang / skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yul gzhan dang / dus gzhan dang / skyes bu gzhan la phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: It is not mistaken with respect to another object, another time, or another person.

original: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be nonerroneous.

original: gzhan du na mngon sum du na me stag 'phro ba'i tshogs kyi rgyun par du khyab cing rgyas pa'i me'i phung po khyed cag gis nyams su myong na yang ci'i phyir the tshom gyi dbyang thag g-yo ba'i yid du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na mngon sum du na me stag 'phro ba'i tshogs kyi rgyun par du khyab cing rgyas pa'i me'i phung po khyed cag gis nyams su myong na yang ci'i phyir the tshom gyi dbyang thag g-yo ba'i yid du 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, when you experience the mass of fire that spreads and expands in the form of a stream of sparks, why does your mind waver with the rope of doubt?

original: de lta yin dang khyod la 'ga' yang tshad @169b mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyod la 'ga' yang tshad @169b mar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsams pa'o //
translated: The opponent thinks, ‚ÄúIf that were so, then nothing would be valid cognition.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log dang bral ba'i shes pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig the tshom dang phyin ci log dang bral ba'i shes pa de ni rtog pa dang ldan pa'i tshad ma'i tha snyad kyi yul yin te /
translated: The argument is as follows: That cognition which is free from doubt and error is the object of the convention of valid cognition that is conceptual.

original: dper na me la 'khrul pa med pa can gyi gtso bo sreg pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba de nges pa'i rgyu'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na me la 'khrul pa med pa can gyi gtso bo sreg pa la sogs pa don du gnyer ba de nges pa'i rgyu'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the cognition that is the cause of the ascertainment of fire for one who is not confused about fire and who seeks to perform an action such as burning.

original: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las 'byung ba'i shes pa yang the tshom dang phyin ci log dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te /üîΩci nas tshad mar 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: me la sbyin sreg la sogs pa'i ngag las 'byung ba'i shes pa yang the tshom dang phyin ci log dang bral ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs te / ci nas tshad mar 'gyur ba yin //
translated: The cognition that arises from the statement ‚ÄúFire is for performing homa‚Äù is also free from doubt and error. This is a natural inference.

original: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di dang sbrel to //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is valid cognition‚Äù is connected to this.

original: de byed pa na zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
analyzed: de byed pa na zhes bya ba ni blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it is produced‚Äù refers to the mind.

original: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: de min zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that‚Äù and so on responds to that.

original: gal te re zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa'i the tshom la sogs pa dang bral ba'i shes pa rig byed kyi tshig las 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin no de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gal te re zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa'i the tshom la sogs pa dang bral ba'i shes pa rig byed kyi tshig las 'byung ba yin no zhes bya ba gtan tshigs kyi don yin no de'i tshe gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid yin te /
translated: If the meaning of the reason is that the cognition that arises from the words of the Vedas is, for the time being, free from doubt and so on, then the reason is not established.

original: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba de las gzhan gyi tshig phyin ci log la sogs pa bzhin du me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba de las kyang the tshom mtshungsüîΩpa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtogs pa dang ldan pa me la sbyin sreg byas pa las mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba de las gzhan gyi tshig phyin ci log la sogs pa bzhin du me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su skye'o zhes bya ba de las kyang the tshom mtshungs pa nyid yin te /
translated: For example, a person who has knowledge of the Vedas may have doubt about the statement ‚ÄúOne is born in the higher realms through fire sacrifice,‚Äù just as he would about the words of another person.
