original: dbang po las 'das pa'i don la yod pa dang med par nges rgyu med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa'i don la yod pa dang med par nges rgyu med pa'i phyir la /
translated: The reason is not established because there is no way to ascertain the existence or nonexistence of a transcendent object.

original: don la mi slu ba ni gnyi ga la yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don la mi slu ba ni gnyi ga la yang ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the reason is not nondeceptive with regard to the object, because neither is observed.

original: phyin ci log gang gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: phyin ci log gang gzhan bzhin no //
translated: It is just like any other misconception.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i mtha' can yin pa'i phyir gzhan rkyen yin no //üîΩci ste yang rigs byed kyi tshig nyid las nges par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdun pa'i mtha' can yin pa'i phyir gzhan rkyen yin no // ci ste yang rigs byed kyi tshig nyid las nges par 'gyur te /
translated: This is because it ends with the seventh case.

original: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan btsal bas ci zhig bya snyam na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu gzhan btsal bas ci zhig bya snyam na /
translated: But if it is ascertained from the words of the Veda itself, then what is the use of seeking another cause?

original: de'i phyir gzhan 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To this he says, ‚ÄúIt is just like the other,‚Äù etc.

original: gzhan 'dra zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi don las phyin ci log gi don zhen pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'dra zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi don las phyin ci log gi don zhen pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is just like the other‚Äù means that the ascertainment is of a meaning that is contrary to the meaning of the Veda.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù means from a human source.

original: cis mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cis mi 'gyur te 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why would it not be so? It would be so, he says.

original: de lta yin dang de yang tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang de yang tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: If that were so, then that [human source] would be a valid cognition.

original: gnyi ga la yang de'i tshe gnod pa mi dmigs par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang de'i tshe gnod pa mi dmigs par khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time there is no difference between the two, since neither is contradicted.

original: ci ste rtog pa dang ldan pa thos pa rnams kyis shes pa g-yo ba med pa nyid skye bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rtog pa dang ldan pa thos pa rnams kyis shes pa g-yo ba med pa nyid skye bas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ma grub pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the reason is not unestablished because a non-moving cognition arises in the learned who have conceptual thoughts,

original: skye mod de lta na yang gal te ma grub pa ma 'gyur na ma nges pa ni mi zlogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir dad pa'i dbang gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skye mod de lta na yang gal te ma grub pa ma 'gyur na ma nges pa ni mi zlogs so zhes bstan pa'i phyir dad pa'i dbang gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then although it does arise, if it were not unestablished, it would not be indeterminate. To show this, he says, ‚ÄúControlled by faith,‚Äù etc.

original: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas @170a * //üîΩpa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas @170a * // pa la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOf another‚Äù refers to the Buddhas, etc.

original: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni srog chags gsod pa dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin las ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i ngag las so //
analyzed: gzhan las zhes bya ba ni srog chags gsod pa dang ldan pa'i mchod sbyin las ngan song gi sdug bsngal 'byung ngo zhes bya ba'i ngag las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom another‚Äù refers to the statement, ‚ÄúFrom a sacrifice that involves killing living beings, suffering in the lower realms arises.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i blo'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba med pa'i blo'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the non-moving cognition.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
translated: This is shown by the words,

original: ngan song sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
analyzed: ngan song sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
translated: ‚ÄúThe suffering of the lower realms,‚Äù etc. It is easy to understand.

original: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yi ma nges pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yi ma nges pa ston pa ni /
translated: Again, to show that it is not established that it is not produced by a person, he says,

original: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: If you say that the meaning of the Veda is not understood because of the absence of a person who desires to explain it, then the Veda would not be the means of knowing its own meaning, because it is dependent on the desire of a person.üîΩIf you say that the meaning of the Veda is not understood because of the absence of a person who desires to explain it, then the Veda would not be the means of knowing its own meaning, because it is dependent on the desire of a person.

original: 'dod pa rang dbang can yin pa'i phyir rig byed la rag las pa'i brda las ltos pa dang bcas pa rang gi don gsal bar byed pa 'dod pa'i don gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur te /üîΩnges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa rang dbang can yin pa'i phyir rig byed la rag las pa'i brda las ltos pa dang bcas pa rang gi don gsal bar byed pa 'dod pa'i don gsal bar byed par mi 'gyur te / nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of the Veda is not understood because of the absence of a person who desires to explain it, because the desire of a person is independent.

original: gang gi tshe de la ltos pa med pa'i rig byed kyi don gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe tshad mar rigs te /üîΩskyes bu'i bshad pa khyad par du bshad nas /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de la ltos pa med pa'i rig byed kyi don gsal bar byed pa de'i tshe tshad mar rigs te / skyes bu'i bshad pa khyad par du bshad nas /
translated: If the meaning of the Veda were understood without dependence on that, then it would be reasonable that the Veda is the means of knowing its own meaning.

original: ches myur bar rang gi don rtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ches myur bar rang gi don rtogs pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it generates the understanding of its own meaning very quickly, after explaining the meaning of the Veda in a special way.

original: gzhan du 'chad na yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rang gi don gsal bar byed pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan du 'chad na yang mig la sogs pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis rang gi don gsal bar byed pa mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don to //
translated: If it were explained otherwise, then it would not be accepted that the meaning of the Veda is understood by nature, like the eye and so on. This is the summarized meaning.

original: bshad pa bya na zhes bya ba ni rnam par bshad na'o //
analyzed: bshad pa bya na zhes bya ba ni rnam par bshad na'o //
translated: If it is to be explained means if it is to be explained in detail.

original: myur du zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par te skad cig gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myur du zhes bya ba ni mgyogs par te skad cig gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúQuickly‚Äù means rapidly, in an instant.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa de ni phyin ci log yin no //
translated: This desire of yours is mistaken.

original: rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi don dang 'brel ba yin du chug mod //
analyzed: rig byed skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyis rang bzhin gyi don dang 'brel ba yin du chug mod //
translated: Even if the Vedas are related to the meaning of their nature because they are not made by a person,

original: de lta na yang 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid sgrub par byed pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dod pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid sgrub par byed pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: still, because the desire is not fulfilled, the other proof of the uncertainty is stated, beginning with ‚ÄúMoreover.‚Äù

original: rang bzhin la yod pa ni rang bzhin can te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la yod pa ni rang bzhin can te /
translated: That which exists in the nature is natural.

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúown nature‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúown nature.‚Äù

original: tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bus byas pa nyid tshad ma'i rgyu khas blang bar bya ba'i rmongs pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i ma byas pa nyid kyis ci zhig bya ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad mar gyur pa'i skyes bus byas pa nyid tshad ma'i rgyu khas blang bar bya ba'i rmongs pa nyid du ston par byed pa'i ma byas pa nyid kyis ci zhig bya ba zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that the mere fact of being made by a person who is a valid person is to be accepted as the cause of validity, what is the point of the confusion itself, which is not made?

original: gzhan yang rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show this, it is said, ‚ÄúMoreover, the Vedas, etc.‚Äù

original: skyon med byed pa la sogs la //
analyzed: skyon med byed pa la sogs la //
translated: In order to make them faultless, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i sgras skyon med pa'i 'chad pa po gzung ngo //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sgras skyon med pa'i 'chad pa po gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù includes the faultless expounders.

original: yang na skyon med par byas pa dang 'chad pa yang ji ltar tshad ma nyid du grub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang na skyon med par byas pa dang 'chad pa yang ji ltar tshad ma nyid du grub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or, how can the faultless composition and exposition be established as valid cognition?

original: 'di ltar shes rab brtse sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes rab brtse sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, it is said: ‚ÄúThus, wisdom, compassion, etc.‚Äù

original: ji skad du ri khrod rjes /
analyzed: ji skad du ri khrod rjes /
translated: As the Lord of Hermits said:

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshig gang yin pa de yang gal te yid ches pa'i skyes bu las dbang po'i yul nyid yid yin na de ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshig gang yin pa de yang gal te yid ches pa'i skyes bu las dbang po'i yul nyid yid yin na de ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no zhes bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúWhatever worldly words there are, if they are from a trustworthy person, and if they are the object of the senses, then they are non-erroneous.‚Äù

original: @170b tshig mchog ces bya ba ni bzad pa'o //
analyzed: @170b tshig mchog ces bya ba ni bzad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSupreme words‚Äù means excellent.

original: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to show that the non-human authorship is uncertain, it is said:

original: skyes bus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot composed by humans,‚Äù etc.

original: skyes bu'i nyes pa nye bar len pa nyid las don dag la shes pa 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes bu'i nyes pa nye bar len pa nyid las don dag la shes pa 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the cognition of objects is mistaken merely from the appropriation of human faults.

original: nags kyi me la sogs pa de dang bral ba rnams kyang autpala sngon po la sogs pa la phyin ci log gi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nags kyi me la sogs pa de dang bral ba rnams kyang autpala sngon po la sogs pa la phyin ci log gi shes pa skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even those that are devoid of that, such as the fire in the forest, generate erroneous cognition in regard to the blue lotus, etc.

original: nags kyi me ni nags na yod pa'i me'o //
analyzed: nags kyi me ni nags na yod pa'i me'o //
translated: The fire in the forest is the fire in the forest.

original: de yang rang nyid 'od ma la sogs pa drung pa las byung ba gang yin pa de 'dir 'khrul ba'i yul nyid du lta bar bya'i gang gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i skyes bus byas pa de la skyes bus ma byas pa mi srid pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs 'khrul
analyzed: de yang rang nyid 'od ma la sogs pa drung pa las byung ba gang yin pa de 'dir 'khrul ba'i yul nyid du lta bar bya'i gang gtsub shing gtsubs pa'i skyes bus byas pa de la skyes bus ma byas pa mi srid pa'i phyir des gtan tshigs 'khrul
translated: And that which arises from the friction of kindling wood, etc., is regarded here as the object of error, but not that which is produced by the friction of the kindling wood by a person, because it is impossible that it is not produced by a person. Thus, it is not the case that the reason is erroneous.

original: pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the idea.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni smig rgyu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni smig rgyu la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes mirages, etc.

original: log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The reason why it is the cause of erroneous cognition is shown by:

original: me'i snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: me'i snang ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of fire,‚Äù etc.

original: ci de yang kho bo cag gis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid 'ba' zhig rgyu nyid du mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: ci de yang kho bo cag gis skyes bus ma byas pa nyid 'ba' zhig rgyu nyid du mi brjod kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúBut is it not the case that we do not say that only the non-produced by a person is the cause?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: ma byas pa nyid yin na zhes khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'am /
analyzed: ma byas pa nyid yin na zhes khyad par dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'am /
translated: If it is not produced, it is qualified by that.

original: yang na skyes bus ma byas pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /üîΩde'i phyir ma byas pa'i nags kyi mes 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i gzhan gyi lan dogs par byas pa'i phyir gal te me la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yang na skyes bus ma byas pa smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa ste / de'i phyir ma byas pa'i nags kyi mes 'khrul pa ma yin no snyam du sems pa'i gzhan gyi lan dogs par byas pa'i phyir gal te me la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Or, the statement that it is not produced by a person is a mere example.üîΩTherefore, it is not a mistake that the forest fire is not produced.

original: de'i rgyu ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The opponent thinks this, but in order to suspect that this is a reply, it is said, ‚ÄúIf fire and so on are produced by the power of their causes, then the causes of that fire and so on are the causes of wrong consciousness.‚Äù

original: don rnams kyis ni byas nyid ci //
analyzed: don rnams kyis ni byas nyid ci //
translated: The object is produced by the power of its causes.üîΩThe reply is stated by ‚ÄúHow are objects produced by the power of their causes?‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: and so on.

original: gtan tshigs mi ma thun pa'i phyogs las rnam par gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de khyad par yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi ma thun pa'i phyogs las rnam par gcod par byed pa gang yin pa de khyad par yin te /
translated: That which is the reason that distinguishes it from the dissimilar class is the qualifier.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te gang yang rung ba'i khyad kyis khyad par du byas pa'i gtan tshigs mtha' gcig tu gyur ba nyid yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te gang yang rung ba'i khyad kyis khyad par du byas pa'i gtan tshigs mtha' gcig tu gyur ba nyid yin na de'i tshe gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were not so, if the reason were qualified by some particular, then at that time, no reason would be uncertain at all,

original: 'dod pa dang 'brel ba nyid kyis thams cad khyad par rnyed bar bla ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang 'brel ba nyid kyis thams cad khyad par rnyed bar bla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because everything would be found to be qualified by the related object of desire.

original: rig byed kyis khyad par ma byas pa nyid ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig byed kyis khyad par ma byas pa nyid ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid zlog par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere fact that the Vedas are not qualified by a reason does not refute the fact that they are the cause of wrong knowledge.

original: 'di ltar gal te byas pa nyid log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du grub par gyur na de'i tshe bzlog pa na de yang zlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te byas pa nyid log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid du grub par gyur na de'i tshe bzlog pa na de yang zlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if the fact that they are produced were established as the cause of wrong knowledge, then when that is refuted, that would also be refuted.

original: gzhan dag re 'ga' grub pa nyid do zhes brjod par byed na /üîΩde lta yin na du ba me'i //
analyzed: gzhan dag re 'ga' grub pa nyid do zhes brjod par byed na / de lta yin na du ba me'i //
translated: If others say that sometimes it is established,üîΩthen it is as said:

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúSmoke and so on are not the cause of fire and so on.‚Äù

original: gal te byas pa log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin na de'i tshe ma byas @171a * //
analyzed: gal te byas pa log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin na de'i tshe ma byas @171a * //
translated: If the fact that they are produced were the cause of wrong knowledge, then at that time, the fact that they are not produced

original: ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba thob ste /
analyzed: ba yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin no zhes bya ba thob ste /
translated: and the cause of right knowledge.

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa dag ni rgyu gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i yang dag pa dang log pa'i shes pa dag ni rgyu gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that right and wrong knowledge, which are mutually contradictory, have the same cause.

original: dro ba'i reg pa'i rgyu me ni grang ba'i rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dro ba'i reg pa'i rgyu me ni grang ba'i rgyu nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that fire, the cause of the sensation of heat, is the cause of cold.

original: de lta yin dang byas pa'i phyir du ba me la ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang byas pa'i phyir du ba me la ci lta ba bzhin du rtogs pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, smoke would not be the cause of the knowledge of fire because it is produced.

original: yang ci ste byas pa nyid log pa'i shes pa kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: yang ci ste byas pa nyid log pa'i shes pa kho na'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: But if you say that production is the cause of wrong knowledge alone,

original: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ni ma yin no zhes nges par bzung ba ni ma yin no //
translated: and not of other knowledge, then you have not ascertained that.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: byas pa kho na log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: byas pa kho na log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: Production is the cause of wrong knowledge alone,

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gzhan gyi rgyu can 'gegs par byed pa yin gyi byas pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa 'gegs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di gzhan gyi rgyu can 'gegs par byed pa yin gyi byas pa yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin pa 'gegs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: and not of other knowledge. This is a negation that has another cause. It does not negate that production is the cause of right knowledge.

original: gang gis yang dag pa'i shes pa dang log pa'i rgyu dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir shugs kyis byas pa las bzlog pa yang dag pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba byas pa thams cad khyad par med par log pa'i rgyud nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi
analyzed: gang gis yang dag pa'i shes pa dang log pa'i rgyu dag phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir shugs kyis byas pa las bzlog pa yang dag pa'i rgyu nyid du 'gyur ba byas pa thams cad khyad par med par log pa'i rgyud nyid du 'dod pa ni ma yin gyi
translated: But it is not asserted that all that is produced is an incorrect cause without distinction.

original: / 'on kyang byas pa rnam pa mang po tha dad pa'i phyir cung zad cig log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: / 'on kyang byas pa rnam pa mang po tha dad pa'i phyir cung zad cig log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: However, because there are many different types of production, some are causes of incorrect consciousness.

original: dper na mig ser la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mig ser la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, jaundice.

original: cung zad cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: cung zad cig ni yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Some are causes of correct consciousness.

original: dper na dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mnyam pa lta bu'o //üîΩde lta ma yin na grang ba'i reg pa la kha ba la sogs pas byas pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na dbang po la sogs pa'i tshogs pa mnyam pa lta bu'o // de lta ma yin na grang ba'i reg pa la kha ba la sogs pas byas pa'i rgyu 'ga' zhig dmigs pa'i phyir /
translated: For example, the assembly of sense faculties and so on.

original: shugs kyis grang ba dang 'gal ba'i dro ba'i reg pa la ma byas pa'i rgyu nyid du brtag par bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: shugs kyis grang ba dang 'gal ba'i dro ba'i reg pa la ma byas pa'i rgyu nyid du brtag par bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If that were not so, then because some cause of cold touch, such as snow, would be observed, by implication, that which is not produced would be a cause of warm touch, which is incompatible with cold.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.üîΩTherefore, since the reason for the correctness of the product is not refuted, smoke is a correct reason.

original: de lta bas na byas pa yang dag pa'i shes pa la rgyu nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir du ba yang dag rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa 'di bsu nas /
analyzed: de lta bas na byas pa yang dag pa'i shes pa la rgyu nyid ma bkag pa'i phyir du ba yang dag rgyu mtshan du 'gyur ro snyam pa'i dogs pa 'di bsu nas /
translated: To anticipate this qualm, he says,

original: de ltar skyes bus ma byas na //
analyzed: de ltar skyes bus ma byas na //
translated: If it is not produced by a person,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te byas pa yang dag pa dang log pa nyid gnyi ga'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
analyzed: gal te byas pa yang dag pa dang log pa nyid gnyi ga'i rgyu mtshan yin na /
translated: If the correctness or incorrectness of the product were the reason,

original: de log pa na log pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis ldog par byed pa'i phyir rig byed ma byas pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de log pa na log pa dang yang dag pa'i shes pa gnyis ldog par byed pa'i phyir rig byed ma byas pa nyid kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa'i rgyur gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: then when it is incorrect, both incorrect and correct consciousnesses would be reversed, and so the nonproduct of the Vedas would not be a basis for correct consciousness,

original: de de la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de la rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would not be the reason for that.

original: de lta yin dang khyad par don med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang khyad par don med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: If that were the case, the reason would be indefinite because the distinction would be pointless.

original: yang / ci ste skyes bus ma byas pa //
analyzed: yang / ci ste skyes bus ma byas pa //
translated: Moreover, if it is not produced by a person,

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ston pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ji skad du bshad pa'i gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa ston pa ma yin no //
translated: This does not indicate the pervasion and counter-pervasion of the reason as it has been explained.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: @171b 'di ni ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: @171b 'di ni ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba nyid yin te /
translated: This is a negative application.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs las bzlog pa byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya las bzlog pa log pa nyid la khyab pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs las bzlog pa byas pa nyid kyis bsgrub bya las bzlog pa log pa nyid la khyab pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the opposite of the reason, being produced, pervades the opposite of the probandum, impermanent,

original: skyes bus byas pa kho na la log pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa kho na la log pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because only what is produced is seen to be impermanent.üîΩIf that is so, then where the pervader of impermanent, being produced, exists, there its opposite, non-produced, exists.

original: de lta yin dang gang du log pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba ma byas pa nyid yod pa de dang 'gal ba'i log pa nyid kyi khyab par byed pa byas pa nyid ldog pa ma khyab par bya ba log pa nyid kyang shugs kyis
analyzed: de lta yin dang gang du log pa nyid kyis khyab par byed pa dang 'gal ba ma byas pa nyid yod pa de dang 'gal ba'i log pa nyid kyi khyab par byed pa byas pa nyid ldog pa ma khyab par bya ba log pa nyid kyang shugs kyis
translated: And where the pervader of impermanent, being produced, exists, there its opposite, non-produced, does not exist.

original: ldog pa grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med na yang shugs kyis ma byas pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med na yang shugs kyis ma byas pa bden pa'i don can du 'gyur ba'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med pa yin no snyam na /
translated: Because the contrapositive is established, even if there is no pervasion, since the meaning of the non-affirming negation would be truly established, it is pointless to teach the pervasion.

original: gal te bzlog pa'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bzlog pa'i khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub par gyur na /
translated: If the relation of the predicate and the reason as the pervader and the pervaded were established,

original: de lta bu de yang bden na //
analyzed: de lta bu de yang bden na //
translated: then that would be true.

original: de ni grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni grub pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is not established.

original: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te bsgrub bya'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yod par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if there were a valid cognition that undermined the reason in regard to the discordant class of the proposition,

original: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyab par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyab par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then at that time there would be a pervasion of the discordant class.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin no ;
translated: But that does not exist.

original: / mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: / mi dmigs pa tsam gyis med pa grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nonexistence is not established by mere non-apprehension,

original: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is mistaken.

original: 'di snyam du ma byas pa dang 'gal ba'i byas pa la log pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir shugs kyis ma byas pa la de med par grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du ma byas pa dang 'gal ba'i byas pa la log pa nyid mthong ba'i phyir shugs kyis ma byas pa la de med par grub par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that since you see the opposite of non-production, i.e., production, in contradiction to non-production, you thereby implicitly establish that production does not exist in the absence of non-production,

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not correct.

original: gcig tu mthong ba gzhan du nges pa med par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig tu mthong ba gzhan du nges pa med par bya bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Because you cannot ascertain that what is seen in one way is otherwise,

original: gcig kyang 'gal ba'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang 'gal ba'i khyab par byed pa nyid du mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because you see that very thing which is seen in one way as the very thing that is pervaded by the contradictory.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa gcig nyid brtsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / cig shos 'gal ba dag la khyab par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa gcig nyid brtsal ma thag tu byung ba dang / cig shos 'gal ba dag la khyab par mthong ste /
translated: Thus, you see that the very same impermanence is seen to pervade the two, that which arises immediately after exertion and that which is contradictory to it.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rtsol ba las byung ba la mthong zhes te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rtsol ba las byung ba la mthong zhes te /
translated: You see impermanence as that which arises from exertion,

original: rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa la de med par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsol ba las byung ba ma yin pa la de med par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: but you do not see that it does not exist in that which does not arise from exertion.

original: gzhan yang de la mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis /
analyzed: gzhan yang de la mthong ba zhes bya ba de tsam gyis /
translated: Moreover, in that regard, you cannot ascertain that

original: gal te log pa nyid la byas pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur na la lar bden pa nyid kyang skyes bus byas par mthong ba'i phyir de yang des khyab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te log pa nyid la byas pa nyid kyis khyab par 'gyur na la lar bden pa nyid kyang skyes bus byas par mthong ba'i phyir de yang des khyab par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were the case that all that is false is necessarily created by a person, then even truth would be seen to be created by a person, and therefore that would also be necessarily created by a person.

original: de lta yin dang byas pa nyid log pa na log pa nyid du bden pa yang ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir bden pa'i don can du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yin dang byas pa nyid log pa na log pa nyid du bden pa yang ldog pas skyes bus ma byas pa'i phyir bden pa'i don can du 'grub par 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: If that were the case, then when createdness is refuted, the truth of falsity would also be refuted, and therefore it would not be established as having the meaning of truth because it is not created by a person.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: de ltar re zhig gang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba de ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dang / skyes bus ma byas pa dang des mtshon @172a * //üîΩpa'i skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dam /üîΩrang gi sgras gzung ba nyid rgyas par ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar re zhig gang log pa nyid kyi rgyu nyes pa dang ldan pa dang bral ba de ni log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu ma yin zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs dang / skyes bus ma byas pa dang des mtshon @172a * // pa'i skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dam / rang gi sgras gzung ba nyid rgyas par ma nges pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, first, the reason ‚Äúthat which is free from the cause of error, which is faulty, is not the cause of a mistaken consciousness‚Äù and ‚Äúthat which is not created by a person‚Äù and the exemplification of that, ‚Äúnot created by a person,‚ÄùüîΩor ‚Äúgrasped by its own words‚Äù are extensively taught to be indefinite.

original: ma grub pa nyid du bstan par 'dod de mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ma grub pa nyid du bstan par 'dod de mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach that they are not established and to conclude, he says:

original: des na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúnot created by a person,‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang gsal ba dang / rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid gsal rtag nyid de /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dang gsal ba dang / rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid gsal rtag nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúNot created by a person, clear, and permanent‚Äù means not created by a person, clear, and permanent.

original: de dag gi sgrub byed ces bsdu'o //
analyzed: de dag gi sgrub byed ces bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äútheir proof‚Äù is a summary.

original: 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub byed de gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: 'dis sgrub par byed pas na sgrub byed de gtan tshigs so //
translated: Since this proves, it is a proof, that is, a reason.

original: de yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa sngar bshad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam pa sna tshogs pa sngar bshad pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it is of various types, as explained above.

original: de ni yod pa na zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa yod pa na'o //
analyzed: de ni yod pa na zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa yod pa na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it exists‚Äù means when not created by a person, and so on, exist.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rig byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the Vedas.

original: mi 'thad ces bya ba ni mi rigs par ro //
analyzed: mi 'thad ces bya ba ni mi rigs par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIs not tenable‚Äù means is not reasonable.

original: rgyas par zhes bya ba ni rnam par phyi nas so //
analyzed: rgyas par zhes bya ba ni rnam par phyi nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn detail‚Äù means in various ways.

original: 'di spong zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa sun 'byin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di spong zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la sogs pa sun 'byin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis is refuted‚Äù means that not created by a person, and so on, are faulted.

original: de yod na yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod na yang mngon par 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even if they exist, the desired goal is not accomplished.

original: de sun 'byin par byed na yang skabs su nye bar mi mkho bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de sun 'byin par byed na yang skabs su nye bar mi mkho bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you refute that, then you will be making something that is not necessary for the occasion.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: 'dir ni thos pa ci bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ni thos pa ci bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHere, it is just as one hears‚Äù and so on.

original: blo nyid mthong ba yin pas blos mthong ba'o //
analyzed: blo nyid mthong ba yin pas blos mthong ba'o //
translated: The mind itself is seeing, so it is seeing by the mind.

original: de phra ba'i blos mthong ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de phra ba'i blos mthong ba gang dag la yod pa de dag la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Those who see that with a subtle mind are said to be ‚Äúthose who see with a subtle mind.‚Äù

original: mngon par rlom pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par rlom pa ni /
translated: ‚ÄúConceit‚Äù means

original: gang la rlom pa yod pa de ni mngon par rlom pa ste /
analyzed: gang la rlom pa yod pa de ni mngon par rlom pa ste /
translated: that which is conceited.

original: de'i phyir de'i dngos po ni mngon par rlom pa can no //üîΩde ni lnga pos ma rtogs phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dngos po ni mngon par rlom pa can no // de ni lnga pos ma rtogs phyir //
translated: Therefore, its entity is ‚Äúconceited.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not realized by the five‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma rnams ni log pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma rnams ni log pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe valid cognitions are also overturned‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dis ni rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rtsa ba'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa nyid du ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the fundamental reason is not established.

original: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin nam /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa'i rang bzhin nam /
translated: The pervader is either a nature

original: rgyu ldog pa na khyad par bya ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu ldog pa na khyad par bya ba'am /
translated: or a cause. When it is eliminated, a distinction is made.

original: 'bras bu ldog par byed de /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog par byed de /
translated: The result is refuted.

original: de dag der de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de dag der de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba dag gis 'brel ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because they are related to that thing by the identity of that thing and by origination from that thing.

original: de med par yang yod pa ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par yang yod pa ni 'bras bu dang khyab par bya ba nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not tenable that something exists without that thing being the result or the pervaded.

original: tshad pa de dag dngos po de thams cad la khyab par byed pa dang rgyu nyid dag tu srid pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad pa de dag dngos po de thams cad la khyab par byed pa dang rgyu nyid dag tu srid pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for those valid cognitions to pervade all those things and to be the cause of all those things.

original: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i dngos po tshad ma med par yod pa'i phyir des khyab pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yul dang dus dang rang bzhin gyis bskal ba'i dngos po tshad ma med par yod pa'i phyir des khyab pa ma yin la /
translated: Because things that are separated by place, time, and nature exist without limit, they are not pervaded by those valid cognitions.

original: tshad ma rgyu yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma rgyu yang ma yin te /
translated: And those valid cognitions are not the cause of those things.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin @172b pa'i phyir 'bras bu ldog pa na rgyu tsam ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tshad ma nyid gzhal bya'i 'bras bu yin @172b pa'i phyir 'bras bu ldog pa na rgyu tsam ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: For that reason, because valid cognition is the result of the object of comprehension, when the result is refuted, the cause is not refuted.

original: 'khrul bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul bar mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be mistaken.

original: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni zlog par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa dang khyab par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni zlog par byed pa nyid du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that what is not a cause and what is not a pervader should be a refuter.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the absurdity of the consequence.

original: de bas na gzhal bar bya ba tsam med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: de bas na gzhal bar bya ba tsam med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in the proof of the mere nonexistence of the object of cognition,

original: tshad ma tsam med pa ni 'khrul ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: tshad ma tsam med pa ni 'khrul ba yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: the mere nonexistence of the means of cognition is mistaken.

original: 'khrul pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'khrul pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par bstan pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that very mistake in the discordant side, in order to remove it,

original: des na thos pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des na thos pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúTherefore, the agent of hearing, etc.‚Äù

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: lnga po rnams kyis ma rtogs kyang //
analyzed: lnga po rnams kyis ma rtogs kyang //
translated: Even though the five do not understand,

original: zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba chod pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni thos pa'i byed pa po zhes bya ba chod pa dang 'brel to //
translated: The agent of hearing, etc. is connected with the word ‚Äúeven though.‚Äù

original: byed pa po mi shes pa'i srung ba rgyud la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba de'i 'og tu srung la sogs pa las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa po mi shes pa'i srung ba rgyud la sogs pa gang dag yin pa de dag la de skad ces bya ba de'i 'og tu srung la sogs pa las 'dzin pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: Those who do not know the author of the Veda, etc., are called ignorant. The word etc. includes the guardians of the Veda.

original: de'i phyir drug pa'i mtha' can la bzhin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir drug pa'i mtha' can la bzhin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said like the sixth case ending.üîΩ But if, etc.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs kyi 'khrul pa'i yul ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas gtan tshigs kyi 'khrul pa'i yul ma grub pa nyid du dogs par byed de /
translated: raises the doubt that the reason is inconclusive because of the possibility of another explanation.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni srung brgyud la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni srung brgyud la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word those refers to the guardians of the Veda, etc.

original: thos pa'ang de bzhin cis ma yin //
analyzed: thos pa'ang de bzhin cis ma yin //
translated: Why is it not the same with the Veda?

original: zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyang /
translated: The word also refers to the Vedas.

original: de kho na bzhin don rnam par phye ba dang don dang bcas pa dag gis ci'i phyir byed pa po'i rjes su dpog par mi byed de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na bzhin don rnam par phye ba dang don dang bcas pa dag gis ci'i phyir byed pa po'i rjes su dpog par mi byed de khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why do they not infer the author in the same way that they discern the meaning of the Vedas and understand the meaning of the words? There is no difference.

original: de lta yin dang tshad ma med par ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta yin dang tshad ma med par ma grub po //
translated: If that were so, the Vedas would not be established as being without a valid cognizer.

original: gzhan yang sems can thams cad kyi tshad ma log pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can thams cad kyi tshad ma log pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the valid cognizers of all sentient beings would be refuted.

original: bdag nyid tshad kyi ma log par gtan tshigs su len par byed ces bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid tshad kyi ma log par gtan tshigs su len par byed ces bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: The two positions are: (1) the self is the measure of what is not overturned, and (2) the self is the reason.

original: de la phyogs dang po la gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin la gnyis pa la yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems can kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la gtan tshigs the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin la gnyis pa la yang ma nges pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir sems can kun gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that in the first position the reason is indeterminate, and in the second position it is unestablished, he says, ‚ÄúAll sentient beings . . .‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi byed pa po sems can thams cad kyis mi shes so zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rig byed kyi byed pa po sems can thams cad kyis mi shes so zhes bya ba de lta bu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the fact that the author of the Vedas is not known by all sentient beings.

original: 'di lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i lang tsho la sogs pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no //üîΩre zhig byed pa po ma mthong na zhes gang smras pa 'di ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di lta bur zhes bya ba la sogs pas skyes bu gzhan la yod pa'i lang tsho la sogs pa'i kun du rtog pa dag gis 'khrul pa nyid sgrub par byed pa yin no // re zhig byed pa po ma mthong na zhes gang smras pa 'di ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù and so on prove that the error is due to the imagination of youth and so on that exist in other persons.

original: 'don par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'don par byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the statement, ‚ÄúIf the agent is not seen . . .‚Äù is itself unestablished, he says, ‚ÄúThe reciter . . .‚ÄùüîΩand so on.

original: gal te byed pa po gang yang rung ba ma mthong ba zhes khas @173a * //üîΩlen par byed pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po gang yang rung ba ma mthong ba zhes khas @173a * // len par byed pa de'i tshe /
translated: If you accept that no agent is seen,

original: 'don par byed pa po mthong ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid gsal rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: 'don par byed pa po mthong ba'i phyir ma grub pa nyid gsal rab tu 'jug pa yin no //
translated: then it is quite clear that your reason is unestablished.

original: ci ste dang po'i byed pa po ma mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste dang po'i byed pa po ma mthong ngo zhes bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If you maintain that the original agent is not seen,

original: de'i tshe yang the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yang the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa yin te /
translated: then your reason is still unestablished because of doubt.

original: res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis mthong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: res 'ga' 'ga' zhig gis mthong bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that someone might see it.

original: yang ci ste 'don pa po byed pa por ni ma grub po //
analyzed: yang ci ste 'don pa po byed pa por ni ma grub po //
translated: But if you maintain that the agent is not established as the expounder,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what is it?

original: gsal bar byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that it is the clarifier,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de dag gsal bar byed min te //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag gsal bar byed min te // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: They do not clarify it.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'don par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'don par byed pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThey‚Äù refers to the expounders.

original: ji ltar rtag pa rnams la gsal ba ma srid pa de ltar ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa rnams la gsal ba ma srid pa de ltar ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: How it is impossible for permanent things to clarify will be explained.

original: bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa yang ji ltar gsal bar byed ce na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa mi rtag pa yang ji ltar gsal bar byed ce na /
translated: How does a lamp illuminate a pot, etc., which are impermanent?

original: bden te / de la yang gsal bar byed pa 'ga' yang mi srid do //
analyzed: bden te / de la yang gsal bar byed pa 'ga' yang mi srid do //
translated: That is true, but it is impossible for anything to illuminate it.

original: 'o na ji ltar sgron me la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa nyid du grags she na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sgron me la sogs pa gsal bar byed pa nyid du grags she na /
translated: Well then, how is it that a lamp, etc. is known to be an illuminator?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: It is not.

original: de la sgron ma la sogs pa rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i bum pa bskyed pa na skyed par byed pa nyid khyad par can gyi skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten na gsal bar byed pa zhes grags kyi /üîΩde bzhin du 'dir rig byed kyi gsal bar byed pa 'ga' zhig srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la sgron ma la sogs pa rnam par shes pa skyed par rung ba'i bum pa bskyed pa na skyed par byed pa nyid khyad par can gyi skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin gsal bar bya ba'i phyir 'jig rten na gsal bar byed pa zhes grags kyi / de bzhin du 'dir rig byed kyi gsal bar byed pa 'ga' zhig srid pa ma yin te /
translated: When a pot, which is suitable to produce consciousness, is produced by a lamp, etc., it is called an illuminator in the world because it is a special producer that illuminates the nature of the producer.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni snga ma dang phyi ma dor ba dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni snga ma dang phyi ma dor ba dang ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But in this case, it is impossible for anything to illuminate a Vedic injunction because its nature is not discarded earlier and later and because it is not produced.

original: rtag pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin du chug mod /
analyzed: rtag pa gsal bar byed pa ma yin du chug mod /
translated: Let it be that a permanent thing is not an illuminator.

original: de lta na yang 'di byed pa po las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩdmigs par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rnams //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di byed pa po las khyad par med pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir / dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rnams //
translated: Still, in order to demonstrate that the agent is not different from the action,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe natures that are the objects of perception,‚Äù and so on.

original: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang mi byed pa ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not perform even the slightest action is not suitable to be a manifestor,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that anything could manifest anything.

original: cung zad byed na yang /
analyzed: cung zad byed na yang /
translated: If it does perform even the slightest action,

original: 'di skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs par 'gyur te /
translated: then it must be accepted that it is a producer,

original: bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdmigs par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rnams //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba'i khyad par gyi rang bzhin gzhan skyed pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // dmigs par 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin rnams //
translated: because the definition of a producer is that which produces a different object to be produced.

original: zhes bya ba ni rig byed rnams so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rig byed rnams so //
translated: The natures that are the objects of perception are the Vedas.

original: ci ste yang dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed rnams sngar yang gnas pa nyid yin na de ji ltar de dag de'i byed pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba yin snyam na /
analyzed: ci ste yang dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed rnams sngar yang gnas pa nyid yin na de ji ltar de dag de'i byed pa'i sgo nas 'byung ba yin snyam na /
translated: But if the natures that are the objects of perception, the Vedas, already existed previously, then how could they arise through his action?

original: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThose,‚Äù and so on.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the perceptible nature of the Vedas.

original: des na rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma byed @173b pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rig byed ces bya ba la sogs pas tshad ma byed @173b pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Vedas are not a means of valid knowledge.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi byed pa yong na 'byung ba de ni de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad la sogs par rung ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi byed pa yong na 'byung ba de ni de'i 'bras bu'i tha snyad la sogs par rung ba yin te /
translated: An application is that when something occurs due to the activity of something else, then the former is suitable to be called the effect of the latter.

original: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa yod na 'byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon la sogs pa'i byed pa yod na 'byung ba'i myu gu la sogs pa ni de'i 'bras bu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when the activity of a seed occurs, a sprout, which arises, is its effect.

original: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed kyang 'don pa pa'i byed pa yod na byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rang bzhin gyi rig byed kyang 'don pa pa'i byed pa yod na byung ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The perceptible nature of the Vedas occurs due to the activity of the reciter. This is an argument from the nature of things.

original: spong ba dang len pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su bsgrub pa ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: spong ba dang len pa'i mtshan nyid rjes su bsgrub pa ni tha snyad do //
translated: The subsequent establishment of the characteristics of rejection and acceptance is a convention.

original: sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa dang shes pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras brjod pa dang shes pa gzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include recitation and understanding.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not an unestablished reason.

original: sngar yang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar yang dmigs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it was previously observed.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it indeterminate,

original: 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no other reason for the convention of effect.

original: sngon du 'brel ba ma mthong ba //
analyzed: sngon du 'brel ba ma mthong ba //
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúbecause a prior connection is not seen,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la gsal byed rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la gsal byed rim pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in response to that, it is said, ‚ÄúThe order of the manifestor, etc.‚Äù

original: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gsal byed rim pa can yin pa de dang de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dang gang gsal byed rim pa can yin pa de dang de ni skyes bus byas pa yin te /
translated: The application is this: Whatever is an ordered manifestor is a human product,

original: dper na zlos gar gyi srung brgyud la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na zlos gar gyi srung brgyud la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like the order of the lines of a dance, etc.

original: rig byed gang gsal bar byed pa rim pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rig byed gang gsal bar byed pa rim pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is this: The order of the manifestor of the Veda is a human product.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The reason is not unestablished,

original: yi ge rnams rim gyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge rnams rim gyis snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the letters appear in sequence.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is not indeterminate,

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúOtherwise, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bus byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bus byas pa nyid du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if it is not the case that it is created by a person,

original: 'on kyang rtag pa nyid dang khyab pa nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe rim can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag pa nyid dang khyab pa nyid du brjod pa de'i tshe rim can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it is not the case that it is sequential, because it is said to be permanent and pervasive.

original: 'di ltar re zhig sa bon dang myu gu dang lcug ma la sogs pa bzhin du dus kyis byas pa'i rim pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig sa bon dang myu gu dang lcug ma la sogs pa bzhin du dus kyis byas pa'i rim pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In that case, it is not logical that it is sequential in terms of time, like a seed, sprout, and stalk, etc.

original: rtag pa nyid kyis thams cad dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis thams cad dus mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, being permanent, it is the same at all times.

original: grogs ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba bzhin du yul gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: grogs ma la sogs pa'i phreng ba bzhin du yul gyis byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is sequential in terms of place, like a garland, etc.

original: khyab pa nyid kyis thams cad nam mkha'i yul gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyab pa nyid kyis thams cad nam mkha'i yul gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, being pervasive, it is located in the one place of space.

original: mngon par gsal bas byas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par gsal bas byas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it is sequential in terms of manifestation.

original: khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa nyid kyis rtag pa la gsal bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde grub don du byas pa dang // ma byas lung yang nged la med //
analyzed: khyad par bogs dbyung du med pa nyid kyis rtag pa la gsal bar mi rung ba'i phyir ro // de grub don du byas pa dang // ma byas lung yang nged la med //
translated: Because, being permanent, it is not suitable to manifest, since it cannot be enhanced.

original: ces gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: ces gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: And the one who says, ‚ÄúWe have no scriptureüîΩThat is not accepted as authoritative by the other party,‚Äù

original: lung dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lung dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúScripture‚Äù is mentioned.

original: bkag ste zhes bya ba ni tshad ma brtag par ro //üîΩde dag ces bya ba ni lung dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / don @174a * //
analyzed: bkag ste zhes bya ba ni tshad ma brtag par ro // de dag ces bya ba ni lung dang nye bar 'jal ba dang / don @174a * //
translated: ‚ÄúRefuted‚Äù means that they are not valid cognitions.üîΩ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to scripture, analogy, and inference.

original: gyis go ba rnams so //
analyzed: gyis go ba rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúMeaning‚Äù refers to the meaning of the words.

original: tshad ma yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshad ma yin pa bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to refute‚Äù means in order to refute that they are valid cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to refute‚Äù and so on.

original: tshad ma min nyid ldog don du //
analyzed: tshad ma min nyid ldog don du //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to refute‚Äù means in order to refute that they are not valid cognitions.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to refute‚Äù and so on.

original: ji ltar de dngos po nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dngos po nyid yin zhe na /
translated: How can it be a thing?

original: thos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thos pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúHearing‚Äù and so on.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba 'dis thos pa rang dbang can du brjod do //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa nyid ces bya ba 'dis thos pa rang dbang can du brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúNot made by a person‚Äù means that hearing is independent.

original: skyes bu'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i thos pa ni /
analyzed: skyes bu'i byed pa la ltos pa med pa'i thos pa ni /
translated: Hearing that does not depend on the activity of a person

original: rang bzhin nyid kyi tshad yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin nyid kyi tshad yin no //
translated: is a valid cognition by nature.

original: zhes bsams nas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bsams nas sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thinking this, he wrote ‚Äúin order to refute that they are not valid cognitions.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na skyes bus byas pa nyid log pa tsam brjod pa na khyad par ci zhig bstan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na skyes bus byas pa nyid log pa tsam brjod pa na khyad par ci zhig bstan par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if he were merely refuting that they are made by a person, what distinction would he be teaching?

original: gang gi ltar na don dam par chos can tha dad pa de yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dngos po'i chos yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na don dam par chos can tha dad pa de yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyid dngos po'i chos yin no //
translated: According to whom the ultimate is a different subject, that is also a fact of reality that is not made by a person.

original: don dam par ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas /
analyzed: don dam par ni dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid khyad par gzhan spangs nas /
translated: In the ultimate, the very nature of a thing, having abandoned another distinction,

original: shes par 'dod pa na /
analyzed: shes par 'dod pa na /
translated: is asserted to be known.

original: de skad brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de skad brjod pa yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is what is said‚Äù teaches that.

original: dngos bdag nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dngos bdag nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of a thing‚Äù is the nature of a thing.

original: de lta'i zhes bya ba ni rang dbang can no //
analyzed: de lta'i zhes bya ba ni rang dbang can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat way‚Äù is independent.

original: dngos po'i phyogs ni sgrub don du //
analyzed: dngos po'i phyogs ni sgrub don du //
translated: ‚ÄúIn order to establish the position of a thing‚Äù and so on,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /üîΩdngos po'i phyogs ni grub bya'i phyir //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la / dngos po'i phyogs ni grub bya'i phyir //
translated: whatever is said,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúin order to establish the position of a thing‚Äù and so on is stated.

original: dngos po gang zhig gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gang zhig nye bar blangs pa de bkag pa na dngos po de las nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po gang zhig gtan la dbab par bya ba'i phyir sgrub par byed pa gang zhig nye bar blangs pa de bkag pa na dngos po de las nges par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de tsam du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever thing is to be ascertained, whatever proof is employed, when that is refuted, it is said that ‚Äúit does not follow that thing,‚Äù but

original: dngos po ldog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ldog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: the thing is not reversed.

original: gang gi phyir tshad ma log kyang gzhal bya mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshad ma log kyang gzhal bya mi ldog pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Because, as has been explained, even if the valid cognition is refuted, the object of apprehension is not refuted.

original: de la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa nyid dag ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang khyab par byed pa nyid dag ma tshang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cause and the pervader are incomplete.

original: bkag pa zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bkag pa zhes bya ba ni spangs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRefuted‚Äù means ‚Äúabandoned.‚Äù

original: phyogs gnyi ga yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par rigs te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi ga yang 'grub pa med do zhes bya ba 'di tsam zhig brjod par rigs te /
translated: It is only correct to say that ‚Äúboth sides are not established,‚Äù

original: 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig khong nas dbyung ste /
analyzed: 'dir zhes bya ba'i sgra zhig khong nas dbyung ste /
translated: and the word ‚Äúhere‚Äù should be supplied.

original: de yang 'grub byed ces bya ba 'di'i rjes thogs su blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'grub byed ces bya ba 'di'i rjes thogs su blta bar bya'o //
translated: And that should be supplied after ‚Äúestablished.‚Äù

original: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just this by means of an example, he says:

original: ji ltar lus can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar lus can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the eternalists . . .‚Äù

original: ji ltar rtag par smra bas sgra dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pas sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i bzhin no zhes sbyor ba bkod pa la /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag par smra bas sgra dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid du bsgrub par 'dod pas sgra rtag ste lus can ma yin pa'i phyir nam mkha'i bzhin no zhes sbyor ba bkod pa la /
translated: Just as the eternalists, who assert that sound is a thing, set forth the syllogism, ‚ÄúThe subject, sound, is permanent because of being a thing, like space,‚Äù in order to prove that sound is permanent,

original: phyir rgol bas lus can ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyir rgol bas lus can ma yin pa'i phyir sgra rtag par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical to say that sound is permanent because it is not embodied, because pleasure, etc. are not embodied but are not permanent.

original: bde ba la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir de tsam gyis dngos por 'gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub par @174b byed pa bkag na yang sgra mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir de tsam gyis dngos por 'gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid kyi sgrub par @174b byed pa bkag na yang sgra mi rtag pa nyid du grub pa ma yin pa de bzhin du 'di ma yin no zhes bya ba lhag ma'o
translated: Just as the opponent‚Äôs proof that sound is permanent because it is an entity is refuted, but sound is not thereby established as impermanent, so it is here.

original: // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du ste /
analyzed: // ji ltar zhes bya ba ni rim pa bzhin du ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as‚Äù means in the same order.

original: brjod na yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod na yang zhes bya ba'i mjug tu blta bar bya'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf stated‚Äù should be supplied at the end.

original: sgra zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la /
analyzed: sgra zhes bya ba 'di'i rjes la /
translated: After ‚Äúsound‚Äù here,

original: rtog pa grub pa zhes bya ba 'di kha bskang bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtog pa grub pa zhes bya ba 'di kha bskang bar bya'o //
translated: ‚Äúis established‚Äù should be supplied.

original: yang na 'jig pa bzhin du phyogs gcig sbyor bar blta bar bya'o //üîΩgzhan gyis sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /üîΩdes na gzhan gyis snga phyi'i mtha' //
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa bzhin du phyogs gcig sbyor bar blta bar bya'o // gzhan gyis sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / des na gzhan gyis snga phyi'i mtha' //
translated: Or, like ‚Äúdestruction,‚Äù it should be supplied to each of the other terms.üîΩAnother says:üîΩWith regard to the statement, ‚ÄúThe past and future do not exist,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe past and future do not exist,‚Äù etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means: for that reason.

original: don rdzogs min zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: don rdzogs min zhes bya ba ni rang gi phyogs ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Not complete in meaning means: because one's own position is not established.

original: / ma byas pa dang 'jig med kyis //
analyzed: / ma byas pa dang 'jig med kyis //
translated: By non-production and non-destruction,

original: rtag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid du brjod par 'dod //
translated: eternality is asserted.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: With regard to what was said,

original: gal te dgag tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gal te dgag tsam zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: it is said: If it is a mere negation, etc.

original: 'dir rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir rnam par rtog pa gnyis te /
translated: Here there are two alternatives.

original: res 'ga' med par dgag pa'i ngo bo'i ma byas pa dang 'jig pa dag gis sam ma yin pa'i dgag pa'i ngo bo dag gis rtag pa nyid du 'dod //
analyzed: res 'ga' med par dgag pa'i ngo bo'i ma byas pa dang 'jig pa dag gis sam ma yin pa'i dgag pa'i ngo bo dag gis rtag pa nyid du 'dod //
translated: Sometimes eternality is asserted by way of the nature of an external negation, by non-production and non-destruction, or by way of the nature of an internal negation.

original: de la phyogs dang po la nam mkha'i padma la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir rig byed kyi dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po la nam mkha'i padma la sogs pas ma nges pa'i phyir rig byed kyi dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid grub pa ma yin te /
translated: With regard to that, in the first alternative, because of the sky-lotus, etc., it is not established that the eternality of the entity of the Veda is established, because of uncertainty.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha'i padma la byas pa dang 'jig pa nyid bkag na yang dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du rigs byed la yang yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha'i padma la byas pa dang 'jig pa nyid bkag na yang dngos por gyur ba'i rtag pa nyid ma grub pa de bzhin du rigs byed la yang yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although the production and destruction of a sky-flower are refuted, the establishment of a permanent entity is not accomplished. In the same way, since the reason is not established in the case of the Vedas, the reason is not established.

original: de lta yin dang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du tshad ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang nam mkha'i me tog bzhin du tshad ma nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is so, then the Vedas would not be a valid cognition, just like a sky-flower.

original: ma grub par yang bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩbyas pa nyid dang 'jig pa nyid //
analyzed: ma grub par yang bstan pa'i phyir // byas pa nyid dang 'jig pa nyid //
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reason is not established,

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúproduction and destruction,‚Äù and so on.

original: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni sun phung ba'o //
analyzed: dgag pa zhes bya ba ni sun phung ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Refutation‚Äù means refuting the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na 'o na /üîΩde dag dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na 'o na / de dag dngos po'i bdag nyid kyis //
translated: But if the second position is accepted, then

original: rang gi sgrub byed la ltos min //
analyzed: rang gi sgrub byed la ltos min //
translated: ‚Äúthey are not dependent on their own proof.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di brjod par mi ba'o //
translated: This statement is not made.

original: de ston pa ni ma yin dgag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ston pa ni ma yin dgag / ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú The teaching of that is a nonaffirming negation,‚Äù and so on.

original: go bar zad do //
analyzed: go bar zad do //
translated: The meaning is self-evident.

original: gang zhig rig byed tshig gi don //
analyzed: gang zhig rig byed tshig gi don //
translated: ‚Äú The meaning of the words of the Vedas,‚Äù

original: log par rjes su dpag pas brjod //
analyzed: log par rjes su dpag pas brjod //
translated: and by false inference.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In response to that, it is said:

original: tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tshul gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The three modes, etc.

original: gsal byas pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa rtog par rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa las byung ba de ni dgag par mi nus te /üîΩ'di ni @175a * //
analyzed: gsal byas pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa rtog par rang bzhin dang 'bras bu dang / mi dmigs pa las byung ba de ni dgag par mi nus te / 'di ni @175a * //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúthe manifest‚Äù is inference, which arises from nature, effect, and non-apprehension. It cannot be refuted,üîΩbecause it is

original: dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: related to an entity.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin sus kyang rnam pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin sus kyang rnam pa gzhan du bya bar mi nus te /
translated: No one can change the nature of an entity,

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni rang bzhin skye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its characteristic is the arising of its nature.

original: rang bzhin gzhan byed pa ni de la cung zad byas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan byed pa ni de la cung zad byas pa ma yin te /
translated: Changing the nature of something does not make the slightest difference to it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to an absurd conclusion.

original: de lta bas na tshad mas grub pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de la sus kyang gnod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na tshad mas grub pa'i dngos po gang yin pa de la sus kyang gnod pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, no one can refute an entity that is established by a valid cognition,üîΩbecause it is related to an entity.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ba thams cad du yid brtan pa med pa'i phyir 'gar yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod na de'i mtshan nyid sun phyung bar 'gyur ba thams cad du yid brtan pa med pa'i phyir 'gar yang tshad mar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then if there were a refutation of that which possesses the characteristics of valid cognition, then the characteristics of that would be refuted, and there would be no certainty anywhere, so that nothing would be valid cognition.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni skyes bus gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni skyes bus gang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This very point is taught by ‚ÄúIf a person . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:üîΩThe so-called mind is the self itself. Since it is not essentially perishable, it is said to be imperishable.
