original: sems zhes bya ba dang / de nyid bdag nyid do zhes rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pas mi 'jig par smra'o zhes bya ba dang / yang smras pa kye bdag ni 'di ni 'jig pa med pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chos can no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems zhes bya ba dang / de nyid bdag nyid do zhes rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa med pas mi 'jig par smra'o zhes bya ba dang / yang smras pa kye bdag ni 'di ni 'jig pa med pa rgyun mi 'chad pa'i chos can no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: And again it is said: ‚ÄúKye! The self is not perishable, it is a phenomenon that is not interrupted.‚Äù

original: 'jig pa med pas na mi 'jig pa ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pas na mi 'jig pa ste /
translated: Since it is not perishable, it is imperishable.

original: rtag par byed pa'i don to//
analyzed: rtag par byed pa'i don to//
translated: The meaning is that it is permanent.

original: kye'i zhes bya bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: kye'i zhes bya bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúKye!‚Äù is a word of address.

original: rigs sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras yon tan dang / rdzas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: rigs sogs zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras yon tan dang / rdzas la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe categories‚Äù and so on. The term ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the qualities, substances, and so on.

original: rigs la sogs pa de yang ji ltar tshad mas gnod pa de ltar tshig gi don drug brtag par bsgrubs zin la /
analyzed: rigs la sogs pa de yang ji ltar tshad mas gnod pa de ltar tshig gi don drug brtag par bsgrubs zin la /
translated: And the refutation of the six categories such as ‚Äúsubstance‚Äù by means of valid cognition has already been accomplished in the Examination of Causal Conditions.

original: gang yang bdag la gnod pa'i 'brel ba shes pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa de yang bdag med pa'i gnas skabs su bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: gang yang bdag la gnod pa'i 'brel ba shes pa can gyi rjes su dpag pa de yang bdag med pa'i gnas skabs su bsgrubs zin to //
translated: And the refutation of the inference of the one who knows the relation of the object to the self has already been accomplished in the Examination of the Self.

original: 'on te rig byed tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: 'on te rig byed tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: But if the Vedas are not valid cognition,

original: de ji ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur /
translated: how can they be refuted by inference?

original: ci ste tshad ma la yang gnod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma la yang gnod par 'gyur na /
translated: But if they are valid cognition,

original: rjes su dpag pa la yang des ci'i phyir gnod par mi 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la yang des ci'i phyir gnod par mi 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: why can‚Äôt they refute inference?

original: dngos po dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this doubt, he says, ‚ÄúThe relation to an object,‚Äù and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to inference.

original: sgra ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra ni 'dod pa tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because sound is a mere object of desire,

original: gzhal bya'i dngos po la 'brel ba yod pa ma yin pas de de la tshad ma ma yin la /
analyzed: gzhal bya'i dngos po la 'brel ba yod pa ma yin pas de de la tshad ma ma yin la /
translated: it does not have a relation to the object of evaluation, and therefore it is not a valid cognition of that.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba'i rtags kyi stobs kyis skye ba na dngos po de las 'brel ba'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel ba'i rtags kyi stobs kyis skye ba na dngos po de las 'brel ba'i phyir de nyid tshad ma yin te /
translated: Inference is valid knowledge because it arises in dependence on a reason that is related to its object either through identity or causality.

original: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is a means of valid knowledge.

original: de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba zhes bya ba ni sgra las byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArising from that‚Äù means arising from sound.

original: ci ste 'brel ba med kyang sgra dngos po la tshad mar 'gyur na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste 'brel ba med kyang sgra dngos po la tshad mar 'gyur na de'i tshe /
translated: If sound were a means of valid knowledge with regard to things even though there were no relation,üîΩthen there would be an absurd consequence.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni @175b skyes bu'i ngag las zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes ston pa ni @175b skyes bu'i ngag las zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says, ‚ÄúThe words of a person . . .‚Äù

original: me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ci'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: me'i sbyin sreg las mtho ris su mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di ci'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why is the statement ‚ÄúOne does not go to heaven through fire sacrifice‚Äù not a means of valid knowledge?

original: gnyi ga la yang 'brel ba med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩkhyad par med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang 'brel ba med pa nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro // khyad par med pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference between the two in that neither has a relation.

original: dpe la ltos pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
analyzed: dpe la ltos pa med pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so ;
translated: To demonstrate that very lack of difference, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not dependent on an example . . .‚Äù

original: / ci ste yang gal te de'i phyir nyes pa mi dmigs pa de lta na yang skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyis srid pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni rig byed la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: / ci ste yang gal te de'i phyir nyes pa mi dmigs pa de lta na yang skyes bu la brten pa nyid kyis srid pa yin no zhes bya ba de ni rig byed la yang mtshungs te /
translated: But if, on the other hand, you say that the fault does not arise because of that, then even so, existence is dependent on a person, and this is the same for the Vedas.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar de'i rang bzhin bden pa'i don can yin pa de ltar log pa nyid kyang srid pa'i phyir khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar de'i rang bzhin bden pa'i don can yin pa de ltar log pa nyid kyang srid pa'i phyir khyad par 'ga' yang med do //
translated: For just as the Vedas have a true meaning by their very nature, so also falsity is possible, and there is no difference at all.

original: de la ni tshad ma ma yin zhes de ltar zhes bya ba la sgos pa gang smras pa 'di ni mi la sbyin sreg byas pas mtho ris su mi skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag skyes bus byas pa la yang brjod par nus pa ma yin
analyzed: de la ni tshad ma ma yin zhes de ltar zhes bya ba la sgos pa gang smras pa 'di ni mi la sbyin sreg byas pas mtho ris su mi skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i ngag skyes bus byas pa la yang brjod par nus pa ma yin
translated: And what you say, namely, that ‚Äúit is not a means of valid cognition in that way,‚Äù cannot be said of the Vedas, because it can be said of the speech of a person, ‚ÄúBy performing a fire sacrifice for a human being, one is not reborn in heaven,‚Äù and so on.

original: no zhes ston pa ni sgra yis don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: no zhes ston pa ni sgra yis don rtogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúThe understanding of the meaning by means of a word,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgras don rtogs pa na yang mkhas pas zhes sdang tsam gyis me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ming can de skyes bus byas pa na de la ste dpyod pa pa rnams la tshad ma ma yin no zhes de ltar brjod nus
analyzed: sgras don rtogs pa na yang mkhas pas zhes sdang tsam gyis me'i sbyin sreg gis mtho ris su mi skye'o zhes bya ba 'di ming can de skyes bus byas pa na de la ste dpyod pa pa rnams la tshad ma ma yin no zhes de ltar brjod nus
translated: When one understands the meaning of a word, even if one is a scholar, one cannot say, ‚ÄúBy merely hating, one is not born in the higher realms through the fire sacrifice,‚Äù and so on.

original: pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
analyzed: pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni ngag gi don to //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement.

original: 'dis ni skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa gnyis shin tu lkog tu ma gyur ba'i don la rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa gnyis shin tu lkog tu ma gyur ba'i don la rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the reason for understanding is the same for both that which is produced by a person and that which is not produced by a person, with regard to a meaning that is not completely hidden.

original: de lta yin dang rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid yin na skyes bus ma byas pa kho na tshad ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan mtshungs pa nyid yin na skyes bus ma byas pa kho na tshad ma yin gyi cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa 'di ni rigs pa dang bral ba yin no //
translated: If that were the case, and the reason for understanding is the same, then it is unreasonable to say, ‚ÄúOnly that which is not produced by a person is valid cognition, not the other.‚Äù

original: nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir de la log pa nyid du rtogs kyi skyes bus ma byas pa la ni ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa rnams ni skyes bu la brten pa'i phyir de la log pa nyid du rtogs kyi skyes bus ma byas pa la ni ma yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible to say that faults are based on persons, and therefore are understood to be wrong in relation to them, but not in relation to what is not made by persons.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa dag la yang rang bzhin gyis log pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu nyid srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa dag la yang rang bzhin gyis log pa'i don shes pa'i rgyu nyid srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible that the cause of the cognition of the meaning of the wrongness of what is not made by persons would exist by intrinsic reality.

original: dod de nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: dod de nyid ston pa ni /
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says:

original: de ltar sgra kun zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ltar sgra kun zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All words are like that.

original: kun zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: kun zhes bya ba ni skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll‚Äù means both those made by persons and those not made by persons.

original: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la'o //
analyzed: gcig nyid la zhes bya ba ni skyes bus ma byas pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn one‚Äù means in what is not made by persons.

original: sdang ba ni na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la de ma thag brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sdang ba ni na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la de ma thag brjod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: As for what was said, ‚ÄúThe angry one speaks thus,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúThat is said immediately,‚Äù and so on.

original: de ma thag tu brjod pa ni sgra 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa nyid kyi dngos po la 'brel ba med pa'i @176a * //
analyzed: de ma thag tu brjod pa ni sgra 'dod pa tsam gyis 'jug pa nyid kyi dngos po la 'brel ba med pa'i @176a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is said immediately‚Äù means that the thing that is engaged by mere desire for the word is not related to the thing.

original: phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the past‚Äù and so on.

original: shes rab can dag ces bya ba na bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams so //
analyzed: shes rab can dag ces bya ba na bde bar gshegs pa pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wise‚Äù are the followers of the Sugata.

original: gang yang bshad pa byed pas rig byed kyi ngag las shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: gang yang bshad pa byed pas rig byed kyi ngag las shes pa ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: The author of the commentary explains: ‚ÄúThe knowledge derived from the words of the Vedas is perception.

original: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal na ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa ni mngon sum dang 'gal na ni tshad mar 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bshad do //
translated: Inference is not a valid means of knowledge if it contradicts perception.‚Äù

original: gang yang 'di skad du /
analyzed: gang yang 'di skad du /
translated: He also says:

original: skur bar byed ni byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa dang / skal ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don rtogs par nus kyi /
analyzed: skur bar byed ni byung ba dang / 'byung ba dang / 'byung bar 'gyur ba dang / phra ba dang / chod pa dang / skal ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don rtogs par nus kyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOne can understand the meaning of such words as ‚Äòbh≈´ta‚Äô (past), ‚Äòbhavya‚Äô (future), ‚Äòs≈´k·π£ma‚Äô (subtle), ‚Äòvyavahita‚Äô (separated), and ‚ÄòbhƒÅgya‚Äô (fortunate),üîΩbut no one else can understand even the slightest bit.‚Äù

original: gzhan dbang pos ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de thams cad 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dbang pos ni cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa de thams cad 'di nyid kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: All of this is refuted by the following verse,

original: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la 'di thams cad mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa'i tshig la 'di thams cad mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all of these are equally applicable to the words of human beings.

original: 'dzin dang 'don dang 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: 'dzin dang 'don dang 'chad pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: As for what was said, ‚Äúthat which is grasped, recited, and explained,‚Äù

original: log pa'i rjes chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: log pa'i rjes chags zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat which is born from attachment to error, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni log pa'i rjes su chags pa las skyes pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni log pa'i rjes su chags pa las skyes pa yang yin la /
translated: That is born from attachment to error,üîΩand it is also the thought of the Vedas.

original: rig byed sems pa yang yin no zhes bsdu bar byas la /
analyzed: rig byed sems pa yang yin no zhes bsdu bar byas la /
translated: That is the compound.

original: de rmongs par byas pas zhes phyis gsum pa'i bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: de rmongs par byas pas zhes phyis gsum pa'i bsdu ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that which is deluded‚Äù is the third member of the compound.

original: sems pa ni mod la sems pa'o //
analyzed: sems pa ni mod la sems pa'o //
translated: Thought is the thought of the moment.

original: log pa'i rjes su chags pas nyes pa yod na yang mngon par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: log pa'i rjes su chags pas nyes pa yod na yang mngon par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there is a fault in attachment to error, it is not manifest,üîΩjust as, for example, the taking of a wife before the sacramentary rite is not a fault for the Parsats and others.

original: dper na par sig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med do //üîΩgzhan yang snang ba las byung ba'i //üîΩngo shes pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: dper na par sig pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ma bag mar len pa la sogs pa lta bu yin pa'i phyir ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med do // gzhan yang snang ba las byung ba'i // ngo shes pa yis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: Therefore, there is not the slightest wonder in this.üîΩMoreover, as for what was said, ‚Äúthat which is recognized from appearances,‚Äù

original: ngo shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ngo shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat which is recognized, etc.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid ni rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul ba yin la /
translated: The definition of perception is that it is free from conceptual thought and is nonerroneous.

original: ngo shes pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni rtog pa dang bral ba ma yin te /
translated: Recognition is not free from conceptual thought,

original: de nyid 'di yin no snyam du sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'di yin no snyam du sgra'i rnam pa dang ldan par 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages its object with the aspect of a word, thinking ‚ÄúThis is that.‚Äù

original: ma 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is also not nonerroneous,

original: sngar mthong ba dang da lta skyes pa dag gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba dang da lta skyes pa dag gcig tu mtshams sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it connects what was seen previously with what is seen now as one.

original: sngar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid phyis mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid phyis mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: That which was seen previously is not seen later,

original: rim can ma yin pa las shes pa rim can du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rim can ma yin pa las shes pa rim can du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not tenable that a cognition that is not sequential arises from a nonsequential object.

original: 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba'i chos can gyi 'bras bu res 'ga' mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de ma tshang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las 'byung ba'i chos can gyi 'bras bu res 'ga' mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni de ma tshang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result that is the property of an existent is not sometimes nonexistent, because it is not incomplete.

original: gal te rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir 'bras bu sdod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te rgyu ma tshang ba med pa yin na ci'i phyir 'bras bu sdod par 'gyur /
translated: If the cause is not incomplete, why does the result remain?

original: rtag @176b pa ni phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis res 'ga' ltos par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag @176b pa ni phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis res 'ga' ltos par 'gyur ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And a permanent thing is not sometimes dependent because it is not something that can be helped.

original: de lta bas na de las byung ba'i shes pa cig car bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na de las byung ba'i shes pa cig car bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition that arises from it would be simultaneous.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang gi tshe rgyu ma tshang ba med pa de ni de'i tshe 'byung ba nyid yin te /
translated: The application is this: when the cause is not incomplete, then it is just at that time that it arises.

original: dper na mig la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa mtha' dag gi mtha'i gnas skabs can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na mig la sogs pa rgyu'i tshogs pa mtha' dag gi mtha'i gnas skabs can gyi mig gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: For example, the visual consciousness that has the condition of the totality of the collection of causes such as the eye.

original: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang gnas skabs thams cad du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa'i sgra las byung ba'i shes pa yang gnas skabs thams cad du rgyu ma tshang ba med pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs so //
translated: And the cognition that arises from the sound of cow, etc. is just at that time when the cause is not incomplete. This is a natural inference.

original: de bas na 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid du ma grub po zhes dang po nyid du bstan pa'i dngos po rtag par bstan zin to //
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul ba'i phyir dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ngo shes pa mngon sum nyid du ma grub po zhes dang po nyid du bstan pa'i dngos po rtag par bstan zin to //
translated: Therefore, because of error and because of conceptualization, recognition is not established as direct perception.

original: thams cad du rang gi ngo bos ngo shes pa grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: thams cad du rang gi ngo bos ngo shes pa grub pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that recognition is not established by way of its own nature in any way,

original: sgra'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe cognition of sound,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gi tshe ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa dag gis sgra sgrogs pa de dag la 'di ni ri skegs kyi sgra'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe ne tso dang ri skegs la sogs pa dag gis sgra sgrogs pa de dag la 'di ni ri skegs kyi sgra'o //
translated: When parrots, mynas, and so on utter sounds, they are recognized as the sounds of mynas and the sounds of parrots, because the objects are mutually different.

original: 'di ni ne tso'i sgra'o zhes phan tshun yul tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i shes par 'gyur bas thams cad du rang gi ngo bo shes pa grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni ne tso'i sgra'o zhes phan tshun yul tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa'i shes par 'gyur bas thams cad du rang gi ngo bo shes pa grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since the cognitions are different, recognition is not established by way of its own nature in any way.

original: yang ci ste gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas ni ne tso la sogs pa'i sgra la phan tshun du ldog pa'i shes pa 'di skye'o snyam pa 'di yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: yang ci ste gsal bar byed pa tha dad pas ni ne tso la sogs pa'i sgra la phan tshun du ldog pa'i shes pa 'di skye'o snyam pa 'di yang mi 'thad de /
translated: Moreover, it is not tenable that the cognition of the exclusion of one thing arises in regard to the sound of a parrot, etc. due to the difference of the manifesters.

original: gsal bar byed pa sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa sel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the manifesters are eliminated.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te gsal byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni gal te gsal byed ces bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: This is explained by ‚ÄúIf you say that the sound is different, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i ngo bo'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the cognition of the nature of the exclusion.

original: gzhan yang gal te sgra rnams kyi tha dad pa grub na yang gsal byed kyis byas pa'am /üîΩtha dad pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te sgra rnams kyi tha dad pa grub na yang gsal byed kyis byas pa'am / tha dad pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, if the difference of the sounds is established, then it is made by the manifesters,üîΩbut it is not the difference of their own nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de'i tshe thams cad la yid brtan du med do zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ni ma yin pa de'i tshe thams cad la yid brtan du med do zhes ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In that case, it is not reliable in regard to everything. To demonstrate the absurd consequence, it is said:

original: khyed la rig pa 'di nyid kyis //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: khyed la rig pa 'di nyid kyis // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis very awareness of yours, etc.‚Äù

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni sna tshogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúEverything‚Äù means the various things.

original: de ltar 'gyur mod ce na /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur mod ce na /
translated: If you say that this is so,üîΩthen it follows that the difference of the sounds is not established.

original: de'i phyir khyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúYou cannot say, etc.

original: 'di ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äù This is the clarification.

analyzed: bar byas so zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di dag ni skyes bus ma byas pa yin no zhes khyed cag la ngo shes pa'i mthar thug pa'i rnam par gzhag par mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa yin no //

analyzed: dngos po nyid rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa'i spyi ni rtags zhes bya'i gzhan ni ma yin te ;

analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dpe bsgrub bya ma chang ba ma yin no //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la /

original: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang dpe dag ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this argument, the reason and example are shown to be unestablished.

original: ba lang nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ba lang nyid du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show this, he says, ‚ÄúThe cow itself, etc.‚Äù

original: ba lang nyid rtag bsal ba yin //
analyzed: ba lang nyid rtag bsal ba yin //
translated: The cow itself is excluded from permanence.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtag tu zhes bya ba 'dis ma grub pa nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni rtag tu zhes bya ba 'dis ma grub pa nyid du bshad do //

original: 'brel ba rtag pa bsal ba yin //
analyzed: 'brel ba rtag pa bsal ba yin //
translated: The connection is excluded from permanence.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis rtag pa dang 'brel phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis rtag pa dang 'brel phyir zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par bshad do //
translated: This shows that ‚Äúbecause of the connection with permanence‚Äù is unestablished.

original: rdul @178b phran nam mkha' sogs kyang spangs //
analyzed: rdul @178b phran nam mkha' sogs kyang spangs //
translated: Atoms, space, etc. are also excluded.

original: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'dis ni /
translated: This shows that

original: rdun  phran rnams dang nam mkha' bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba 'di ma grub par bshad do //
analyzed: rdun  phran rnams dang nam mkha' bzhin // zhes bya ba 'di ma grub par bshad do //
translated: ‚Äúlike atoms and space‚ÄùüîΩis unestablished.

original: bsal zhes bya ba 'di sun phyung ba ste /
analyzed: bsal zhes bya ba 'di sun phyung ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúExcluded‚Äù is refuted.

original: tshig gi don drug brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig gi don drug brtag par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of the words should be examined.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: ma yin zhes bya ba dgag pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin zhes bya ba dgag pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot‚Äù is a negation.

original: du ma'i spyi la mngon phyogs pa //
analyzed: du ma'i spyi la mngon phyogs pa //
translated: And the universal of many is manifest.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the passage beginning with the words:

original: dmigs gzung ba lang nyid brjod par //
analyzed: dmigs gzung ba lang nyid brjod par //
translated: The universal of cow is the object of the word cow.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The passage beginning with the words:

original: 'di ji ltar 'khrul pa nyid du grub ce na /
analyzed: 'di ji ltar 'khrul pa nyid du grub ce na /
translated: How is this error established?

original: skad cig nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩji ltar bum sogs rnyings pa'am //
analyzed: skad cig nyid phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // ji ltar bum sogs rnyings pa'am //
translated: The passage beginning with the words: Because of momentariness.

original: mtshon cha sogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshon cha sogs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The passage beginning with the words: Just as a pot, etc.üîΩThe passage beginning with the words: In the case of a pot, etc.

original: bum pa sogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba 'di yang bstan zin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid du bstan pas so //
analyzed: bum pa sogs la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba 'di yang bstan zin zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i dngos po brtag par 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid du bstan pas so //
translated: This has been demonstrated, i.e. the non-existence of a cause of destruction has been demonstrated in the examination of the demonstrated entity.

original: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la yang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir de sgra la ci'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum pa la sogs pa la yang 'jig pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir de sgra la ci'i phyir 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: Just as in the case of a pot, etc. also, because there is no cause of destruction, why should it arise in sound?

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu zhes skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The cause of destruction is to be supplied.

original: 'dis ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //üîΩyul dang dus dang sbyor byed rnams //
analyzed: 'dis ni grub pa la sgrub pa dang chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yang ma grub pa nyid du bstan pa yin no // yul dang dus dang sbyor byed rnams //
translated: This shows that the example of the non-established is also not established in the proof.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: With regard to the statement ‚Äúthe object, time, and the application,‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go bar zad do //
analyzed: ngo shes pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te go bar zad do //
translated: he says, ‚Äúrecognition,‚Äù and so on. The meaning is clear.üîΩWith regard to the statement ‚Äúthat very real,‚Äù and so on, the error in the proof of what is already established is as follows:

original: gang nyid yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon ni gang las tha dad pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang nyid yang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'i sbyor ba la grub pa la sgrub pa nyid kyi skyon ni gang las tha dad pa'i spyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what is different, a universal,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dod ces bya ba ni min zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'dod ces bya ba ni min zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúIs asserted‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúis not.‚Äù

original: yang ci ste gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid kyi yang rten du mi 'gyur ro snyam te /
analyzed: yang ci ste gzhan sel ba'i bdag nyid kyi yang rten du mi 'gyur ro snyam te /
translated: Moreover, if you think that the nature of the exclusion of other is not the basis,

original: de ltar de rnam pa 'dis bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar de rnam pa 'dis bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: in this way, it is established by this method.

original: des na grub pa la sgrub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na grub pa la sgrub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that there is a proof of what is already established.

original: khyed kyi gzhan sel ba'i rten de ga la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: khyed kyi gzhan sel ba'i rten de ga la sogs pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúHow could your basis of the exclusion of other be a universal?‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma spong ba yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma spong ba yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not so‚Äù rejects the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de ltar sgrub pa la gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar sgrub pa la gtan tshigs ma grub par 'gyur te /
translated: If it were so, the proof would be inconclusive.

original: 'di ltar gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dgag pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba dgag pa'i dngos po las ma gtogs pa gzhan 'ga' zhig yod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Because there is no other thing called ‚Äúthe exclusion of other‚Äù apart from the negated thing.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: ga la sogs pa gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa de nyid yin te /
analyzed: ga la sogs pa gsal ba'i ngo bo rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa de nyid yin te /
translated: It is the exclusion of other heterogeneous things such as pot.

original: khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa la gzhan las ldog pa dang gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan spangs nas de tsam shes par 'dod pa la gzhan las ldog pa dang gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam grangs rnams kyis brjod pa yin no //
translated: When one wishes to know the mere exclusion of other things, the synonyms ‚Äúexclusion of other,‚Äù ‚Äúexclusion of the other,‚Äù and so on are used.

original: @179a * // de chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
analyzed: @179a * // de chos can gyi rang gi ngo bo med par bsgrub par bya ba la /
translated: If the exclusion of other is the nature of the thing itself, then in proving that the thing itself does not exist,

original: ga las gzhan pa'i blo ma brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di chos can gang gi chos su 'gyur te /
analyzed: ga las gzhan pa'i blo ma brjod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di chos can gang gi chos su 'gyur te /
translated: why is the reason ‚Äúbecause the cognition of other is not expressed‚Äù not the property of the subject?

original: gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the property of the subject of anything.

original: gang yang gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i gnyid bzhin no zhes dper byed pa de yang chos can ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang gzhan gyis kun du brtags pa'i gnyid bzhin no zhes dper byed pa de yang chos can ma grub pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: dngos po pa yi rjes dpag kun //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po pa yi rjes dpag kun // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: All inferences of realistsüîΩare like the example of the son of a barren woman.

original: dpe la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras gtan tshigs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: dpe la sogs pas zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras gtan tshigs la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù in the line ‚Äúand so on, such as the example‚Äù includes the reason and so on.

original: gzhan yang ma brjod pa na yang rgol bas 'dod pas yul du byas pa gang yin pa kho na bsgrub byar 'dod la /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma brjod pa na yang rgol bas 'dod pas yul du byas pa gang yin pa kho na bsgrub byar 'dod la /
translated: Moreover, when something is not stated, the opponent‚Äôs desire is taken as the object, and that alone is asserted as the thesis.

original: 'dir khyed cag gis ga nyid dgag pa tsam bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir khyed cag gis ga nyid dgag pa tsam bsgrub par 'dod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Here you do not assert that the mere negation of ‚Äúit is not‚Äù is the thesis.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: Well then, what is it?

original: thabs 'dis ga gcig nyid du bstan par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: thabs 'dis ga gcig nyid du bstan par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: The method is that you assert that the mere negation of ‚Äúit is not‚Äù is taught.

original: dam bca' ba 'di la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bca' ba 'di la mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa sngar bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this thesis is undermined by perception and so on, as was previously explained, he says,

original: khyed kyis 'bad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: khyed kyis 'bad pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúYour effort is pointless,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ga nyid kyi rten dgag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces bya ba ni tha dad pa'i ga nyid kyi rten dgag pa'o //
translated: The phrase these is a denial of a basis that is a different entity.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'ang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra rjes su dpag pas gnod pa gzung ngo //üîΩbrjod pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgang phyir sdug dang mi sdug sogs //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa'ang zhes bya ba'i yang gi sgra rjes su dpag pas gnod pa gzung ngo // brjod pa zhes bya ba ni / gang phyir sdug dang mi sdug sogs //
translated: The phrase contradicted by perception includes the contradiction by inference.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is said refers to the passage that begins with the words because of the agreeable, disagreeable, and so forth.

original: gnyis la grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: gnyis la grub pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: The phrase in both refers to the passage that begins with the words if you say that the word is one thing and the meaning is another.

original: kha rtsang de ring la sogs pa //
analyzed: kha rtsang de ring la sogs pa //
translated: The phrase in response to that refers to the passage that begins with the words yesterday, today, and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba la 'dir yang brjod pa zhes rtags dang rnam par dbye ba yongs su bsgyur la sbrel bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te zhes bya ba la 'dir yang brjod pa zhes rtags dang rnam par dbye ba yongs su bsgyur la sbrel bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase it is said should be supplied here as well, just as it was supplied in the passage that begins with the words if you say that the word is one thing and the meaning is another.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis sgra tha dad du grub pa'i phyir yi ge gcig gnyis la grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir brtags pa'i gzhan sel ba brtags pa nyid du brtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag gis sgra tha dad du grub pa'i phyir yi ge gcig gnyis la grub pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir brtags pa'i gzhan sel ba brtags pa nyid du brtag pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, because sound is established as a single entity by perception and inference, the establishment of two or more letters does not exist. Therefore, the exclusion of other that is imagined is imagined to be just an imputation.

original: mtshungs par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang tshe sgra tsam legs byas pa'i //
analyzed: mtshungs par rtog pa'i shes pa gcig nyid du zhen pa'i phyir ro // gang tshe sgra tsam legs byas pa'i //
translated: because it is conceived to be a single cognition that conceives the similarity.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa la /
translated: You said, for example,

original: sgra ni nye bar dmigs dus su //
analyzed: sgra ni nye bar dmigs dus su //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen the mere sound is well-produced,üîΩthe ear is well-produced, and the sound is well-produced.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: We say, for example,üîΩ‚ÄúWhen the mere sound is heard,üîΩthe ear is well-produced.‚Äù

original: gal te rna ba legs par byed pa'i rlung rnams tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis grub par gyur na de'i tshe sgra tsam gyis rna ba legs par byas pa yin no zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te rna ba legs par byed pa'i rlung rnams tshad ma 'ga' zhig gis grub par gyur na de'i tshe sgra tsam gyis rna ba legs par byas pa yin no zhes brjod par bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the winds that produce the ear were established by some valid cognition, then at that time it would be correct to say that the ear is well-produced by the mere sound.

original: de dag grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not established.

original: de lta bas na de dang 'brel ba ste de sgra dang 'brel bas sgra tsam de rtog pa mngon @179b sum yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni brtag pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na de dang 'brel ba ste de sgra dang 'brel bas sgra tsam de rtog pa mngon @179b sum yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni brtag pa tsam yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is related to that, since it is related to that sound, it is mere speculation to say that the conception is a direct perception of sound.üîΩYou said, for example,üîΩ‚ÄúGrasping sweetness as sour

original: dper na mngar ba kha ba dang / dkar po ser po'i ngo bor 'dzin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: dper na mngar ba kha ba dang / dkar po ser po'i ngo bor 'dzin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: and grasping white as yellow.‚Äù

original: mngar ba sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: mngar ba sogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: This clarifies the statement:

original: 'dis ni / de yi dbang gis sgra la blo //üîΩzhes gang smras pa de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni / de yi dbang gis sgra la blo // zhes gang smras pa de gsal ba yin no //
translated: The cognition of sound is due to that.

original: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyi yul can du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa gzhan gyi yul can du rigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that a cognition having the aspect of one thing has as its object a different thing,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurd consequences.

original: yang ci ste gal te sgra'i shes pa de'i yul ma yin na /
analyzed: yang ci ste gal te sgra'i shes pa de'i yul ma yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the object of the cognition of sound is not sound,

original: de ji ltar yul med pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yul med pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: how can it be without an object?

original: myur dang dal sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: myur dang dal sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, Quickly, slowly, etc.

original: myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma'i rnam par shes pa skye la /
analyzed: myur ba dang dal ba dang bar ma'i rnam par shes pa skye la /
translated: Cognitions arise quickly, slowly, and in between.

original: sgra la ni myur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sgra la ni myur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Sound does not have the aspects of quickly, etc.

original: de ni rtag pa dang kha phra ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rtag pa dang kha phra ba nyid kyis ngo bo gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is permanent and has the same nature as sound.

original: gang zhig snang bar 'gyur ba myur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i don gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig snang bar 'gyur ba myur ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa'i don gzhan yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no other object that appears having the aspects of quickly, etc.

original: de lta bas na rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i don med pa'i phyir 'di yul med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam pa'i rjes su byed pa'i don med pa'i phyir 'di yul med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, because the object that conforms with the aspect does not exist, this consciousness has no object.

original: 'di snyam du sgra de nyid myur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos rnam pa gzhan du snang ba de ni de'i dmigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sgra de nyid myur ba la sogs pa'i ngo bos rnam pa gzhan du snang ba de ni de'i dmigs par 'gyur te /
translated: If you think that the sound itself appears as another aspect due to the nature of being fast, etc., then that is its object.

original: ji skad du /üîΩyul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid kyis //
analyzed: ji skad du / yul dang dus gzhan bdag nyid kyis //
translated: As it is said:üîΩThe external is observed in all aspects

original: phyi rol rnam kun dmigs pa yin //
analyzed: phyi rol rnam kun dmigs pa yin //
translated: By the nature of another place and time.

original: zhes ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: zhes ji skad du bshad pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think this,

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: then here we say:

original: don de nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don de nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: That very object, etc.

original: 'gal zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi rnam pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos can gcig la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal zhes bya ba ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid kyi rnam pa dag ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis chos can gcig la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Contradictory‚Äù means that the aspects of being the same and being different are not suitable for a single subject because they are characterized by mutually excluding one another.

original: gzhan yang shes pa 'di thams cad 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang shes pa 'di thams cad 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, all these consciousnesses are mistaken.

original: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yul med pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i phyogs dang rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang yul med pa nyid yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The following verse is stated to demonstrate that the position of no aspects and the position of aspects are both devoid of objects.

original: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa la //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa'i shes pa la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Consciousness without aspects

original: shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don du gtogs pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ni don du gtogs pa nyid nyams su myong ba yin gyi /
translated: The aspects of blue, etc., of those who advocate consciousness without aspects are experienced as belonging to the object.

original: ji ltar 'khrul ba'i shes pa la ser po la sogs pa snang ba de ltar dung la sogs pa'i don gnas pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yul med pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul ba'i shes pa la ser po la sogs pa snang ba de ltar dung la sogs pa'i don gnas pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yul med pa nyid gsal rab pa nyid do //
translated: Since the object, such as a conch, does not exist as it appears to an erroneous consciousness, such as the appearance of yellow, etc., it is very clear that it is devoid of an object.

original: 'on te ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gal te don don du gtogs pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de shes par gtogs par 'gyur dgos te /üîΩde lta ma yin te gnyi @180a * //
analyzed: 'on te ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa gal te don don du gtogs pa ma yin pa de'i tshe gdon mi za bar de shes par gtogs par 'gyur dgos te / de lta ma yin te gnyi @180a * //
translated: But if the aspects of yellow, etc., do not belong to the object, then they must definitely belong to consciousness.

original: ga la yang med na ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ga la yang med na ji ltar nyams su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: If they do not belong to either, then how could they be experienced?

original: de lta yin dang shes par gtogs pa yin na ji ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de lta yin dang shes par gtogs pa yin na ji ltar shes pa rnam pa med pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: If that is so, and it belongs to consciousness, how can it be said that consciousness is without aspect?

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi /
translated: This is true, but

original: 'on kyang shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs khas blangs nas shes pa'i yul med pa 'di brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa rnam pa med par smra ba'i phyogs khas blangs nas shes pa'i yul med pa 'di brjod de /
translated: we have stated that consciousness is without aspect from the standpoint of the opponent.

original: gang zhig shes pa rnam pa med par 'dod pa de nyid la 'dir lan brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: gang zhig shes pa rnam pa med par 'dod pa de nyid la 'dir lan brjod par bya'o //
translated: We reply to those who assert that consciousness is without aspect.

original: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba las don nyams su myong bar 'jog ste /
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa'i phyogs la yang don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba las don nyams su myong bar 'jog ste /
translated: In the case of consciousness with aspect, the object is posited as experienced on the basis of the experience of an aspect that resembles the object.

original: 'khrul ba'i shes pa la don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir yul med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul ba'i shes pa la don dang 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kyi rnam pa nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir yul med pa nyid yin no //
translated: But since mistaken consciousness does not experience an aspect that resembles the object, there is no object.

original: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dag las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bcas pa dang rnam pa med pa dag las gzhan pa'i rnam pa'i rnam pa'i yul 'dzin pa'i shes pa yod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Also, there is no consciousness that apprehends an aspect of an object that is different from that which has an aspect and that which is without aspect.

original: de lta bas na 'khrul ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'khrul ba'i shes pa thams cad yul med pa yin no zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: Therefore, it is established that all erroneous cognitions are without objects.

original: 'di la 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan yang srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di la 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan yang srid pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that there is no basis for error in this regard, he says:

original: gsal byed yod par rigs ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gsal byed yod par rigs ma yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: It is not reasonable that there be manifestation.

original: gsal bar byed pa tha dad pa ni sgra tsam sgra la tha dad 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan du brjod la /
analyzed: gsal bar byed pa tha dad pa ni sgra tsam sgra la tha dad 'khrul ba'i rgyu mtshan du brjod la /
translated: The manifestation of difference is said to be the basis for error in the manifestation of sound in sound.

original: rtag pa la ni gsal bar byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni gsal bar byed pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But there is no manifestation whatsoever in the permanent,

original: de la de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la de cung zad kyang mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not perform any function in regard to it.

original: khyad par cung zad kyang mi byed pa de ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par cung zad kyang mi byed pa de ni gsal bar byed par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That which does not perform any function whatsoever is not reasonable as a manifestation,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that anything would be a manifestation.

original: de lta na gang su yang rung ba gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gang su yang rung ba gsal bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, anything whatsoever would be a manifestation.

original: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa'i legs par byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra tsam ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal bar byed pa'i legs par byed pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir sgra tsam ste /
translated: Therefore, because it conforms to the manifestation of the well-made, sound is the well-made.

original: sgra la blo tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra la blo tha dad par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable for there to be different cognitions of sound.

original: dper na sgron ma la sogs pa //
analyzed: dper na sgron ma la sogs pa //
translated: For example, it was said:

original: mig gi phan 'dogs byed pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mig gi phan 'dogs byed pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it assists the eye,üîΩlike a lamp, etc.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshigs su bcad pa snga ma 'di'i don nye bar bkod nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa la sogs pas sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la tshigs su bcad pa gcig gis tshigs su bcad pa snga ma 'di'i don nye bar bkod nas tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa la sogs pas sun dbyung ba'i phyir /
translated: In response to that, in one verse he sets forth the meaning of the previous verse, and in the second verse and so on he refutes it.

original: ji ltar bum sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar bum sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf a pot, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: rna ba legs par byas su zin na yang /üîΩci sgra rang bzhin gyi rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes par shes pa skyed par nus sam /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas su zin na yang / ci sgra rang bzhin gyi rang gi yul can gyi rnam par shes par shes pa skyed par nus sam /
translated: Even if the ear is well formed,üîΩit must be asked whether it is able to generate a cognition that is the natural object of sound or not.

original: 'on te mi nus zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: 'on te mi nus zhes bya ba 'di brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: The first position is that it is able to generate a cognition that is the natural object of sound.

original: phyogs dang po rna ba legs par byas pa las sngar yang dmigs par @180b thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po rna ba legs par byas pa las sngar yang dmigs par @180b thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The consequence of that is that it would be observed even before the ear is well formed.

original: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni /üîΩrna ba legs par byas na don //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'chad pa ni / rna ba legs par byas na don //
translated: To explain this, he says,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf the ear is well formed, the object,‚Äù and so on.

original: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means ‚Äúfor that reason.‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni sgra'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to sound.

original: spyo ba ni /
analyzed: spyo ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúRebuke‚Äù means

original: gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa //
analyzed: gang rgyu ma tshang ba med pa //
translated: ‚Äúthat which is not incomplete as a cause.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du brjod par bya ba la /
translated: The rest is as before.

original: rna ba legs par byas pa don med par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas pa don med par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the ear is well formed, it is not useless.

original: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci ste phyogs gnyis pa yin na de'i tshe /
translated: But if the second position is maintained, then

original: rna ba legs par byas na yang sgra dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas na yang sgra dmigs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: even if the ear is well formed, sound is not perceived,

original: sgra thams cad kyi tshe mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra thams cad kyi tshe mi rung ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for all sounds to occur.

original: de lta yin dang phyogs 'di la yang rna ba legs par byas pa don med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang phyogs 'di la yang rna ba legs par byas pa don med pa nyid yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then in this position also, the well formed ear would be useless.

original: sbyor ba ni gang dag gang skyed par byed pa ni mi rung ba'i gnas skabs las khyad par med pa de ni de byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang dag gang skyed par byed pa ni mi rung ba'i gnas skabs las khyad par med pa de ni de byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The argument is this: That which does not differ from a state in which it is not a producer is not a producer of that,

original: dper na ko tra pas s'a lu'i myu gu mi byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ko tra pas s'a lu'i myu gu mi byed pa bzhin no //
translated: like a kotrava seed is not a producer of a rice sprout.

original: rna ba legs par byas na yang sgra shes par skyed par mi rung gnas skabs las khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o //üîΩ'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas na yang sgra shes par skyed par mi rung gnas skabs las khyad par med do zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa'o // 'di ma grub pa yang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: If the ear is well-formed, it is not suitable to generate the consciousness of sound; if it is not well-formed, it is not suitable to generate the consciousness of sound.üîΩThere is no difference in the situation. This is a non-observation of a more extensive property.üîΩIt is not the case that this is not established.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'gyur na yang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: If it were possible,

original: rung ba nyid kyis 'brel ba gang la yod pa de ni rung ba nyid dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rung ba nyid kyis 'brel ba gang la yod pa de ni rung ba nyid dang ldan pa'o //
translated: that which has a connection with suitability has suitability.

original: gal te sgra shes pa skyed pa la rgyu yin par 'dod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sgra shes pa skyed pa la rgyu yin par 'dod par gyur na /
translated: If it were to become the cause for generating the consciousness of sound,

original: de'i tshe de de la rung ngam mi rung ba nyid du rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe de de la rung ngam mi rung ba nyid du rnam par rtog pa 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: at that time, would it not be the case that the conceptual thought of suitability or unsuitability would engage it?

original: gang gi phyir legs par byas pa'i rna ba nyid sgra dmigs pa la rgyu yin par 'dod kyi sgra ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir legs par byas pa'i rna ba nyid sgra dmigs pa la rgyu yin par 'dod kyi sgra ni ma yin no //
translated: Because it is asserted that the well-formed ear itself is the cause for the observation of sound, not sound.üîΩTherefore, the fault of the consequence explained above will not occur.

original: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs par byas nas /
analyzed: des na ji skad du bshad pa'i thal bar 'gyur ba'i skyon du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di dogs par byas nas /
translated: Having anticipated this qualm,

original: lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to respond, he says:

original: sgra ni shes bya min par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sgra ni shes bya min par 'gyur // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Sound would not be an object of cognition.

original: de lta na rol sogs pa bzhin du sgra nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta na rol sogs pa bzhin du sgra nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because sound is not required, like taste, etc.,

original: shes pa des shes par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa des shes par bya ba nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it would not be an object of cognition by that cognition.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa gang la nyer bar mkho bar ma gyur ba de ni shes pa des shes par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig shes pa gang la nyer bar mkho bar ma gyur ba de ni shes pa des shes par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: The application of the reason is this: That which is not required by a cognition is not an object of cognition by that cognition,

original: dper na rna ba'i shes pa la rol sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rna ba'i shes pa la rol sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: like taste, etc., by auditory cognition.

original: sgra yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i la /
analyzed: sgra yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i la /
translated: Sound is not required by auditory cognition.

original: nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mkho ba ma yin no zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa'o //
translated: This is the observation of a contradiction with a pervasion.

original: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ma nges pa yang ma yin /
translated: This is not indeterminate.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang shes bya nyid yin na /
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yang shes bya nyid yin na /
translated: If that which is not a benefit is an object of cognition,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro la sogs pa yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i shes bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro la sogs pa yang rna ba'i rnam par shes pa'i shes bya nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would follow, absurdly, that taste, etc., would also be objects of auditory cognition, because there would be no certainty.üîΩIf you accept
the original premise,üîΩthen it would follow, absurdly, that sound would not be an object of auditory cognition, because it is not a benefit.

original: te rang gi rgyu nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: te rang gi rgyu nges par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the cause itself is ascertained?

original: 'di ltar legs par bya ba'i rna ba dang mtshungs par de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag las shes pa skye ba na sgra rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar skye'i /
analyzed: 'di ltar legs par bya ba'i rna ba dang mtshungs par de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa dag las shes pa skye ba na sgra rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar skye'i /
translated: In this way, when consciousness arises from the immediately preceding condition and so on, which are similar to the well-made ear, it arises only in the aspect of the realization of sound.

original: ro rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ro rtogs pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin no //
translated: It does not arise in the aspect of the realization of taste.

original: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the power of the cause is individually ascertained.

original: sgra rgyu nyid du khas len na yang gdon mi za bar rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
analyzed: sgra rgyu nyid du khas len na yang gdon mi za bar rgyu'i nus pa so sor nges pa khas blang bar bya dgos te /
translated: Even if one accepts that sound is the cause, one must certainly accept that the power of the cause is individually ascertained.

original: 'di ltar thams cad rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang ci'i phyir shes pa sgra rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'byung gi rna ba la sogs pa rtog pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin zhes rgol na /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad rgyu nyid du mtshungs na yang ci'i phyir shes pa sgra rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'byung gi rna ba la sogs pa rtog pa'i bdag nyid du ni ma yin zhes rgol na /
translated: In this way, if one argues that when all are similar in being the cause, why does consciousness arise only in the aspect of the realization of sound and not in the aspect of the realization of the ear and so on?

original: rgyu'i nus pas so sor nges pa'i sgo kho na nas lan brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di thams cad dpyad na ma nges pa nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir /üîΩlegs byas rna ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: rgyu'i nus pas so sor nges pa'i sgo kho na nas lan brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba 'di thams cad dpyad na ma nges pa nyid spang bar bya ba'i phyir / legs byas rna ba la sogs pa //
translated: All of this is analyzed in order to avoid the uncertainty of the reply.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩji ltar phyogs 'di mi 'thad pa de ltar phyis /üîΩsgra dang shes pa'i 'brel pa gang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ro //üîΩlegs byas rna ba la sogs pa //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / ji ltar phyogs 'di mi 'thad pa de ltar phyis / sgra dang shes pa'i 'brel pa gang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston par 'gyur ro // legs byas rna ba la sogs pa //
translated: The reply is given by ‚ÄúThe good action is the ear, etc.‚ÄùüîΩThe phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the immediately preceding condition, etc.

original: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i sogs pa'i sgras mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen la sogs pa gzung ngo zhes bya ba ni khas len pa'o //
translated: This is the acceptance.

original: gal te sgra rgyu ma yin pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na ste /
analyzed: gal te sgra rgyu ma yin pa de lta na yang nyes pa yod pa kho na ste /
translated: If the sound is not the cause, then there is still the fault.

original: 'di ltar ci sgra 'di rang bzhin gyi shes pa des shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci sgra 'di rang bzhin gyi shes pa des shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin nam /
translated: In this way, the two positions are: Is the sound the nature that is to be known by that consciousness?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes bya ba phyogs gnyis so //
translated: Or is it not?

original: phyogs dang po la skyon bshad pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs dang po la skyon bshad pa ni /
translated: The first position is explained to be faulty:

original: shes te shes bya'i ngo bo can //
analyzed: shes te shes bya'i ngo bo can //
translated: It would be the nature of the object of knowledge.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: And so on.

original: gal te sgra shes pa des shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te sgra shes pa des shes par bya ba'i rang bzhin yin na de'i tshe /
translated: If that consciousness of sound were the nature of the object of consciousness, then,

original: sgra'i ngo bo bzhin du de'i rnam par shes pa yang dus thams cad du rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra'i ngo bo bzhin du de'i rnam par shes pa yang dus thams cad du rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: like the nature of sound, its consciousness would always be permanent,

original: de'i shes bya'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes bya'i rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be engaged in the nature of the object of its consciousness.

original: dbyig pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha sbyin rjes su 'jug pa na dbyig pa rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //üîΩshes dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: dbyig pa dang 'brel pa'i rang bzhin gyi lha sbyin rjes su 'jug pa na dbyig pa rjes su 'jug par mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // shes dang shes bya'i rang bzhin ni //
translated: When Devadatta, whose nature is connected with a stick, is engaged, it is not that the stick is not engaged.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The nature of consciousness and the object of consciousnessüîΩ.

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir shes pa dang shes bya dag gi rang bzhin lu gu rgyud bzhin du sbrel ba de'i phyir gcig yod pa na gnyis pa yang yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir shes pa dang shes bya dag gi rang bzhin lu gu rgyud bzhin du sbrel ba de'i phyir gcig yod pa na gnyis pa yang yod par 'gyur te /
translated: Because the nature of consciousness and the object of consciousness are connected like a chain, therefore when one exists, the other also exists.

original: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar grub po //
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar grub po //
translated: because there is no error.

original: de lta yin mod ci nyes she na /
analyzed: de lta yin mod ci nyes she na /
translated: What is wrong with that?

original: legs byas rna bas bskyed bya ba //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: legs byas rna bas bskyed bya ba // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The ear is the producer of what is well-done.

original: legs @181b byas rna bas bskyed bya ba //
analyzed: legs @181b byas rna bas bskyed bya ba //
translated: The ear is the producer of what is well-done,

original: gang phyir shes pa dang 'brel pa'i //üîΩzhes bya bar sgra rjes su 'jug ces bya ba khong nas 'byung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang phyir shes pa dang 'brel pa'i // zhes bya bar sgra rjes su 'jug ces bya ba khong nas 'byung bar bya'o //
translated: because it is connected with consciousness.üîΩThe ear is the producer of what is well-done, because sound is connected with consciousness that is produced by the well-done ear.

original: gang gi phyir legs par byas pa'i rna bas bskyed par byas pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa'i sgra thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir rna ba legs par ma byas kyang de'i shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir legs par byas pa'i rna bas bskyed par byas pa'i shes pa dang 'brel pa'i sgra thams cad du rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir rna ba legs par ma byas kyang de'i shes par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, even when the ear is not well-done, it is the consciousness of that.

original: rna ba legs par byas pa don med do //
analyzed: rna ba legs par byas pa don med do //
translated: So it is pointless to make the ear well-done.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang skyon 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang skyon 'chad pa ni /
translated: The error in the second position is stated:

original: sgra de'i shes bya'i bdag ma yin //
analyzed: sgra de'i shes bya'i bdag ma yin //
translated: That sound is not the self of the object of consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste go bar zad do //
translated: And so on, the meaning is clear.

original: 'di thams cad ni des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i shes pa yang de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas brjod la /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni des phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa'i shes pa yang de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas brjod la /
translated: All of these are stated by accepting that consciousness is not to be benefited by it, but it is the nature of the realization of that.

original: da ni shes pa'i de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni shes pa'i de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin 'brel pa med par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that it is not logical for the nature of the realization of consciousness to be unrelated, he says:

original: sgra dang 'brel ba shes pa gang //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgra dang 'brel ba shes pa gang // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Any consciousness related to soundüîΩis not the nature of the realization of that.

original: dngos po rnams kyi 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi 'brel pa ni rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: The relationship of things is only of two types:

original: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'o //
translated: identity and origination.

original: gzhan du ni phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du ni phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, there would be no benefit.

original: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni 'brel pa yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba dang phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa dag ni 'brel pa yin par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not logical that that which is not to be benefited and that which benefits are related,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that anything could be related to anything.

original: 'brel pa de rnam pa gnyis char yang shes pa dang sgra dag la med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brel pa de rnam pa gnyis char yang shes pa dang sgra dag la med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since that relationship does not exist in either of the two modes in consciousness and sound,

original: ji ltar 'brel pa med par de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'brel pa med par de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be a cognition that is essentially the understanding of that, when there is no relation?

original: gzhan du na /
analyzed: gzhan du na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: there would be an extreme absurdity.

original: yang ci ste 'brel pa med par yang de'i rnam par skyes pas de'i shes pa de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag go snyam na /
analyzed: yang ci ste 'brel pa med par yang de'i rnam par skyes pas de'i shes pa de rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du rnam par gzhag go snyam na /
translated: But if you think that even without a relation, because it is produced in the aspect of that, the cognition of that is posited as essentially the understanding of that,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is not logical,

original: shes pa rnam pa med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa rnam pa med par khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because you accept that cognition is without aspect.

original: 'di ltar dpyod pa pa rnams kyis ni shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par khas len pa ma yin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar dpyod pa pa rnams kyis ni shes pa rnam pa dang bcas par khas len pa ma yin no /
translated: In this way, the ƒÄryas do not accept that cognition has aspects.

original: khas len du chug mod de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khas len du chug mod de lta na yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if you accept that, it is still not logical,

original: sgra lkog tu gyur pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra lkog tu gyur pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that sound would be hidden.

original: de lta na yang sgra lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang sgra lkog tu gyur pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: In that case, sound would be only hidden,

original: mngon sum pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: but it would not be manifest.

original: de lta yin dang de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That being so, there would be no valid knowledge that establishes it.

original: shes pa de ni de'i rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba de nyid du yang sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa de ni de'i rnam pa can yin no zhes bya ba de nyid du yang sgrub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not established that consciousness has the aspect of that.

original: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang de 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu ldog pa las kyang de 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it established from the cessation of the effect,

original: de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa nyid du khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is accepted that it is not a producer.

original: 'di snyam du shes pa dang bcas par smra ba gang dag gi ltar na skyed par byed pa kho na yul yin pa de dag @182a * //
analyzed: 'di snyam du shes pa dang bcas par smra ba gang dag gi ltar na skyed par byed pa kho na yul yin pa de dag @182a * //
translated: If you think that for those who assert that consciousness is associated with objects,

original: gi ltar na yang don thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid du ji ltar rtogs snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gi ltar na yang don thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir shes pa don gyi rnam pa can nyid du ji ltar rtogs snyam du sems na /
translated: since the object is always hidden, how is it understood that consciousness has the aspect of the object?

original: bden te 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las 'bras bu rtogs pa las rgyu gzhan nges pa dang shes pa de sngon po'i rnam pa tha dad par byed pa nyid kyis nges pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i thabs yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las 'bras bu rtogs pa las rgyu gzhan nges pa dang shes pa de sngon po'i rnam pa tha dad par byed pa nyid kyis nges pa gang yin pa 'di ni de'i thabs yin te /
translated: It is true, but still, from the perspective of the effect, the ascertainment of the cause from positive and negative concomitance and the ascertainment of that consciousness as the cause of the aspect of blue is the method for understanding that.

original: 'di ltar mig dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ni shes pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa ni des byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis bzlog pa las rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog pa gangüîΩyin pa de tha dad pa 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges te /
