analyzed: 'di ltar mig dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams ni shes pa thams cad la mtshungs pa'i phyir shes pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i tha dad pa ni des byas pa ma yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis bzlog pa las rgyu gzhan rjes su dpog pa gang yin pa de tha dad pa 'di ni des byas pa yin no zhes bya bar nges te /
translated: Therefore, it is ascertained that the difference of consciousness is created by another cause that is inferred by implication.

original: de'i rnam pa 'di des byas pa'i phyir shes pas gzung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag la /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa 'di des byas pa'i phyir shes pas gzung ba yin no zhes rnam par gzhag la /
translated: The aspect of that consciousness is apprehended by consciousness because it is created by it.

original: thams cad 'di yang khyed cag la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad 'di yang khyed cag la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so for you.

original: de rgyu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rgyu nyid du khas mi len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you do not accept that it is the cause.

original: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa yang thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mig la sogs pa yang thams cad kyi tshe lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: You may think, ‚ÄúBecause the eye and so on are always hidden,

original: shes pa thams cad la khyad par med pa nyid ci ltar nges snyam du sems na /
analyzed: shes pa thams cad la khyad par med pa nyid ci ltar nges snyam du sems na /
translated: how can it be ascertained that they are not different in all consciousnesses?‚Äù

original: 'di ni bden mod kyi bsam pa 'di ni rnam par shes par smra ba'i yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden mod kyi bsam pa 'di ni rnam par shes par smra ba'i yin te /
translated: This is true, but this is the opinion of the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba de ni de rmi lam la sogs bzhin du shes pa'i khyad par mtshung  pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis byas par brjod kyi phyi rol gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba de ni de rmi lam la sogs bzhin du shes pa'i khyad par mtshung  pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gyis byas par brjod kyi phyi rol gyis byas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins say that the object is produced by the immediately antecedent condition, just as a dream object is.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don yod na 'di thams cad brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don yod na 'di thams cad brjod de /
translated: But if external objects exist, all of this is explained.

original: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu ldog na yang ji ltar phyi rol gyi don 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di brtsad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'bras bu ldog na yang ji ltar phyi rol gyi don 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba 'di brtsad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Otherwise, when the effect is stopped, how could the external object be established?

original: rgyu tsam yod pa nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi phyi rol ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu tsam yod pa nyid du grub par 'gyur gyi phyi rol ni ma yin te /
translated: Only the existence of a cause is established, not an external object,

original: rgyu de yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i nang du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu de yang rmi lam la sogs pa'i nang du yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that cause is possible even in a dream, etc.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: yang ci ste sgra skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa de lta na skyon yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang ci ste sgra skyed par byed pa nyid du khas blangs pa de lta na skyon yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that there is a fault if one accepts that sound is productive, he says,

original: de las byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las byung na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it arises from that, etc.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni de las byung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the ear.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù and so on concludes the argument.

original: yang na min zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o //
analyzed: yang na min zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyogs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr not‚Äù refers to the position that it is not a producer.

original: de ltar nges par zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar nges par zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThus, it is certain‚Äù

original: shes pa rtag tu yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa na'o //
analyzed: shes pa rtag tu yod pa dang med pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa na'o //
translated: that consciousness has the characteristic of sometimes existing and sometimes not existing.

original: de ltar re zhig rna ba legs par byas pa khas blangs nas yul skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin bsam pas rna ba @182b legs par byas pa don med pa bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig rna ba legs par byas pa khas blangs nas yul skyed par byed pa dang skyed par byed pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin bsam pas rna ba @182b legs par byas pa don med pa bstan to //
translated: Thus, having accepted that the ear is well-constructed, the author demonstrates that it is pointless to construct the ear, since one cannot determine whether the object is produced or not produced.

original: da ni rna ba legs par byas pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rna ba legs par byas pa nyid mi srid par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that the ear is not well-constructed, he says:

original: legs byas res 'ga' ba yin na //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: legs byas res 'ga' ba yin na // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the ear were well-constructed,üîΩit would be well-constructed at all times.

original: gal te legs par byas pa res 'ga' ba yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te legs par byas pa res 'ga' ba yin par gyur na /
translated: If the ear were well-constructed, it would be well-constructed at all times.

original: de lta na legs par byas pa'i 'bras bu shes pa yang res 'ga' bar rigs te /
analyzed: de lta na legs par byas pa'i 'bras bu shes pa yang res 'ga' bar rigs te /
translated: In that case, it would be logical that the result of proper action would sometimes not be known.

original: gzhan du ni rgyu rtag tu ma tshang ba med par gnas pa na ci'i phyir de'i 'bras bu res 'ga' bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du ni rgyu rtag tu ma tshang ba med par gnas pa na ci'i phyir de'i 'bras bu res 'ga' bar 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, if the cause always abides without being incomplete, why would its result sometimes not occur?

original: rtag pa'i rna ba legs par byed pa res 'ga' bar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtag pa'i rna ba legs par byed pa res 'ga' bar rigs pa yang ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To demonstrate that it is illogical for the proper action of a permanent ear to sometimes not occur, he says:

original: legs byas nus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: legs byas nus pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Proper action is only capable of producing a result.

original: 'di ltar rna ba la sogs pa'i legs par byed pa ni 'bras bu shes pas nges par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rna ba la sogs pa'i legs par byed pa ni 'bras bu shes pas nges par byas pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the proper action of the ear and so on is ascertained by the result, knowledge.

original: 'bras bus nges par byas pa yin pa na legs par byas pa nus pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'bras bus nges par byas pa yin pa na legs par byas pa nus pa'i bdag nyid kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is ascertained by the result, then proper action would only have the nature of capability,

original: nus pa nyid 'bras bus nges par byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa nyid 'bras bus nges par byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because capability is ascertained by the result.

original: nus pa de yang rna ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nus pa de yang rna ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa nyid yin gyi tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, that capability is the nature of the ear itself, it is not separate.

original: de nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir rna ba byed pa po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir rna ba byed pa po ma yin par thal ba'i phyir dang 'brel pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect arises from that, it follows that the ear is not the agent, and because the connection is not established.

original: nus pa yod na de las byung ba'i shes pa rtag tu yod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nus pa yod na de las byung ba'i shes pa rtag tu yod par 'gyur la /
translated: If there is potential, then the consciousness that arises from it would always exist.

original: ci ste med par gyur na de'i tshe de las byung ba'i shes pa nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste med par gyur na de'i tshe de las byung ba'i shes pa nam yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But if it does not exist, then the consciousness that arises from it would never arise.

original: de lta yin dang de shes pa res 'ga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang de shes pa res 'ga' bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then that consciousness would not sometimes occur.

original: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba rna ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis legs par bya ba ji ltar ston par byed de ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba rna ba'i nus pa'i mtshan nyid kyis legs par bya ba ji ltar ston par byed de ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, how could the consciousness that sometimes occurs be well explained by the characteristic of the potential of the ear? It could not!

original: yang ci ste 'bras bu shes pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'i nus pa rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang ci ste 'bras bu shes pas rjes su dpag par bya ba'i nus pa rang bzhin du gyur pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, if the potential that is to be inferred by the effect, consciousness, were the nature of the ear itself,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what would it be?

original: sgra tsam rnams kyis rna ba'i snga na med pa'i nus pa res 'ga' bar byed pa yin la /
analyzed: sgra tsam rnams kyis rna ba'i snga na med pa'i nus pa res 'ga' bar byed pa yin la /
translated: The potential of the ear, which is a non-previous state, is sometimes made by mere sounds.

original: de nyid shes pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid shes pas rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be inferred from the knowledge of reality.

original: des na rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nus pa ston par byed pa 'thad pa yin no snyam na /üîΩrna ba la nus skyed pa na //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa res 'ga' ba nus pa ston par byed pa 'thad pa yin no snyam na / rna ba la nus skyed pa na //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that consciousness, which is sometimes manifest, manifests potency.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, the root text states, ‚ÄúWhen the potency is generated in the ear,‚Äù and so on.

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa'am /üîΩtha dad pa'am /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa'am / tha dad pa'am /
translated: The ear is either identical to the potency,üîΩdifferent from the potency,

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa byed ces bya ba phyogs gsum mo //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i nus pa byed ces bya ba phyogs gsum mo //
translated: or the potency is neither identical to nor different from the ear.

original: phyogs dang po la nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rna ba gnyi ga'i bdag kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la nus pa'i rang gi ngo bo bzhin du rna ba gnyi ga'i bdag kyang mi rtag pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first case, like the nature of the potency itself, the self of both ears would be impermanent.

original: gang las she na skye phyir te 'byung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩyang ci ste /üîΩrna ba nus pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas @183a * //
analyzed: gang las she na skye phyir te 'byung ba'i phyir ro // yang ci ste / rna ba nus pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid du khas @183a * //
translated: Why? Because it arises.

original: len pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: len pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But if you do not accept that the ear is not different from the potency,

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: then what do you accept?

original: rna ba nus pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid do snyam na /
analyzed: rna ba nus pa las gzhan ma yin pa nyid do snyam na /
translated: You accept that the ear is not different from the potency.

original: ches blun pa'i spyod pa 'di la ltos shig / ji ltar rang bzhin gcig 'byar ba na de nyid kyi tshe gzhan ring bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ches blun pa'i spyod pa 'di la ltos shig / ji ltar rang bzhin gcig 'byar ba na de nyid kyi tshe gzhan ring bar 'gyur te /
translated: When they are joined together as one nature, at that time the other becomes distant,

original: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i mtshan nyid phan tshun rang bzhin rjes su 'jug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristic of non-difference is the mutual non-concomitance of their natures.

original: chu dang 'o ma yul thag ring bar gnas pa na de dang 'byar ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: chu dang 'o ma yul thag ring bar gnas pa na de dang 'byar ba nyams su myong ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: When water and milk are located far apart, their joining together is not experienced.üîΩEven if one allows this position, still there is no fault.

original: phyogs 'di yin du chug pa de lta na yang nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phyogs 'di yin du chug pa de lta na yang nyes pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: dngos dang tha dad med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos dang tha dad med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Because it is not different from the entity,

original: dngos po'i ring gi ngo bo bzhin du legs par byas pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po'i ring gi ngo bo bzhin du legs par byas pa yang rtag pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Just as the nature of the entity is distant, so too would the good be permanent,

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not different.

original: de lta yin dang skyon gzhan 'di yang yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: de lta yin dang skyon gzhan 'di yang yin no zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: If that were so, there would be another fault.üîΩTo explain this, he says,

original: des na des bskyed bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: des na des bskyed bya'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, the produced by that, etc.

original: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nyes pa bstan pa ni tha dad na ni tha dad na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa la yang nyes pa bstan pa ni tha dad na ni tha dad na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The second position is also shown to be faulty: If different, then the difference would be perceived, but it is not perceived.

original: nus pa dngos po las tha dad pa nyid du khas len pa na 'di de'i nus pa zhes 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nus pa dngos po las tha dad pa nyid du khas len pa na 'di de'i nus pa zhes 'brel pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that potentiality is different from the thing, then the relation of this is that potentiality would not be established,

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa ni gzhan gyi dbang du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is not to be benefited cannot be controlled by another.

original: rna ba nus pa byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rna ba nus pa byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The ear does not produce potentiality,

original: sgra la sogs pa'i gsal bar byed pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa'i gsal bar byed pa nyid phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the manifestation of sound and so on is accepted as the benefit.

original: ci ste rna ba yang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na de bzhin du nus pa phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang rna ba las tha dad pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste rna ba yang phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin na de bzhin du nus pa phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa yang rna ba las tha dad pa'i phyir thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But if the ear is also a benefit, then in the same way, the potentiality of the benefit is also different from the ear, so there would be an infinite regress.

original: de lta na nus pa rnams kyi brgyud pa ma grub pa'i phyir skabs kyi don grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na nus pa rnams kyi brgyud pa ma grub pa'i phyir skabs kyi don grub pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, since the series of potentialities is not established, the meaning of the context is not established.

original: gzhan yang nus pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir rna ba byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang nus pa kho na las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir rna ba byed pa po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, because the effect arises from the potentiality alone, the ear does not become the agent.

original: de lta yin dang dngos po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang dngos po nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, it would follow that it is not a thing.

original: ci ste nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa tha mi dad par khas len par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste nus pa la phan 'dogs par byed pa'i nus pa tha mi dad par khas len par byed na /
translated: But if you accept that the potentiality is not different from that which assists the potentiality,

original: de ni dngos po'i nus pa tha mi dad pa la ci zhig zhe sdang / gzhan yang nus pa rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni dngos po'i nus pa tha mi dad pa la ci zhig zhe sdang / gzhan yang nus pa rtag tu skye bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then why do you hate the non-difference of the potentiality of a thing? Moreover, it follows that the potentiality would always arise,

original: de'i rgyu rna ba rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu rna ba rtag pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because its cause, the ear, is permanent.

original: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: phan gdags par bya ba ma yin pa yang lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And that which is not to be assisted does not depend on any cooperating conditions.

original: phyogs gsum pa la /üîΩtha dad tha mi dad spangs pa'i //
analyzed: phyogs gsum pa la / tha dad tha mi dad spangs pa'i //
translated: In the third position,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúAbandoning difference and non-difference,‚Äù and so on.

original: bsal zin zhes bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa dgag pa rnams su ste /
analyzed: bsal zin zhes bya ba ni gang zag la sogs pa dgag pa rnams su ste /
translated: ‚ÄúAlready refuted‚Äù refers to the refutations of the person and so on.

original: gcig nyid gcig @183b gi tshe bsgrub pa dang dgag par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig nyid gcig @183b gi tshe bsgrub pa dang dgag par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not suitable to establish or refute one thing as one thing.

original: 'di ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa phan tshun spangs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa phan tshun spangs te /
translated: Thus, difference and non-difference are mutually exclusive.

original: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag las gcig gi rang bzhin rnam par bcad pa nyid kyis gzhan yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas pa'i mtshan nyid dag las gcig gi rang bzhin rnam par bcad pa nyid kyis gzhan yongs su gcod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of one is eliminated, the other is excluded.

original: gang zhig gang bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa med par rang bzhin yongs su mi gcod pa de ni yongs su bcad nas gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa med par rang bzhin yongs su mi gcod pa de ni yongs su bcad nas gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: That which does not eliminate its own nature without eliminating something else excludes its own nature,

original: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag las gang yang rung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag las gang yang rung ba bzhin no //
translated: because it abides by excluding something else, like any one of existence and nonexistence.üîΩAnd that which is mutually exclusive does not occur without the negation of one nature establishing another, because it is established by the power of that.

original: gang yang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni rang bzhin gcig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid bkag pa na shugs kyis de'i bdag nyid sgrub pas de yang de nyid kyi tshe dgag par mi rigs
analyzed: gang yang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid de dag ni rang bzhin gcig dgag pa gzhan sgrub pa med na mi 'byung ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan nyid bkag pa na shugs kyis de'i bdag nyid sgrub pas de yang de nyid kyi tshe dgag par mi rigs
translated: Therefore, it is not suitable to refute that at that time.

original: te / gzhan nyid kyang ma bkag par thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i skyon phyogs gnyi ga la yang brjod par bya'o //üîΩgnyi ga legs par byas phyogs la //
analyzed: te / gzhan nyid kyang ma bkag par thal ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i skyon phyogs gnyi ga la yang brjod par bya'o // gnyi ga legs par byas phyogs la //
translated: The fault that it follows that difference is not refuted should be stated in the same way in both systems.üîΩIf you say, Both are good,

original: khyed kyi gnyis brjod log pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
analyzed: khyed kyi gnyis brjod log pa yin // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa 'di la /
translated: your statement is reversed.

original: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To this he says, By that very thing,

original: rang bzhin gyis shes pa skyed par rung ba dang mi rung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa'i sgo bas so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis shes pa skyed par rung ba dang mi rung ba'i rang bzhin rnam par brtags pa'i sgo bas so //
translated: by the gate of the examination of the nature of what is suitable and unsuitable to produce cognition by nature.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas mjug sdud par byed do //
translated: He concludes with Therefore, and so on.

original: rim pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras lu ta dang steng du 'don pa la sogs pa gzung ngo //üîΩgang dag sgra 'di ma phrad dang // skye ba rna bas 'dzin par byed //
analyzed: rim pa la sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgras lu ta dang steng du 'don pa la sogs pa gzung ngo // gang dag sgra 'di ma phrad dang // skye ba rna bas 'dzin par byed //
translated: The phrase order, and so on includes order, pronunciation, and so on.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: To the statement, Those who say this sound is apprehended by the ear without contact,

original: ji ltar ma phrad tsam mtshungs kyang //
analyzed: ji ltar ma phrad tsam mtshungs kyang //
translated: he says, Just as non-contact is the same,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: gal te thams cad dang ma phrad pa de lta na yang dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir yul thams cad 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te thams cad dang ma phrad pa de lta na yang dngos po rnams kyi nus pa so sor nges pa'i phyir yul thams cad 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you say that it is not so, because the capacity of things is individually distinct, then all objects would not be apprehended.

original: dper na khab long zhes bya ba'i rdo bas phrad pa'i lcags len na yang ma phrad pa thams cad mi len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khab long zhes bya ba'i rdo bas phrad pa'i lcags len na yang ma phrad pa thams cad mi len pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, a magnet attracts iron that is in contact with it, but it does not attract all that is not in contact with it.

original: gal te khab long zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag po'i lugs kyis dpe ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te khab long zhes bya ba la sogs pas bde byed bdag po'i lugs kyis dpe ma grub pa nyid du dogs pa yin te /
translated: If you say that the example of the magnet, etc. is not established in the system of the Vaise~ika, who maintain that the magnet has a soul,

original: de na re /
analyzed: de na re /
translated: then they say this:

original: de la yang nor bu khab long gi 'od reg pa'i dbang gis lcags len pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de la yang nor bu khab long gi 'od reg pa'i dbang gis lcags len pa yin gyi /
translated: The light of the magnet touches the iron and attracts it.

original: de lta ma yin na yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lcags len par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lcags len par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were otherwise, it would attract all the iron that exists in the world.

original: gal te yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od bzhin du de'i 'od ma dmigs pa de lta na yang chod pa dang ring ba len par ma mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no @184a * //üîΩzhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te yang sgron ma la sogs pa'i 'od bzhin du de'i 'od ma dmigs pa de lta na yang chod pa dang ring ba len par ma mthong ba'i phyir rjes su dpag par bya ba yin no @184a * //üîΩzhes zer ro //
translated: If you say that the light of the magnet is not perceived, like the light of a lamp, etc., then it is to be inferred because it is seen to attract what is hidden or distant.

original: 'od 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: 'od 'di zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: The response to this is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe light of the magnet,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas yod pa'i tha snyad 'gegs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas yod pa'i tha snyad 'gegs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The nonobservation of the imperceptible is what prevents the designation of existence.

original: gang yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lcags rnams len par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba sgrub par byed pa smras pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /üîΩ'od de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang yul thams cad na gnas pa'i lcags rnams len par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i thal ba sgrub par byed pa smras pa de'i lan gdab pa'i phyir / 'od de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to the argument that it follows that the magnet would attract all the iron in existence is stated in the lines beginning ‚ÄúThe light of the magnet,‚Äù and so on.

original: khab long gi 'od de shing la sogs pa phrad pa thams cad ci'i phyir mi len zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i phyogs la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs so //
analyzed: khab long gi 'od de shing la sogs pa phrad pa thams cad ci'i phyir mi len zhes bya ba ni phrad pa'i phyogs la yang thal bar 'gyur ba mtshungs so //
translated: Why does the light of the magnet not attract all the wood and so on that it comes into contact with? The absurd consequence is the same in the case of contact.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa'i phyir ha cang thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the absurd consequence does not follow because the natures of things are individually determined,

original: ma phrad pa'i phyogs la yang gang gis na de la mi 'dod pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa nyid sus phrogs /
analyzed: ma phrad pa'i phyogs la yang gang gis na de la mi 'dod pa dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin so sor nges pa nyid sus phrogs /
translated: then in the case of noncontact, too, what is it that prevents you from accepting that the natures of things are individually determined?

original: de lta bas na ma mthong ba'i 'od rtogs pa don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma mthong ba'i 'od rtogs pa don med pa yin no //
translated: If it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,

original: de la ring dang nyer gnas pa'i //
analyzed: de la ring dang nyer gnas pa'i //
translated: thenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,

original: 'dzin dang mi 'dzin mtshungs par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dzin dang mi 'dzin mtshungs par 'gyur //
translated: thenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthen

original: zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthen

original: ring dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ring dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: rim gyis 'dzin par ma grub ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dzin par ma grub ste /
translated: If it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,

original: sgra sbyor ba'i de ma thag tu thams cad kyi shes pa cig car skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra sbyor ba'i de ma thag tu thams cad kyi shes pa cig car skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: thenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthen

original: gsal gzhan la sogs 'byung ba'ang min //
analyzed: gsal gzhan la sogs 'byung ba'ang min //
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthen

original: zhes gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes gang smras pa de la /
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthen

original: ji ltar nye ring sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar nye ring sogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Here, it is said:üîΩIf it is the same for the apprehended and the non-apprehended,üîΩwhether far or near,üîΩthenüîΩHere, it is said:

original: ji ltar gzugs ma phrad pa dang / ma khyab pa 'dzin pa na gsal ba dang mi gsal bar mthong ba de bzhin du sgra yang ma khyab pa dang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa na gsal ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar gzugs ma phrad pa dang / ma khyab pa 'dzin pa na gsal ba dang mi gsal bar mthong ba de bzhin du sgra yang ma khyab pa dang ma phrad pa 'dzin pa na gsal ba dang gzhan pa la sogs pa rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the same for the apprehended and the non

original: 'on te gzhan la gzugs kyang ma phrad par 'dzin par ma grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan la gzugs kyang ma phrad par 'dzin par ma grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it also the case that the eye does not apprehend form without coming into contact with it?

original: de ji ltar dpe nyid du brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar dpe nyid du brjod ce na /
translated: How can you cite this as an example?

original: nyes pa 'di ni med de ;
analyzed: nyes pa 'di ni med de ;
translated: This is not a problem.

original: gal te yang gzhan la tshig tsam gyis ma grub pa de lta na yang tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang gzhan la tshig tsam gyis ma grub pa de lta na yang tshad mas grub pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga la yang grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Even though it is not established for the other party that the eye apprehends form without coming into contact with it, it is established for both parties that the eye does not apprehend form by coming into contact with it.

original: 'di lta yang tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta yang tshad ma gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the means of valid knowledge that establishes this?

original: nye ba dang bskal ba dag dus mtshungs par 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nye ba dang bskal ba dag dus mtshungs par 'dzin pa'o //
translated: It is direct perception, because the eye apprehends objects that are near and far at the same time.

original: gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa de ni nye bar myur du phyin cing bskal par yun ring po nas phyin te /
analyzed: gang 'gro ba dang ldan pa de ni nye bar myur du phyin cing bskal par yun ring po nas phyin te /
translated: That which is endowed with going goes quickly to what is near and goes slowly to what is far.

original: dper na lha sbyin grong nas gzhan du 'gro ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin grong nas gzhan du 'gro ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, Devadatta goes from one village to another.

original: shing gi yal ga dang zla ba yang dus mtshungs par mig phye ba'i de ma thag tu 'dzin par mthong ngo //
analyzed: shing gi yal ga dang zla ba yang dus mtshungs par mig phye ba'i de ma thag tu 'dzin par mthong ngo //
translated: The eye also apprehends the branches of a tree and the moon at the same time, because it sees them as soon as it is opened.

original: de lta bas na mig ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar go'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na mig ni ma phrad par 'dzin pa yin no zhes bya bar go'o //
translated: Therefore, the eye apprehends without coming into contact.

original: 'di 'od byed pa na re /
analyzed: 'di 'od byed pa na re /
translated: This is the position of the Illuminating Lamp.

original: shes pa myur du skye bas dus tha dad du @184b mi 'dzin pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes pa myur du skye bas dus tha dad du @184b mi 'dzin pa'i phyir log pa'i shes pa nyid yin te /
translated: Because consciousness arises quickly, it does not apprehend different times, so it is a mistaken consciousness.

original: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: autpala'i 'dab ma brgya 'bigs pa bzhin no zhes zer te /
translated: It is like piercing a hundred lotus petals.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /üîΩde lta na mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rim par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te / de lta na mtsho dang ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa la yang rim par zhen par mi 'gyur te /
translated: This is not correct.

original: mgyogs par 'byung bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mgyogs par 'byung bar mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, one would not conceive of lake and water and so on in sequence because they arise quickly.

original: de lta yin dang rtogs pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin dang rtogs pa tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, they would not be different realizations.üîΩAnd because all minds arise quickly, it would never be the case that they are apprehended in sequence.

original: blo thams cad la yang mgyogs par 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir nam yang rim can du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par dpyad zin to //
analyzed: blo thams cad la yang mgyogs par 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir nam yang rim can du 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di rgyas par dpyad zin to //
translated: This has been extensively analyzed.

original: yang de nyid na re /
analyzed: yang de nyid na re /
translated: Again, the same text says:

original: gal te yang mig ma phrad par 'dzin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yang mig ma phrad par 'dzin par gyur na /
translated: If the eye apprehends without contact,

original: de'i tshe rtsig pa la sogs pa la sgrib pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir sgrib pa mi 'thad pa dang / gang yang thag shin tu ring ba mi 'dzin la nye bar 'dzin pa der yang mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtsig pa la sogs pa la sgrib pa'i nus pa med pa'i phyir sgrib pa mi 'thad pa dang / gang yang thag shin tu ring ba mi 'dzin la nye bar 'dzin pa der yang mi 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, since there is no capacity to obstruct such things as walls, obstruction is untenable, and also it would not be the case that one does not apprehend a very distant object but does apprehend a nearby object, because there would be no difference between them.

original: 'di snyam du don gang kho na mig gi yul du 'gyur ba de kho na dmigs la /
analyzed: 'di snyam du don gang kho na mig gi yul du 'gyur ba de kho na dmigs la /
translated: If you think that only that object which becomes the object of the eye is apprehended,

original: gang mi 'gyur ba de mi dmigs so snyam du sems na /
analyzed: gang mi 'gyur ba de mi dmigs so snyam du sems na /
translated: and that which does not become the object of the eye is not apprehended,

original: de yang de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang de ltar ma yin te /
translated: then that is not so.

original: 'brel pa med par yul du 'gyur ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par yul du 'gyur ba nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is untenable that that which is unrelated becomes an object.

original: 'brel pa med par yul gyi dngos po yin pa 'di yang ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'brel pa med par yul gyi dngos po yin pa 'di yang ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this thing called ‚Äúan object‚Äù that is unrelated?

original: gang zhig khyed cag gis yul gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa de ni 'brel pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gang zhig khyed cag gis yul gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa de ni 'brel pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad pas khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhes zer ro //
translated: That which you call ‚Äúan object‚Äù is simply called ‚Äúrelated,‚Äù so there is no difference at all.

original: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis rgyu'i dngos po yul gyi ngo bo brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kho bo cag gis rgyu'i dngos po yul gyi ngo bo brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Because we state that the object is the cause, not the connection.

original: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa nyid du ston pa na yul gyi dngos po zhes brjod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig gi rnam par shes pa skyed pa la gzugs la sogs pa'i yul lhan cig byed pa nyid du ston pa na yul gyi dngos po zhes brjod kyi /
translated: Thus, when we show that the object, such as form, is the cooperative condition for the arising of visual consciousness, we say that the object is the cause.

original: de dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'dres pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not mixed with that.

original: lhan cig byed pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The meaning of cooperative condition is twofold:

original: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa ste /
analyzed: phan tshun du phan pa byed pa ste /
translated: that which is the mutual benefit,

original: dper na snang ba nas grib khang du zhugs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snang ba nas grib khang du zhugs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like, for example, a lamp and a house;

original: don gcig la byed pa ste dper na mig phye ba tsam gyis gzugs 'dzin pa lta bu yin na /
analyzed: don gcig la byed pa ste dper na mig phye ba tsam gyis gzugs 'dzin pa lta bu yin na /
translated: and that which is the single object, like, for example, the eye and form.

original: gnyi ga ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i khyad par nyid yul du brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar na yang rnam par shes pa'i rgyu'i khyad par nyid yul du brjod kyi 'brel pa ni ma yin no //
translated: In both cases, the cause of consciousness is stated to be the object, not the connection.

original: rgyu'i khyad par so sor nges pa de nyid 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par so sor nges pa de nyid 'brel pa med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
translated: If you say that the specific cause is the connection, that is not so.

original: rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las nges pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gis kha cig nyid shes pa skyed par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i nus pa las nges pa 'grub pa'i phyir ro // gang gis kha cig nyid shes pa skyed par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because ascertainment is established from the power of its cause.üîΩIf it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy does it generate the cognition of just that and not another?‚Äù

original: gzhan ni ma yin pa 'di la rang gi rgyu las skye ba na de lta bur gyur pa kho na skye ba yin te /üîΩdngos po thams @185a * //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin pa 'di la rang gi rgyu las skye ba na de lta bur gyur pa kho na skye ba yin te / dngos po thams @185a * //
translated: When it arises from its own cause, it arises just as it is.

original: cad ni rgyu tha dad pas rang bzhin tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cad ni rgyu tha dad pas rang bzhin tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all things have different natures due to having different causes.

original: dper na khyed cag la 'brel par 'dra bzhin du yang ci'i phyir mig gis gzugs kho na dmigs kyi ro ni ma yin /
analyzed: dper na khyed cag la 'brel par 'dra bzhin du yang ci'i phyir mig gis gzugs kho na dmigs kyi ro ni ma yin /
translated: For example, even though you have a similar connection, why does the eye apprehend just form and not taste?

original: de dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir mi dmigs so zhe na /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúIt does not apprehend because it is not connected to it,‚Äù

original: 'brel pa nyid du ci'i mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'brel pa nyid du ci'i mi 'gyur te /
translated: why is it not connected?

original: yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because the object is not different.

original: / gang gis yul tha mi dad na yang mig gis gzugs nyid 'dzin gyi de'i yul na gnas na yang ro ni ma yin pa nges par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan cung zad ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: / gang gis yul tha mi dad na yang mig gis gzugs nyid 'dzin gyi de'i yul na gnas na yang ro ni ma yin pa nges par byed pa'i rgyu gzhan cung zad ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúIf the object is not different, why does the eye apprehend just form and not taste, even though it abides in its object?‚Äù There is no other cause whatsoever that ascertains it.

original: yul shin tu ring ba na gnas pa yang ma yin no / rang gi rgyu nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yul shin tu ring ba na gnas pa yang ma yin no / rang gi rgyu nges par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the cause that is determined,

original: 'di ni ma phrad pa'i phyogs la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma phrad pa'i phyogs la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: then that is the same for the position of non-contact.

original: spros pas chog go //
analyzed: spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough of this elaboration!

original: snang ba tha dad blo rnams ni //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad blo rnams ni //
translated: The different cognitions of form,üîΩand so on, are not the same.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas gzhan gyi klan ka dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the opponent raises an objection,

original: ji ltar snang ba tha dad pa'i blo rnams yul gcig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba tha dad pa'i blo rnams yul gcig par 'gyur te /
translated: How can the different cognitions of form, and so on, be the same in their object?üîΩIn that case, the objects of the cognitions of taste, form, and so on, would be the same.

original: de lta na ni ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yang gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni ro dang gzugs la sogs pa'i blo rnams kyi dmigs pa yang gcig tu 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bsam pa'o //
translated: This is the opponent's thought.

original: lan 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: lan 'chad pa ni /
translated: The reply is:

original: phyi rol don smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: phyi rol don smra ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The proponents of external objects say,

original: gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi yul can gyi blo rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs kyi blo ni gzugs kyi yul can gyi blo rnams so //
translated: The cognitions of form are the cognitions that have form as their object.

original: nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gi gsal ba la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ji ltar yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: nye ba dang ring ba la sogs pa'i bye brag gi gsal ba la sogs par snang ba'i phyir ji ltar yul gcig pa nyid du 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'di mtshungs so //
translated: This objection is the same.

original: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba gang dag rnam pa ni yul du gtogs pa nyid yin gyi rnam par shes par gtogs pa ni ma yin par brjod pa dag la klan ka 'di yin gyi /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du smra ba gang dag rnam pa ni yul du gtogs pa nyid yin gyi rnam par shes par gtogs pa ni ma yin par brjod pa dag la klan ka 'di yin gyi /
translated: This objection is for those who assert external objects and say that the aspect belongs to the object but not to consciousness.

original: yang rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag gi ltar na shes pa thams cad yul med pa yin zhing bdag rig pas gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang ldan pa tha dad pa nyid du skye bas de dag la
analyzed: yang rnam par shes par smra ba gang dag yin pa de dag gi ltar na shes pa thams cad yul med pa yin zhing bdag rig pas gsal ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa tha dad pa dang ldan pa tha dad pa nyid du skye bas de dag la
translated: But for those who assert consciousness, all consciousnesses are without objects, and because of the production of self-awareness, which is clear and possesses different aspects such as clarity, etc.,

original: ni klan ka 'di med do //
analyzed: ni klan ka 'di med do //
translated: for them this objection does not exist.

original: yang gang dag phyi rol gyi don yod par smras pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin pa de dag gi ltar na bdag nyid kyi yul dang 'dra bar khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / cha 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa'i blo rnams yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir klan ka med do //üîΩ'o na sgra phrad nas 'dzin pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod la /
analyzed: yang gang dag phyi rol gyi don yod par smras pa shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs yin pa de dag gi ltar na bdag nyid kyi yul dang 'dra bar khas mi len pa'i phyir dang / cha 'ga' zhig gis 'dra ba'i phyir snang ba tha dad pa'i blo rnams yul gcig pa nyid du mi 'gal ba'i phyir klan ka med do // 'o na sgra phrad nas 'dzin pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ci yod la /
translated: Also, according to those who maintain that external objects exist and that consciousness has aspects, there is no fault, because, like the object itself, it is not accepted that the aspects are different from consciousness, and because it is not contradictory that cognitions with different aspects have the same object, since they are similar in some part.üîΩBut what is the valid cognition that refutes the apprehension of sound through contact?

original: ma phrad par 'dzin pa la yang sgrub par byed pa ci yod ces 'dri na /
analyzed: ma phrad par 'dzin pa la yang sgrub par byed pa ci yod ces 'dri na /
translated: And what is the proof for the apprehension of sound without contact?

original: phrad nas 'dzin @185b pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phrad nas 'dzin @185b pa'i phyogs la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúIn the position of apprehension through contact . . .‚Äù

original: rna ba'i nang gi sgra gzhan du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i nang gi sgra gzhan du zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'o //
translated: The example of the dissimilar class is ‚ÄúThe sound in the ear is not like that.‚Äù

original: dper na rna ba 'brug par byed pa'i bya'i gshog pa'i sgra rnam par chad par dmigs pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na rna ba 'brug par byed pa'i bya'i gshog pa'i sgra rnam par chad par dmigs pa de bzhin du /
translated: For example, just as the sound of the wings of a bird flapping in the ear is perceived as intermittent,

original: 'brug la sogs pa'i sgra yang pho long brdab pa'i tshul gyis song nas rna ba'i yul du 'ongs pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'brug la sogs pa'i sgra yang pho long brdab pa'i tshul gyis song nas rna ba'i yul du 'ongs pa nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: The sound of thunder and so on also goes by the manner of a bouncing ball and is apprehended just as it comes into the domain of the ear.

original: mtshungs pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa nyid du 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is apprehended as being the same.

original: rang gi rgyu dang ldan pa dang 'du ba'i yul gyi dbang gis 'di rnam par chad par 'khrul pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyu dang ldan pa dang 'du ba'i yul gyi dbang gis 'di rnam par chad par 'khrul pa yin no zhes kyang brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: It cannot be said that this is a delusion of a division due to the power of its own cause and the object that it is combined with,

original: de dag rna bas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag rna bas mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the ear does not apprehend them.

original: shes pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yul du 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rnam pa sgro btags nas skyed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: shes pa ni 'ga' zhig tu yul du 'gyur ba'i dngos po'i rnam pa sgro btags nas skyed pa ma yin la /
translated: Consciousness is not produced by superimposing the aspect of an entity that becomes an object in some way.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la ro dang 'dra ba sgro 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gzugs la ro dang 'dra ba sgro 'dogs par byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The eye consciousness does not superimpose a form that is like a taste.

original: de'i phyir de ltar phrad nas 'dzin pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phrad nas 'dzin pa la gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma brjod nas /
translated: Therefore, having stated the refutation of the apprehension of an object through contact in that way,

original: ma phrad par 'dzin pa la sgrub par byed pa 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: ma phrad par 'dzin pa la sgrub par byed pa 'chad pa ni /
translated: the explanation of the proof of the apprehension of an object without contact is as follows.

original: de ltar chad do snyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar chad do snyam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is thought that it is cut off, etc.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus means for that reason.

original: reg sogs bzhin du gzhan du min //
analyzed: reg sogs bzhin du gzhan du min //
translated: Like contact, etc., not otherwise.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe ste /
translated: This is an example of dissimilarity.

original: dper na reg pa'i dbang po rnam par 'chad par mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dper na reg pa'i dbang po rnam par 'chad par mi 'dzin pa de bzhin du 'di la yang yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: For example, just as the faculty of contact is not apprehended as cut off, so it is here as well. This is the meaning.

original: gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe bsgrub bya ma tshang ba nyid du dogs pa bsu nas lan 'debs pa yin no //
translated: Beginning with the phrase ‚ÄúAccording to some,‚Äù he responds to the objection that the example is incomplete.

original: 'dir 'od byed pa dang gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa rnams tshad ma byed pa ni mig dang rna ba ni phrad nas 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir 'od byed pa dang gzhon nu ma len la sogs pa rnams tshad ma byed pa ni mig dang rna ba ni phrad nas 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: Here, those who are not authoritative, such as KƒÅ≈õyapƒ´ya and Bhadanta DharmatrƒÅta, say that the eye and ear sense faculties apprehend their objects after coming into contact with them,

original: phyi rol gyi dbang po yin pa'i phyir sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dbang po yin pa'i phyir sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are external sense faculties, like the nose sense faculty, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi dbang po ni nang gi yid kyi dbang pos 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dbang po ni nang gi yid kyi dbang pos 'khrul pa bsal ba'i don du'o //
translated: The external sense faculties are for the purpose of removing confusion about the internal mental sense faculty.

original: de bzhin du dbang po'i don yin pa na chod pa'i don mi dmigs pa'i phyir sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang po'i don yin pa na chod pa'i don mi dmigs pa'i phyir sna la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: Likewise, if it is the object of a sense faculty, it is not perceived as an obstructed object, like the nose faculty, etc.

original: yul bzlog pa'i don du dbang po yin pa na zhes khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: yul bzlog pa'i don du dbang po yin pa na zhes khyad par du byas so //
translated: The sense faculty is specified as the object that turns away from the object.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dag ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra dag ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Likewise, form and sound are apprehended by the sense faculty that apprehends through contact,

original: phyi'i dbang po'i don yin pa'i phyir dri dang ro bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi'i dbang po'i don yin pa'i phyir dri dang ro bzhin no //
translated: because they are external sense objects, like smell and taste.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra'i shes pa dag ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'i yul dmigs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang sgra'i shes pa dag ni phrad nas 'dzin pa'i phyir dbang po'i gzung bar bya ba'i yul dmigs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, the consciousnesses of form and sound are the perceivers of the objects that are apprehended by the sense faculty that apprehends through contact.

original: phyi'i dbang po'i don dmigs par byed pa'i phyir @186a * //
analyzed: phyi'i dbang po'i don dmigs par byed pa'i phyir @186a * //
translated: Because they are the perceivers of external sense objects,

original: dri dang ro'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
analyzed: dri dang ro'i shes pa bzhin no zhe'o //
translated: like the consciousnesses of smell and taste.

original: 'dir sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni gang yang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /üîΩgo sla'o // de lta bas na thos pa la //
analyzed: 'dir sun 'byin pa 'chad pa ni gang yang phyi rol zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste / go sla'o // de lta bas na thos pa la //
translated: Here, the refutation is stated in the line beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is external,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIt is easy to understand.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in the lines beginning with ‚ÄúIf it is heard,‚Äù and so on,

original: ldan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ldan dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúPossession‚Äù and so on.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don drug brtags par ro //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni tshig gi don drug brtags par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù refers to the examination of the six topics.

original: 'o na tha mi dad pa 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na tha mi dad pa 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if they are not different, then how can they be possessed or not possessed?

original: rlung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rlung ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe winds‚Äù and so on.

original: rlung rnams kho na ldan pa dang bral bar skye ba na /
analyzed: rlung rnams kho na ldan pa dang bral bar skye ba na /
translated: When the winds are produced as possessed or not possessed,

original: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba tha mi dad par brjod kyi /
analyzed: ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba tha mi dad par brjod kyi /
translated: possession and separation are said to be nondifferent.

original: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim gyis kyang ldan pa dang bral bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma ma yin pa ni rim gyis kyang ldan pa dang bral bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But it is not reasonable that what is not momentary is possessed or not possessed gradually,

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gcig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have the same nature.

original: rna ba'i nam mkhar phyin pa na //
analyzed: rna ba'i nam mkhar phyin pa na //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen it reaches the space of the ear‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: In response to that,

original: rna ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rna ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚Äúthe ear‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir phyogs gnyis te /üîΩrlung 'di res 'ga' dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: 'dir phyogs gnyis te / rlung 'di res 'ga' dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
translated: Here there are two positions.

original: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig yin grang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rang bzhin du gyur pa zhig yin grang /
translated: Is this wind sometimes the nature of an object of apprehension or is it the nature of a nonobject of apprehension?

original: phyogs dang po la sgra rigs pa'i dus su lug gis bsnun pa bzhin du rlung yang rtogs te dmigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyogs dang po la sgra rigs pa'i dus su lug gis bsnun pa bzhin du rlung yang rtogs te dmigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the first case, just as the sound is perceived, so too the wind would be perceived, like the striking of a sheep.

original: yang ci ste rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir sgra rnam par gsal ba ste /üîΩsgra dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang ci ste rnam par shes pa gnyis cig car bar mi 'byung ba'i phyir sgra rnam par gsal ba ste / sgra dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: But if you think that the sound is perceived because two consciousnesses do not occur simultaneously,üîΩthen the wind would be perceived,

original: rlung de myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rna ba'i ste dmigs pa'i gegs byed pa yin no snyam na /
analyzed: rlung de myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rna ba'i ste dmigs pa'i gegs byed pa yin no snyam na /
translated: just as the wind that is experienced is the obstruction to the object of the ear.

original: 'di ni sgra dmigs pa'i dus na lcag gis bsnun pa dang rlung gzhan myong bar brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni sgra dmigs pa'i dus na lcag gis bsnun pa dang rlung gzhan myong bar brjod par rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable to say that at the time of perceiving the sound, the other wind produced by the fan or the striking of the whip is experienced.

original: ji ltar sgra dmigs pa'i dus na rlung yab la sogs pas byas pa'i rlung gzhan dang lcag gis bsnun pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i rlung gi reg bya yang rigs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sgra dmigs pa'i dus na rlung yab la sogs pas byas pa'i rlung gzhan dang lcag gis bsnun pa nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i rlung gi reg bya yang rigs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as at the time of perceiving the sound, the other wind produced by the fan or the striking of the whip is experienced, so too the tactile object of the wind that reaches the ear would be reasonable.

original: 'dis ni shes pa cig car mi skye bar dam bcas pa la mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni shes pa cig car mi skye bar dam bcas pa la mngon sum dang 'gal bar bshad do //
translated: This explains the contradiction with direct perception of the thesis that consciousness does not arise all at once.

original: myur bar 'byung ba'i stobs kyis cig car 'dzin pa nyid du 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: myur bar 'byung ba'i stobs kyis cig car 'dzin pa nyid du 'khrul pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not a mistake that one apprehends all at once because of the speed of the arising of consciousness.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bstan zin to //
translated: This has already been explained as being absurd.

original: rim gyis 'byung na yang mgyogs pas byas pa'i cig car par 'khrul pa yin la rag mod /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung na yang mgyogs pas byas pa'i cig car par 'khrul pa yin la rag mod /
translated: Even if it arises gradually, it is a mistake to think that it arises all at once because of its speed.

original: de lta na yang 'dir len skabs su nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'dir len skabs su nye bar mi mkho ba'i phyir cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: Even so, it is not the slightest bit necessary to consider this in the context of the refutation of reflexive awareness.üîΩTo demonstrate this, he says,

original: rim gyis 'byung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Even if it arises gradually, etc.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar @186b 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa mgyogs par 'byung ba'i phyir cig car 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya bar @186b 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is a mistake to think that consciousness arises all at once because it arises quickly,

original: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa rnam pa thams cad du ma dmigs pa nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then it would be utterly impossible for it to be the object of perception.

original: 'di ltar 'dir rnam pa thams cad du rim gyis sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir rnam pa thams cad du rim gyis sam /
translated: Thus, here, in every way, it is either gradual orüîΩ

original: cig car gyi rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i rlung ma dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: cig car gyi rna ba'i yul du phyin pa'i rlung ma dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, in this case, the wind that has become the object of the ear is not perceived in any way, either gradually or all at once.

original: de lta bas na mgyogs pas byas pa'i rnam par shes pa la cig car 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni cung zad kyang lan ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mgyogs pas byas pa'i rnam par shes pa la cig car 'khrul pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni cung zad kyang lan ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the claim that the cognition of sound is mistaken with regard to simultaneity is not an answer at all.

original: gsog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gsog yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is just a heap of nonsense.

original: 'dir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa la 'chad do //
analyzed: 'dir ci ste zhes bya ba la sogs pas phyogs gnyis pa la 'chad do //
translated: Here, the second position is explained by the question, ‚ÄúWhat is that?‚Äù

original: gzegs zan pa ni bye brag pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzegs zan pa ni bye brag pa rnams so //
translated: The ‚Äúfollowers of Kanada‚Äù are the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: de dag gi ltar na rlung ni reg pa'i rtags can yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi ltar na rlung ni reg pa'i rtags can yin la /
translated: According to them, wind is characterized by touch.

original: bshad pa byed pa ri khrod pas kyang /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pa ri khrod pas kyang /
translated: The author of the commentary, ƒÄryadeva, also says,

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rlung gi rlung dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba rnams rna bug gi phyogs nas 'byung ba na mi dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i rlung gi rlung dang ldan pa dang rnam par dbye ba rnams rna bug gi phyogs nas 'byung ba na mi dmigs pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe wind that is not directly perceived, which is associated with the wind element, and which is differentiated, is not perceived when it emerges from the direction of the ear.‚Äù

original: 'dir nyes pa bshad pa ni /üîΩde yi reg thobs su yis byas //
analyzed: 'dir nyes pa bshad pa ni / de yi reg thobs su yis byas //
translated: Here, the error in this position is explained by the question,

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúWho has made it so that it is obtained by contact?‚Äù

original: reg pa ni reg bya'o //
analyzed: reg pa ni reg bya'o //
translated: Contact is the tangible object.

original: reg bya thob pa ni reg bya thob par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: reg bya thob pa ni reg bya thob par gyur pa ste /
translated: The attainment of the tangible object is the attainment of the tangible object.

original: myong bar thal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: myong bar thal bar gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is the attainment of the experience of the tangible object.

original: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te /üîΩrlung de reg par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di bshad pa byed pas byas pa de ji ltar /
analyzed: 'di skad du bstan pa yin te / rlung de reg par thal bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa 'di bshad pa byed pas byas pa de ji ltar /
translated: This is what is being taught.üîΩThe explanation of the one who explains the treatise is that the wind that is the cause of the attainment of contact is like this.

original: 'di ltar rlung sgrar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar smra ba'i bslab pa byed pa dag la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rlung sgrar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de ltar smra ba'i bslab pa byed pa dag la /
translated: The one who explains the treatise says that sound is derived from wind.

original: bshad pa byed pa na re sgra rlung las byung ba yin na rlung gi bkod pa'i khyad par yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa byed pa na re sgra rlung las byung ba yin na rlung gi bkod pa'i khyad par yin te /
translated: The one who explains the treatise says that if sound is derived from wind, it is a special arrangement of wind.

original: dper na snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin gyi cha shas bzhin du 'di'i rlung gi cha shas de dag rna sgra la yod par rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: dper na snam bu snal ma'i rang bzhin gyi cha shas bzhin du 'di'i rlung gi cha shas de dag rna sgra la yod par rtogs par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: For example, just as a cloth is a collection of threads, the parts of wind in the ear would be understood to be sound.

original: de lta yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: gal te de lta yin na mthong bas dmigs par 'gyur na sgrar gtogs pa'i rlung gi cha shas rnams ni mthong ba yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na mthong bas dmigs par 'gyur na sgrar gtogs pa'i rlung gi cha shas rnams ni mthong ba yang ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: If that is so, then it would be seen, but the parts of the wind that are included in sound are not seen.

original: dbang po las 'das pa nyid khas blangs na yang skyon gzhan 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: dbang po las 'das pa nyid khas blangs na yang skyon gzhan 'chad pa ni /
translated: If you accept that it is beyond the senses, another error ensues:

original: yang na rlung ni dbang 'das bla //
analyzed: yang na rlung ni dbang 'das bla //
translated: Or else, the wind is beyond the senses,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: rlung de dang ldan pa ni de 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: rlung de dang ldan pa ni de 'brel pa ste /
translated: That which is associated with that wind is connected with it.

original: sa dang chu dang me'i ming can gyi 'byung ba gsum po gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me'i ming can gyi 'byung ba gsum po gang la de yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has the three elements, which are called earth, water, and fire, is so called because it exists in that.

original: der gtogs pa ni der gyur pa ste /
analyzed: der gtogs pa ni der gyur pa ste /
translated: That which belongs to that is that which is transformed into that.

original: de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with that which is based on that.

original: gnyis pa la brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis pa'i bsdu ba yin la /
analyzed: gnyis pa la brten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gnyis pa'i bsdu ba yin la /
translated: In the second line, ‚Äúbased on the second‚Äù and so on, the second is included.

original: de yang reg bya zhes bya ba 'di dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang reg bya zhes bya ba 'di dang gzhi mthun pa yin no //
translated: And that is the common locus of ‚Äútangible object‚Äù and so on.

original: grang ba dang dro ba @187a * //
analyzed: grang ba dang dro ba @187a * //
translated: Cold and heat

original: dang cig shos kyi reg bya de'i rang bzhin rigs pa ste tshor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang cig shos kyi reg bya de'i rang bzhin rigs pa ste tshor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The nature of the touch of the other, i.e., the wind, is the feeling.

original: gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgra las gsal bar byed par mngon par 'dod pa lte ba'i rlung la gnas pa las gzhan bzhin te /
analyzed: gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni sgra las gsal bar byed par mngon par 'dod pa lte ba'i rlung la gnas pa las gzhan bzhin te /
translated: Like the other, i.e., like the wind that is the basis of the desire to manifest sound.

original: drug pa'i mtha' can gyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: drug pa'i mtha' can gyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: The nature of the wind is the sixth, i.e., the touch of wind.

original: dper na dgun gyi dus su kha ba'i tshogs dang 'brel pa'i bu yug gi rlung lta bu dang / yang na ji ltar snga dro'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs 'phros pas phyogs ma lus par khyab par 'jug pa'i so ga'i dus kyi rlung lta bu dang /
analyzed: dper na dgun gyi dus su kha ba'i tshogs dang 'brel pa'i bu yug gi rlung lta bu dang / yang na ji ltar snga dro'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyi tshogs 'phros pas phyogs ma lus par khyab par 'jug pa'i so ga'i dus kyi rlung lta bu dang /
translated: For example, in the winter season, the touch of the wind is cold, in contact with a mass of snow; or, in the spring season, the touch of the wind is warm, pervading all directions with the rays of the morning sun.

original: de bzhin du grang ba dang cig shos ma yin pa'i kha ba'i dus 'jug pa'i rlung gi reg bya grang ba la sogs pa rigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du grang ba dang cig shos ma yin pa'i kha ba'i dus 'jug pa'i rlung gi reg bya grang ba la sogs pa rigs par 'gyur ba de bzhin du 'di yang 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the touch of the wind, cold or not cold, in the season of snow or the other season, is reasonable.

original: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi lan 'debs par byed de /
analyzed: ci ste yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhan gyi lan 'debs par byed de /
translated: If one says that the touch of the wind is not cold in the season of snow, then the author replies:

original: de dang zhes bya ba ni rlung dang ngo //
analyzed: de dang zhes bya ba ni rlung dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAnd‚Äù refers to the wind.

original: mi ldan zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mi ldan zhes bya ba ni ma 'brel pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot connected‚Äù means not related.

original: rna 'brug la zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: rna 'brug la zhes 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúLike an echo‚Äù is the connection.

original: lhag ma ni go bar zad do //üîΩyang na rig byed rjes 'brangs nas //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go bar zad do // yang na rig byed rjes 'brangs nas //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.üîΩOr, as for what was said, ‚ÄúFollowing the Vedas,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: and so on,

original: sun 'byin pa mtshungs pas de'i phyir 'di nyid la bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa mtshungs pas de'i phyir 'di nyid la bsgre bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: the response is the same, so in order to demonstrate this, he says,

original: gang dag nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang dag nam mkha' zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who say that space is the nature of the ear,‚Äù and so on.

original: rna ba cha med pa'i nam mkha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyogs la legs par byas pa don med pa dang legs par byed pa mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon sngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag rna ba ma yin pa'i phyogs la
analyzed: rna ba cha med pa'i nam mkha'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyogs la legs par byas pa don med pa dang legs par byed pa mi 'thad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon sngar bshad pa gang dag yin pa de dag rna ba ma yin pa'i phyogs la
translated: The faults previously explained, such as ‚Äúthe effort is pointless‚Äù and ‚Äúthe effort is untenable,‚Äù and so on, apply to the position that the partless ear has the nature of space.

original: yang mtshungs pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: yang mtshungs pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa logs shig tu brjod par mi bya'o //
translated: Since they are the same, the response should not be stated separately.

original: gal te yang khyab pa dang gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
analyzed: gal te yang khyab pa dang gcig nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa gang smras pa de la /
translated: Moreover, with regard to what you have said, such as ‚Äúpervasion‚Äù and ‚Äúsameness,‚ÄùüîΩin the passage that goes:

original: nam mkha' khyab dang phyogs gcig la //
analyzed: nam mkha' khyab dang phyogs gcig la //
translated: ‚Äúpervasion and one part of space,‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on,

original: gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni legs par ma byas pa la brten pa'o //üîΩcha med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba 'di rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i zhes bya ba ni legs par ma byas pa la brten pa'o // cha med pa la ni rnam par dbye ba 'di rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚Äúother‚Äù refers to that which is not well-formed.

original: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩbrtags pa pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ni don byed pa 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa mi 'gal te /
analyzed: cha shas dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // brtags pa pa'i rnam par dbye ba la ni don byed pa 'jug pa dang mi 'jug pa mi 'gal te /
translated: This division is not tenable for the partless because it would follow that they would have parts.

original: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i don gyi rjes su byed pa ni don byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgro btags pa'i don gyi rjes su byed pa ni don byed pa ma yin te /
translated: In the division of the imputed, there is no contradiction in engaging and not engaging in the performance of a function because the performance of a function does not follow imputed objects.

original: de dag ni dngos po dang 'brel pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po dang 'brel pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are related only to things.

original: de lta yin dang rten gcig la gal te dbang po legs par byas la /
analyzed: de lta yin dang rten gcig la gal te dbang po legs par byas la /
translated: If that is so, then in the case of a single basis, if the sense faculty is well formed,

original: de la yang rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de la yang rtogs par byed pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: it will have the nature of a cognizer.

original: de rten gzhan la de nyid don @187b dam pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du de la legs par byas pa dang rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rten gzhan la de nyid don @187b dam pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad du de la legs par byas pa dang rtogs par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that is the ultimate reality of other things that depend on it, it is well-known and understood everywhere.

original: des na skyes bu'i lus kyi phyogs gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: des na skyes bu'i lus kyi phyogs gcig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa gang yin pa de dag thams cad bsal ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, all that was said, such as ‚Äúin one part of the body of a person,‚Äù is refuted.
